analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu ni //

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu /

analyzed: mchog rnams smos kyang ci zhig dgos //

analyzed: dge ba'i mchog ni bskyed pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //

analyzed: sdig pa nges pa can rnams ni thabs cis kyang mi grol bar dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed par zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: bde gshegs rgyal ba nyid kyis gsungs //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar du ston to //

analyzed: de ltar thabs brgyad ston to //

analyzed: thams cad kyang thabs sla bas grol bar 'gyur ba yin no // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brgya byin la sogs pas bka' stsal pa bden pa nyid du byas nas nor bu dri ma med pa thar te dga' ldan du skyes nas grags pa chen po'i lha dang bcas bas de bzhin gshegs pa la tshe 'di

analyzed: nyid la mchod pa'i phyir sems bskyed de /

analyzed: zhus pa ngo mtshar che'o //

analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang zhus pa /

analyzed: dkon mchog la khyad par can du bsngags nas lta bar 'tshal lo //

analyzed: zhes gsol ba btab nas 'od kyis snying bskul te 'od mi snang bar gyur nas /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen pos dga' ba'i tshal snang bar byas nas /

analyzed: bla ma gnyis ma gtogs pa thams cad g-yos te ngo mtshar che ba'i don zhus pa /

analyzed: khyad par lnga'i mchod pas mchod de mi snang bar gyur te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having made offerings with the five special offerings, he disappeared, it is said.

original: nor bu dri ma med pa dga' ldan du skyes pa bstan to //
analyzed: nor bu dri ma med pa dga' ldan du skyes pa bstan to //
translated: It is explained that the stainless jewel was born in Tushita.

analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang zhes bya ba la sogs nas bag yod bar sgrubs shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis thams cad la phan pa'i phyir rgyud gtad pa bstan /

translated: Thus, the root tantra is taught to be the principal one of the great seal and the tathāgata family of the enjoyment body, and so forth.

analyzed: ci'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud du mdzad ce na /

analyzed: lha thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs dang / phrin las dang / yon tan dang lnga /

analyzed: rtsa bar dang por ston pa dang ldan pas na rtsa ba'i rgyud ces bya'o //

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /

analyzed: gsang ba lnga ldan gang yin pa //

analyzed: dang po nyid du bstan pas na // de ni rtsa ba'i rgyud ces bya //
translated: is taught as the first

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci'i phyir rgyud ces brjod ce na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyud ces brjod ce na //
translated: Why is it called a tantra?

original: rgyud ni rgyun chags zhes bya ste //
analyzed: rgyud ni rgyun chags zhes bya ste //
translated: Tantra is called “continuum”

original: 'khor ba rgyud du 'dod pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pas rgyun chags pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba rgyud du 'dod pa yin // zhes gsungs pas rgyun chags pa'am /

analyzed: 'khor ba'i phyir rgyud ces bya'o //

analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba'i rgyud bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the root tantra,

analyzed: de ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud phyi ma ston te ;
translated: then, beginning with “Then, the Bhagavān entered into the samādhi called ‘The Vajra of the Essence of All Buddhas,’” the continuation of the tantra is taught.

analyzed: ci'i phyir phyi ma zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “continuation”?

analyzed: snga ma las byung zhing de nyid gsung ba spas pa shes pa'i phyir rgyud phyi ma zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because it arose from the previous one and because it teaches the hidden meaning of that, it should be called “continuation of the tantra.”

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, it is as stated:

original: phyi ma snga ma las byung ste //
analyzed: phyi ma snga ma las byung ste //
translated: The continuation arose from the previous one,

original: de nyid gsungs pa sbas shes pa //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa sbas shes pa //
translated: and because it teaches the hidden meaning of that,

original: rgyud ni phyi mar brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rgyud ni phyi mar brjod pa yin //
translated: the tantra is called the continuation.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is stated.

original: 'dis rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma ni dga' ba'i tshal 'di nyid du gsungs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma ni dga' ba'i tshal 'di nyid du gsungs par shes par bya ste /
translated: By this, it should be understood that the continuation of the continuation of the tantra was taught in this very Joyous Grove.

original: mi'i yul du bab pa la sogs pa la khyad par ma bshad pa dang / phyis 'dzam bu gling gi ris 'di nyid na zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mi'i yul du bab pa la sogs pa la khyad par ma bshad pa dang / phyis 'dzam bu gling gi ris 'di nyid na zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement that the Buddha was born in the human realm, etc. does not specify the continent, and the statement that he was born in this southern continent of Jambudvīpa🔽refers to the southern side of Mount Sumeru.

original: ri rab kyi lho phyogs la dgongs pa dang / yang phyis ming dang rjes yi rang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni ;
analyzed: ri rab kyi lho phyogs la dgongs pa dang / yang phyis ming dang rjes yi rang ngo zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni ;
translated: The statement that he later rejoiced in the name and the praise

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yin pas sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa yin pas sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i phyir 'gal ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: is not contradictory, because he possessed the superknowledge of magical power and therefore could see the emanation body.

original: la la dag gnas gang du 'chad pa de dag gis bshad pa'i lung brjod dgos te /
analyzed: la la dag gnas gang du 'chad pa de dag gis bshad pa'i lung brjod dgos te /
translated: Some say that the place where the teaching is expounded must be mentioned in the scriptures.

original: lung med pa kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: lung med pa kho na nyid yin te /
translated: There is no such scripture,

original: de nyid kyis gang nas kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis gang nas kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not mentioned in any scripture.

original: rigs pa ni @255a * //
analyzed: rigs pa ni @255a * //
translated: The reasoning

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i phyir mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: is not valid, because it is too obscure.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, immediately after the first application.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa las phyag na rdo rjes sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa las phyag na rdo rjes sngar bshad pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Here, the concentration of the first application is explained in the root tantra, along with the special qualities explained above by Vajrapani.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Vajrapani,

original: ye shes kyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa phyag gi mthil na gnas pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'am phyag na rdo rje nyid 'dzin pas de skad ces bya ste nges so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rdo rje rtse lnga pa phyag gi mthil na gnas pa bzhin du 'dzin pa'am phyag na rdo rje nyid 'dzin pas de skad ces bya ste nges so //
translated: is so-called because he holds the five-pronged vajra of wisdom as if it were in the palm of his hand, or because he holds Vajrapani himself.

original: 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is what he said is to be supplied.

original: ji ltar gsungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: How did he say it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus zhes bya ba gsungs te sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus zhes bya ba gsungs te sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis so //
translated: It is said through the power of the Blessed One, that is, through the Buddha's blessing.

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What did he say?

original: brtag pa'i rgyal po phyi ma 'di //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brtag pa'i rgyal po phyi ma 'di //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is the later king of treatises,

original: brtag pa'i rgyal po pha rol tu phyin pa drug byang chub kyi sems dang bcas ba yin la de ston ba la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: brtag pa'i rgyal po pha rol tu phyin pa drug byang chub kyi sems dang bcas ba yin la de ston ba la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light, is so called because it teaches the six perfections and the thought of awakening.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems can kun gyi don bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to benefit all sentient beings,

original: byang chub tu ni sems bskyed nas //
analyzed: byang chub tu ni sems bskyed nas //
translated: having generated the thought of awakening,🔽I will practice the six perfections

original: pha rol phyin drug spyod bdag / brtan pa rtogs pa nyid yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol phyin drug spyod bdag / brtan pa rtogs pa nyid yin no // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and be steadfast in realization.

original: brtag pa phyi ma 'di zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa 'di lta bu 'di'o //
analyzed: brtag pa phyi ma 'di zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa 'di lta bu 'di'o //
translated: This later analysis is like the one explained above.

original: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus bka' stsal to //
translated: It is said means that it was spoken by the power of the Buddha.

original: 'dis ni phyag na rdo rje bshad bas /
analyzed: 'dis ni phyag na rdo rje bshad bas /
translated: This shows that because it was explained by Vajrapani,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsungs pa'i phyir bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis gsungs pa'i phyir bka' nyid du rnam par gzhag pa gsungs so //
translated: it is established as the word of the Buddha because it was spoken by the Tathagata himself.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi bsam ba la dgongs nas de skad ces bshad kyis don la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi bsam ba la dgongs nas de skad ces bshad kyis don la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It was explained in that way with the intention of the disciples' thoughts, but in reality there is no difference.

original: dpa' bo gdan la bzhengs nas kyang //
analyzed: dpa' bo gdan la bzhengs nas kyang //
translated: The hero, having risen from his seat,

original: dgyes shing rdo rje gsor nas ni //
analyzed: dgyes shing rdo rje gsor nas ni //
translated: Being pleased and brandishing the vajra,

original: sh'akya'i bdag po dgyes mdzad pa //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bdag po dgyes mdzad pa //
translated: the Lord of the Śākyas, the gladdener,

original: thub pa'i gtso la phyag btsal nas //
analyzed: thub pa'i gtso la phyag btsal nas //
translated: having bowed to the chief of sages,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i dpa' bo gtso bo la gus pas zla ba dang padma'i gdan rang dang 'tsham pa las bzhengs nas byin gyis brlabs pas dgyes shing bgegs zhi ba dang / bar chod kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bsor nas kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i dpa' bo gtso bo la gus pas zla ba dang padma'i gdan rang dang 'tsham pa las bzhengs nas byin gyis brlabs pas dgyes shing bgegs zhi ba dang / bar chod kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje bsor nas kyang /
translated: This means that having arisen from the moon and lotus seats suitable for oneself, with respect for the chief of nondual heroes, being pleased by the consecration, and in order to pacify obstacles and to not be overcome by obstructions, brandishing the vajra,

original: sh'akya'i bdag po sems can gyi don la dgyes par mdzad pa thub pa'i gtsol phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sh'akya'i bdag po sems can gyi don la dgyes par mdzad pa thub pa'i gtsol phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: having bowed to the chief of sages, the Lord of the Śākyas, who delights in the welfare of sentient beings, is the meaning of this.

original: 'dis ni gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis kyang bgegs zhi bar byas nas gnang ba thob nas 'jug pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis kyang bgegs zhi bar byas nas gnang ba thob nas 'jug pa bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that even those who practice the conduct of the door of mantra should pacify obstacles, obtain permission, and then engage.

original: sgrib pa thams @255b cad rnam par dag pa rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad de mchod pa'i sgrib ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams @255b cad rnam par dag pa rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa thams cad de mchod pa'i sgrib ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having entered the meditative absorption called “the vajra of the purification of all obscurations” means that all obscurations are the obscurations of worship, and so forth.

original: rnam par dag pa rdo rje zhes bya ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rdo rje zhes bya ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The vajra of purification is the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya la /
translated: The meditative absorption that focuses on that is called that.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa ste /
translated: Entering into meditative absorption in that is actualizing it.

original: de lta bur gyur nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that having become like that.

original: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgom pas zla ba'i dbus su thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du zhugs nas gtso bo bskyed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog bsgom pas zla ba'i dbus su thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid du zhugs nas gtso bo bskyed de /
translated: This teaches that having entered into the middle of the moon through the cultivation of the supreme king of maṇḍalas, the nature of method and wisdom, the principal one is generated.

original: phyag rgya brjod pa dang sngags brjod pa dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya brjod pa dang sngags brjod pa dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that the recitation of the mudra and the recitation of the mantra are included.

original: ngan song thams cad rnam par sbyong ba'i rang gi snying bo'i 'di thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan song thams cad rnam par sbyong ba'i rang gi snying bo'i 'di thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This essence of mine, which purifies all evil destinies, has been brought forth from my heart.

original: ngan song thams cad rnam par sbyong ba ni 'dir gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad rnam par sbyong ba ni 'dir gtsug tor ro //
translated: Here, purifies all evil destinies is the uṣṇīṣa.

original: rang gi snying bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na bskyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na bskyed pa la bya'o //
translated: The essence of mine is the generation of that very [uṣṇīṣ].

original: 'di nyid kyi thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang bzhin 'og nas 'byung ba 'di nyid kyi thugs nges pa can ye shes las bton zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rang bzhin 'og nas 'byung ba 'di nyid kyi thugs nges pa can ye shes las bton zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has been brought forth from my heart means that this very mantra, which has the nature of sound and will be stated below, has been brought forth from the mind of the Teacher, meaning has been extracted from the wisdom of the mind.

original: 'dis ni sgom pa bo rnams kyis gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba la sngags bkod de 'khor thams cad bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgom pa bo rnams kyis gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba la sngags bkod de 'khor thams cad bskyed do //
translated: By this, all the retinue is generated, having arranged the mantra on the moon in the heart of the principal one, by the meditators.

original: ston pa'i sngags nyid badzra h'um phat ces bya ba ni rdo rje gtsug gi'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i sngags nyid badzra h'um phat ces bya ba ni rdo rje gtsug gi'o //
translated: The mantra of the Teacher himself is vajra hūṃ phaṭ, which is the mantra of the uṣṇīṣa.

original: aom sarbba p'a pam da ha na badzra h'um phat ces bya ba nas brtsams nas ;
analyzed: aom sarbba p'a pam da ha na badzra h'um phat ces bya ba nas brtsams nas ;
translated: Beginning with oṃ sarva pāpaṃ dahana vajra hūṃ phaṭ,

original: aom ma te sarbba tirya ka ga ti he h'um phat ces bya ba bco lngas bteg pa'i sngags ston to //
analyzed: aom ma te sarbba tirya ka ga ti he h'um phat ces bya ba bco lngas bteg pa'i sngags ston to //
translated: The mantra Om mate sarva tiryaṅga gati he hūṃ phaṭ is taught by the fifteen.

original: de nas de dag gi yo byad rnams bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi yo byad rnams bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the requisites of those are explained.

original: de dag gi zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The those are the deities of the maṇḍala.

original: yo byad rnams zhes pa gsol ka ba dang bran la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yo byad rnams zhes pa gsol ka ba dang bran la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The requisites are the servants, messengers, and so on.

original: bshad do zhes bya ba bzlas pa'i sngags rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya ba bzlas pa'i sngags rnams gsungs so //
translated: The explained are the mantra recitations.

original: de nyid aom sarbba aa ba ya zhes bya ba nas h'um phat ces bya bas ston to //
analyzed: de nyid aom sarbba aa ba ya zhes bya ba nas h'um phat ces bya bas ston to //
translated: That itself is taught by Om sarva avāya up to hūṃ phaṭ.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams bskyed pa ni /
translated: The generation of the deities of the maṇḍala

original: rgyud gzhan dang 'di nyid kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / phyi ma'i bde ba chen bo'i bshad pa las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dang 'di nyid kyi rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / phyi ma'i bde ba chen bo'i bshad pa las shes par bya ste /
translated: should be understood from other tantras, this very root tantra, and the explanation of the later Hevajra.

original: ra tontta ma tram padmotta ma hr'i:/
analyzed: ra tontta ma tram padmotta ma hr'i:/
translated: Ratonttamatraṃ padmottamahrīḥ,

original: bi shotta aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: bi shotta aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: viśottā a, and so on.

original: na mo bha ga wa te sarbba du rga ti zhes bya ba la sogs ba rtsa ba'i rig pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: na mo bha ga wa te sarbba du rga ti zhes bya ba la sogs ba rtsa ba'i rig pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Namo bhagavate sarva-duḥkha-cchitāyai and so on, together with the root vidyā.

original: des ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: This teaches the following:

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom po rnams kyis ni sh'akya thub pa'i thugs kar thun mong dang khyad par gyi sngags bkod de /🔽rdo rje gtsug @256a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom po rnams kyis ni sh'akya thub pa'i thugs kar thun mong dang khyad par gyi sngags bkod de / rdo rje gtsug @256a * //
translated: Those who meditate on the supreme royal maṇḍala arrange the ordinary and special mantras in the heart of Śākyamuni.

original: tor nas brtsams nas rdo rje dril bu'i bar du bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tor nas brtsams nas rdo rje dril bu'i bar du bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Beginning from the vajra uṣṇīṣa up to the vajra bell, they generate. This is the meaning.

original: sbrul pa'i dus su mthong ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi smon lam dang thugs rje'i mthus ji ltar 'dod pa ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sbrul pa'i dus su mthong ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi smon lam dang thugs rje'i mthus ji ltar 'dod pa ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: At the time of emanation, for those who are fortunate enough to see, the deities of the maṇḍala appear as desired by the power of their aspirations and compassion.

original: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa sngon du 'gro ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa sngon du 'gro ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with the dissolution and consecration,

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: the supreme king of actions should be understood as before.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan zin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum bstan zin to //
translated: The three types of samādhi have been explained.

original: thabs de la 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs de la 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pas 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of “one should enter into that method by obtaining initiation and the commitments in this very life,”

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga ston to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga ston to //
translated: the ritual of the master’s actions and the disciple’s entry, etc. are taught by “then,” etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du bsnyen pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du bsnyen pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: “ Then” means immediately after the prior service.

original: gzhan yang sa bzung ba dang lhag par gnas pa dang bcas pa yang de nas zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang sa bzung ba dang lhag par gnas pa dang bcas pa yang de nas zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: Moreover, the selection of the site and the consecration are also taught by “then.”

original: dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba ni thig gdab pa dang rdul tshon bri ba'i gzugs can gyi dkyil 'khor bshad ces bya ba'i don to //🔽'khor lo 'dra ba'i dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba ni thig gdab pa dang rdul tshon bri ba'i gzugs can gyi dkyil 'khor bshad ces bya ba'i don to // 'khor lo 'dra ba'i dkyil 'khor la //
translated: “ Having explained the maṇḍala” means “having explained the maṇḍala that has the form of the layout and the drawing of the colored powder.”

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi gnas gru bzhi pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi gnas gru bzhi pa /
translated: “ The maṇḍala that is like a wheel” is the site of the maṇḍala that has four sides.

original: sgo bzhi pa rta babs dang bcas pa kha khyer dang ldan pa la sogs pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor byas la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgo bzhi pa rta babs dang bcas pa kha khyer dang ldan pa la sogs pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor byas la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should make an outer maṇḍala with four gates and arches, a parapet, and so forth.

original: 'dis ni / dkyil 'khor la ni 'khor lo bshad //
analyzed: 'dis ni / dkyil 'khor la ni 'khor lo bshad //
translated: By this, the statement “The maṇḍala is explained as the wheel”

original: ces bya ba legs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba legs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is well taken.

original: de'i nang du ji ltar bri zhe na /
analyzed: de'i nang du ji ltar bri zhe na /
translated: What should be drawn inside that?🔽It is said:

original: shin tu mdzes pa'i rtsibs brgyad can //
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa'i rtsibs brgyad can //
translated: With eight very beautiful spokes,

original: lte bar bcas shing rtsibs rten can //
analyzed: lte bar bcas shing rtsibs rten can //
translated: with a hub, and with a rim.

original: nang gi rim ba bris nas ni //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi rim ba bris nas ni // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Having drawn the inner circle,🔽one should draw the outer circle.

original: rtsibs brgyad dang ldan pa dang lte ba dang rtsibs rten dang sum rim du bris nas rdo rje phreng bas yongs su bskor ba bri zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsibs brgyad dang ldan pa dang lte ba dang rtsibs rten dang sum rim du bris nas rdo rje phreng bas yongs su bskor ba bri zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should draw the eight spokes, the hub, the rim, and the three circles, and completely surround it with a vajra garland.

original: de'i nang du ci zhig dgod ce na /🔽lte ba'i nang du sh'akya yi //
analyzed: de'i nang du ci zhig dgod ce na / lte ba'i nang du sh'akya yi //
translated: What should be placed inside that?🔽It is said:🔽In the center, one should draw the Śākya

original: dpang po thub pa bri bar bya //

original: phyag 'tshal ba yi phyag rgyar bshad //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba yi phyag rgyar bshad //
translated: have explained this as the mudrā of homage.

original: ces bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang @258a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang @258a * //
translated: This is taught as the mudrā of homage of the tathāgata family.🔽With the palms joined at the throat,

original: ldan pas dpral bar thal mo sbyar zhing phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul du byas na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi phyag 'tshal ba'i phyag rgyar bshad ces bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: ldan pas dpral bar thal mo sbyar zhing phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul du byas na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rnams kyi phyag 'tshal ba'i phyag rgyar bshad ces bya bar bstan to //
translated: in the manner of bowing down,🔽the buddhas, the sugatas, the born ones,🔽have explained this as the mudrā of homage.

original: rnal 'byor rigs pas mgrin phyogs su //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rigs pas mgrin phyogs su //
translated: This is taught as the mudrā of homage of the vajra family.

original: thal mo snying gar sbyar ba ni //🔽rtag tu padma'i rigs nyid du //
analyzed: thal mo snying gar sbyar ba ni // rtag tu padma'i rigs nyid du //
translated: With the palms joined at the heart,🔽in the manner of bowing down,🔽the buddhas, the sugatas, the born ones,🔽have explained this as the mudrā of homage.🔽This is taught as the mudrā of homage of the lotus family.🔽With the palms joined at the navel,🔽in the manner of bowing down,🔽the buddhas, the sugatas, the born ones,🔽have explained this as the mudrā of homage.

original: padma'i phyag rgya yin par bshad //
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgya yin par bshad //
translated: This is taught as the mudrā of homage of the action family.

original: ces bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mgrin pa'i phyogs snying gar thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal na padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mgrin pa'i phyogs snying gar thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal na padma'i rigs kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the seal of the lotus family, if you join the palms at the heart level in the direction of the throat and bow with the yoga of the deity.

original: rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo sbyar nas kyang //
translated: And also the vajra palms joined,

original: snying gar gung mo thal sbyar ba //
analyzed: snying gar gung mo thal sbyar ba //
translated: the middle fingers joined at the heart,

original: rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya 'di ;
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya 'di ;
translated: this is the seal of the vajra family,

original: / dam tshig thams cad 'dzin byed pa'o //
analyzed: / dam tshig thams cad 'dzin byed pa'o //
translated: which holds all the commitments.

original: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar nas snying gar gung mo'i rtse mo sbyar ba dang phyag 'tshal ba na rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar nas snying gar gung mo'i rtse mo sbyar ba dang phyag 'tshal ba na rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig thams cad 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you join the palms and touch the tips of the middle fingers at the heart and bow, you will hold all the commitments of the vajra family.

original: 'di rnams kyi rigs su nges par aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'a da bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya bas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi rigs su nges par aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'a da bandha nam ka ro mi zhes bya bas phyag 'tshal bar bya'o //
translated: To ascertain the family of these, you should bow with Oṃ sarva tathāgata vāca vajra karomi.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur g-yon pas thal mor byas la gan rkyal du gzhag pa de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste mthe bong gnyis sprad la zhi ba'i lta bas blta ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur g-yon pas thal mor byas la gan rkyal du gzhag pa de'i steng du g-yas pa bzhag ste mthe bong gnyis sprad la zhi ba'i lta bas blta ba 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi ste /
translated: Moreover, the mudra of the Tathagata lineage is to make a fist with the left hand and place it on the chest, and to place the right hand on top of it, with the two thumbs touching and looking with a peaceful gaze.

original: kun rig dang ngan song sbyong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya ste dam tshig yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya nyid dam tshig ste mi 'da' bar byed pas so //
analyzed: kun rig dang ngan song sbyong ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya ste dam tshig yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i phyag rgya nyid dam tshig ste mi 'da' bar byed pas so //
translated: This is the mudra of the samadhi of the Tathagata lineage, which is explained to be the pledge of the Tathagata lineage.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis kyang //
translated: Even all the Tathagatas

original: 'da' bar ru ni mi mdzad pas //
analyzed: 'da' bar ru ni mi mdzad pas //
translated: Do not transgress it,

original: phyag rgya dam tshig ces su bsgrags //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya dam tshig ces su bsgrags // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the mudra is proclaimed as the pledge.

original: de nyid las bzlog ste /
analyzed: de nyid las bzlog ste /
translated: Because it causes one to not transgress.🔽The opposite of that is the pledge of the lotus lineage.

original: lta 'og bsnol la mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis gcig la gcig lu gu rgyud kyi tshul du bsnol la snying gar gzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya la rdo rje 'dzin ma dpal gyi padma lta bur bya ba ste
analyzed: lta 'og bsnol la mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis gcig la gcig lu gu rgyud kyi tshul du bsnol la snying gar gzhag pa 'di ni rdo rje rigs kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya zhes bya la rdo rje 'dzin ma dpal gyi padma lta bur bya ba ste
translated: The pledge seal of the vajra family is called “vajra-holding,” and is like the glorious lotus of the Buddha.

original: dam tshig thob par byed pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig thob par byed pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the seal that causes one to attain the pledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya yin no //🔽thal mo rdzogs par sbyar ba las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnyams la lhag ma brkyang pa'i 'di ni padma'i rigs kyi padma'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya yin no // thal mo rdzogs par sbyar ba las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis bsnyams la lhag ma brkyang pa'i 'di ni padma'i rigs kyi padma'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: It is also the entrance seal of the Tathāgata family.🔽The lotus seal of the lotus family is formed from the complete añjali gesture with the thumbs and little fingers joined and the remaining fingers extended.

original: rdo re bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rje 'dra bar bsnyams la mthe bong mthe chung gnyis @258b brkyang ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rdo re bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rje 'dra bar bsnyams la mthe bong mthe chung gnyis @258b brkyang ba 'di ni /
translated: The seal of the jewel family is formed from the vajra binding with the two middle fingers joined like a vajra and the thumbs and little fingers extended.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba rdo rje gtsug tor dang rdo rje sems dpa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //🔽de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis de bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba rdo rje gtsug tor dang rdo rje sems dpa'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o // de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe'u chung gnyis de bzhin du byas la /
translated: The mudra of Vajrapani means the pledge mudra of Vajracrista and Vajrasattva.

original: mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag padmo 'dra bar bkug pa ni ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag padmo 'dra bar bkug pa ni ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], the thumbs and little fingers are done likewise, and the two index fingers and ring fingers are bent like a lotus; this is the mudra of Thorough Purification of All Evil Destinies.  This is the pledge mudra.

original: de nyid las mdzub mo dang srin lag gnyis rin po cher byas pa ni dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni rin chen tog dang / dbang bskur ba ste rdo rje gdams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo dang srin lag gnyis rin po cher byas pa ni dbang bskur ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni rin chen tog dang / dbang bskur ba ste rdo rje gdams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], the index finger and ring finger are made into a jewel; this is the consecration mudra.  This is the jewel crest and consecration, which arise from the vajra advice.

original: mthe'u chung dang mthe bong so sor bsnyams la lhag ma rnams brkyang ba 'di ni sdig pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i sngon du'o //
analyzed: mthe'u chung dang mthe bong so sor bsnyams la lhag ma rnams brkyang ba 'di ni sdig pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa'i sngon du'o //
translated: This is the mudra for burning all sins.

original: lag pa g-yon ba de bzhin du bskor zhing zhes bya ba 'di ni las thams cad pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro sbyang ba la sogs pa kun gyi ste snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon ba de bzhin du bskor zhing zhes bya ba 'di ni las thams cad pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni ngan 'gro sbyang ba la sogs pa kun gyi ste snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the mudra for all activities.🔽This is the mudra for incense.

original: snyim pa bzed pa gyen du 'thor bar byed pa 'di ni bdug pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snyim pa 'og nas gyen du 'thor ba dang / bsnyams te 'dzin pa dang / dung dang 'dra bar bya ba dang bzhi ni bdug pa ma la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: snyim pa bzed pa gyen du 'thor bar byed pa 'di ni bdug pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la snyim pa 'og nas gyen du 'thor ba dang / bsnyams te 'dzin pa dang / dung dang 'dra bar bya ba dang bzhi ni bdug pa ma la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The four—the cupped hands facing upward, the cupped hands facing downward, the cupped hands held level, and the cupped hands like a conch—are for Māmakī and so forth.

original: de nyid las brkyang ste 'dzin pa ni gtor ma'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du gtor ma sbyin pa'i tshe rdo rje thal mo brkyang ba sbyin no //
analyzed: de nyid las brkyang ste 'dzin pa ni gtor ma'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni phyi rol du gtor ma sbyin pa'i tshe rdo rje thal mo brkyang ba sbyin no //
translated: The same, extended and held out, is the bali mudra, which means that when giving the bali externally, one gives with the extended vajra-folded palms.

original: de nyid las gung mo nang du bkug pa ni aargha'i'o zhes bya ba ni mchod yon gyi'o //🔽da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ston te rdo rje bcings pa las gung mo gnyis bsnyams te tshigs dang po bcag la sor mo thams cad brkyang ba 'di ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba gtsug tor rnon pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las gung mo nang du bkug pa ni aargha'i'o zhes bya ba ni mchod yon gyi'o // da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya ston te rdo rje bcings pa las gung mo gnyis bsnyams te tshigs dang po bcag la sor mo thams cad brkyang ba 'di ni rnam par 'thor ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba gtsug tor rnon pa'i'o //
translated: The same, with the middle fingers folded in, is the argha mudra, which is for the offering of water.🔽Now the pledges are taught. From the vajra bond, the two middle fingers are joined, the first joint is bent, and all the fingers are extended. This is the scattering mudra, which is for the ushnisha Tsha-tsha.

original: de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe chung gnyis bkug pa ni rnam par 'joms pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mthe bong dang mthe chung gnyis bkug pa ni rnam par 'joms pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
translated: The same, with the thumbs and little fingers folded in, is the vidhi mudra, which is for the ushnisha Dhvaja.

original: de nyid las 'od zer 'bar ba 'dra ba ni gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba gtsug tor gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'od zer 'bar ba 'dra ba ni gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba gtsug tor gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: The same, with the fingers like blazing light rays, is the Tejorasi mudra, which is for the ushnisha Tejas.

original: de nyid las spyi bor bskor ba gdugs dkar rgya zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor gdugs dkar po'i'o //🔽rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis gnyis bsnol la mdud pa gyen du bsnol ba 'di ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'i zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor sbrul ba'i @259a * //
analyzed: de nyid las spyi bor bskor ba gdugs dkar rgya zhes bya ba ni gtsug tor gdugs dkar po'i'o // rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mdzub mo gnyis dang mthe'u chung gnyis gnyis bsnol la mdud pa gyen du bsnol ba 'di ni 'khor lo'i phyag rgya'i zhes bya ba dkyil 'khor sbrul ba'i @259a * //
translated: From that, circling it above the head is called the “great white parasol,” which is the uṣṇīṣa white parasol.🔽From the two vajra fists, the two index fingers and two little fingers are crossed, and the knots are crossed upward. This is the “wheel mudrā,” which is the mudrā for emanating the maṇḍala.

original: phyag rgya'o // rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rjer byas pa ni mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas la lhag ma rnams 'od zer 'bar bar byas ba ni rgyal ba'i gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'o // rdo rje bsdams pa las gung mo gnyis rdo rjer byas pa ni mdzub mo gnyis rin po che ltar byas la lhag ma rnams 'od zer 'bar bar byas ba ni rgyal ba'i gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: From the vajra-binding, the two middle fingers are made into a vajra, the two index fingers are made like a jewel, and the remaining ones are made into blazing light rays, which is the mudrā of Jayoṣṇīṣa.

original: rin chen zhes bya ba rin chen gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rin chen zhes bya ba rin chen gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: “Jewel” is the mudrā of Ratnoṣṇīṣa.

original: de bzhin du mdzub mo gnyis rdo rjer byas la sor mo lhag ma rnams bsdams nas rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdzub mo gnyis rdo rjer byas la sor mo lhag ma rnams bsdams nas rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa ni rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs gtsug tor gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Likewise, with two fingers in the vajra [position], the remaining fingers bound and made like a vajra, is the mudra of Vijaya.

original: g-yas ba mchog sbyin du byas la g-yon pa mi 'jigs pas sbyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yin no zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kyi'o //
analyzed: g-yas ba mchog sbyin du byas la g-yon pa mi 'jigs pas sbyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yin no zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kyi'o //
translated: The right [hand] is made into the gesture of giving gifts, and the left is made into the gesture of giving fearlessness. This is the mudra of the Tathagata.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa 'di ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa las mdzub mo gnyis brkyang ste rdo rje 'dra bar byas pa 'di ni rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From the vajra bond, the two index fingers are extended and made like a vajra. This is the vajra mudra.

original: de nyid las mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug pa 'di ni lcags kyu'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo g-yas pa bkug pa 'di ni lcags kyu'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], the right index finger is bent. This is the hook mudra.

original: de nyid las me tog 'dra bar byas la 'di ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las me tog 'dra bar byas la 'di ni mda'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], it is made like a flower. This is the arrow mudra.

original: de nyid las slar bkug ste mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad pa ni blo gros legs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las slar bkug ste mthe bong gnyis rtse sprad pa ni blo gros legs pa'o //
translated: From that very [mudra], it is bent back and the two thumbs are brought together. This is the excellent wisdom [mudra].

original: de nyid las tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni rin po che'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni rin po che'i'o //
translated: The same, but without breaking the joints, is the jewel.

original: de nyid las sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar skyed pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las sor mo rnams 'od zer 'dra bar skyed pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: The same, but with the fingers like rays, is the splendor.

original: de nyid las spyi bor gzhag pa ni tog gi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las spyi bor gzhag pa ni tog gi'o //
translated: The same, but placed on the crown of the head, is the crest.

original: de las mdun du gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
analyzed: de las mdun du gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
translated: The same, but placed in front, is the smile.

original: de nyid las padmo 'dra bar byas pa ni padma'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las padmo 'dra bar byas pa ni padma'i'o //
translated: The same, but made like a lotus, is the lotus.

original: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis bkug pa ni ral gri'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis bkug pa ni ral gri'i'o //
translated: The same, but with the tips bent, is the sword.

original: de nyid las gdu bu 'dra bar byas pa ni 'khor lo'i'o //🔽de nyid las yid tsam padma 'dra bar byas pa ni lce'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las gdu bu 'dra bar byas pa ni 'khor lo'i'o // de nyid las yid tsam padma 'dra bar byas pa ni lce'i'o //
translated: The same, but made like a bracelet, is the wheel.🔽The same, but made like a mere lotus, is the tongue.

original: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam skyed pa ni rgya gram gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo yid tsam skyed pa ni rgya gram gyi'o //
translated: The same, but with the tips slightly extended, is the cross.

original: de nyid las shin tu bskyed pa ni srung ba'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid las shin tu bskyed pa ni srung ba'i'o //
translated: The same, but with the tips fully extended, is the protection.

original: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis slar bkug pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las rtse mo gnyis slar bkug pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
translated: The same, but with the tips bent back, is the yakṣa.

original: dam du bkug pa ni bsdams pa'o zhes bya ba rnams ni rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje khu tshur gyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: dam du bkug pa ni bsdams pa'o zhes bya ba rnams ni rdo rje sems dpa' nas rdo rje khu tshur gyi mthar thug pa'i bar gyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: These are the pledge seals of Vajrasattva through Vajra Fist.

original: bsdams pa nyid mdun du gzhag pa ni bdug pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsdams pa nyid mdun du gzhag pa ni bdug pa'i'o //
translated: The binding itself placed in front is the incense seal.

original: de nyid la gyen du stod pa ni phreng ba'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gyen du stod pa ni phreng ba'i'o //
translated: The binding itself raised upward is the garland seal.

original: mdun du mthe bong bsnyams te bskor ba ni mar me'i'o //
analyzed: mdun du mthe bong bsnyams te bskor ba ni mar me'i'o //
translated: Circling the thumbs in front is the lamp seal.🔽 That itself made like anointing is the perfume seal.

original: de nyid byug pa ltar byas pa ni dri'o zhes bya ba bdug pa la sogs pa bzhi'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid byug pa ltar byas pa ni dri'o zhes bya ba bdug pa la sogs pa bzhi'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: These are the pledge seals of the four, incense and so forth.

original: sngar bshad pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis bkug pa ni lcags kyu'i'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o // de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis bkug pa ni lcags kyu'i'o //
translated: The above were the action seals.🔽From that itself, the two index fingers folded in is the hook seal.

original: de nyid @259b las rtse mo gnyis sprad pa ni zhags pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid @259b las rtse mo gnyis sprad pa ni zhags pa'i'o //
translated: That itself with the two tips joined is the noose seal.

original: de nyid las gcig la gcig 'khyud pa ni lcags sgrog gi'o //
analyzed: de nyid las gcig la gcig 'khyud pa ni lcags sgrog gi'o //
translated: That itself with one embracing the other is the fetter seal.

original: de nyid las bskyod pa ni mnyes pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni sgo bzhi'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste las kyi phyag rgya ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las bskyod pa ni mnyes pa'i'o zhes bya ba ni sgo bzhi'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste las kyi phyag rgya ni sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du shes bar bya'o //
translated: This is the pledge seal of the four doors. The action seal should be understood from the root tantra above.

original: sku gzugs kyi cho ga yang 'di ni de bzhin byas te zhes bya bas ras ris kyi sgrub pa ston to //
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi cho ga yang 'di ni de bzhin byas te zhes bya bas ras ris kyi sgrub pa ston to //

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rgyal nyid cung zad na ni don yin no //

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje la las kyi rnam par smin pa ci yis nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od de dmyal ba la sogs pa der lhung zhes dris pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthus phyag na rdo rjes bka' stsal pa dang bshad pa ni 'di yin te /

translated: Then, Vajrapani asked, “By what karma did the stainless light of the jewel fall into the hells and so on?”

original: 'di ni sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pa 'di yin te 'dzam bu'i gling gi rigs 'di nyid na mtha' khob pa rigs ngan du gtogs pa'i rgyal po lus mi bde ba zhes bya ba zhig tu gyur te zhes bya ba'i la sogs pa smos te sngon gyi zhes
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pa 'di yin te 'dzam bu'i gling gi rigs 'di nyid na mtha' khob pa rigs ngan du gtogs pa'i rgyal po lus mi bde ba zhes bya ba zhig tu gyur te zhes bya ba'i la sogs pa smos te sngon gyi zhes
translated: By the power of the Buddha, Vajrapani replied, “This is the karmic obscuration of the past. In this very Jambudvipa, in a border region, he was a king of low caste named Duhśāsana.”

original: bya ba rdzogs ldan gyi dus na'o //
analyzed: bya ba rdzogs ldan gyi dus na'o //
translated: “In the past” means in the age of completeness.

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi rigs 'di nyid na zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi lho phyogs gling bzhi pa'i rigs 'di nyid na'o //
translated: “In this very Jambudvipa” means in this very continent of the four continents to the south of Mount Meru.

original: rgyal po lus mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni btsun mo dam pa mdzes ldan ma'i khong du gnas tsam nyid na @260a * //
analyzed: rgyal po lus mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni btsun mo dam pa mdzes ldan ma'i khong du gnas tsam nyid na @260a * //
translated: “King Duhśāsana” means that while he was merely dwelling in the womb of the excellent queen Sundari,

original: lus mi bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus mi bde ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body is uncomfortable.🔽The rest is easy to understand, so it is not explained.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas ma bshad de 'dis kyang nor bu dri ma med pa de nyid kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa dang zhus pa bstan pa'i phyir /

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du lha'i bu nor bu dri ma med pa'i don du zhu ba ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //🔽da ni tshe tshad med pa'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa'i padma'i rigs bshad pa'i rjes thogs la /

translated: In Jambudvipa, the request of the god son Stainless Jewel is not connected.🔽Now, after explaining the maṇḍala of immeasurable life, the lotus family is explained.

original: bshad pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe tshad med pa'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
analyzed: bshad pa de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshe tshad med pa'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
translated: The explanation begins with Then and so on, showing the maṇḍala of immeasurable life.

original: gzhan yang de nas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nas zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then means after the first application.

original: 'dir dang po'i ting nge 'dzin ni gtsug tor du bshad pa nyid dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i ting nge 'dzin ni gtsug tor du bshad pa nyid dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the first samādhi should be understood as explained in the uṣṇīṣa.

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis bos nas bstod de gsol ba btab bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis bos nas bstod de gsol ba btab bo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The sons of the gods such as Śakra and Brahmā, having called out, praised, and made requests, is to be supplied.

original: tshul ji lta bu dang ldan pas she na /
analyzed: tshul ji lta bu dang ldan pas she na /

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i bu rnams yid rab tu mgu zhing rangs te ba spu'i bu gnas sbu rnams langs shing rgyal ba rgyal ba zhes skad chen pos bos nas so //

translated: The sons of the gods such as Śakra and Brahmā, with extremely delighted and pleased minds, with the hairs of their bodies standing on end, having called out with a loud voice, “Victory, victory!”

original: lha'i bu rnams zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pa sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i brgya byin la sogs pa nyid ston to //

translated: The sons of the gods are Śakra and so forth, who have attained the factors conducive to penetration, and are endowed with the fortune of seeing the emanation body.

analyzed: sngar ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du las kyi rnam par smin pa bshad pas rgyal bar 'gyur nas /

analyzed: de sangs par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor du bcug cing /

analyzed: dbang bskur ba rnams yin te /

analyzed: gzhan yang de rnams tshe bsring ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor dang sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir ro // sprul pa ni lha'i dbang po zhes bya ba gang yin pa ste de lta na ni khyod de'i phar gyur to zhes bya ba 'gal lo zhe na ma yin te nor bu dri ma med pa nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa yang de lta bur snang
translated: Moreover, in order to prolong their lives, he taught the mandala and the means of achievement.🔽The emanation is the lord of the gods, and thus you are his father.

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar na thams cad sprul pa dang dngos su 'gyur ro zhe na /

original: 'di ni 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'thad pa nyid do //

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The Lord has said:

analyzed: lha dang lha dbang lha yi bla //

analyzed: lha min dbang po lha yi bdag / ces pa dang / au ma'i khyib  thab skye dgu'i bdag / gtogs 'dod rgyal 'dod thub pa che //

analyzed: 'jig rten gsum dang mkha' dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / nga ni dmyal ba'i dmyal ba pa //

analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar bstod pa bstan nas /

translated: The meaning of the request, O Lord of Secrets, please explain is that Indra and so forth, the supreme gods abiding on the stage of devoted conduct, are requesting for the sake of all sentient beings, for the sake of increasing life and for the sake of health.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po gsungs pa ston to zhes bya ba ni gsol ba btab pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, The Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi... and so forth shows that he taught the essence mantra. Immediately after the request means after the request.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'khor de dag gzigs nas legs so zhes bya bas mgu bar byas te snod dang ldan pa tshangs ba la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams gang khyed kyis 'di lta bu'i spobs pa yang dag
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'khor de dag gzigs nas legs so zhes bya bas mgu bar byas te snod dang ldan pa tshangs ba la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams gang khyed kyis 'di lta bu'i spobs pa yang dag
translated: The Bhagavat Vajrapani, having seen those retinues such as Indra and Brahma, having pleased them with the word “excellent,” the worthy vessels such as Brahma and the sons of the gods, you have generated such eloquence,

original: par bskyed pa ni legs so legs par sgrubs shig dang bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor la gzigs shing mgu bar byas pas snod dang ldan par byas nas spobs pa bskyed pa la dgyes nas legs so zhes bya ba lan gnyis gsungs te ;
analyzed: par bskyed pa ni legs so legs par sgrubs shig dang bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor la gzigs shing mgu bar byas pas snod dang ldan par byas nas spobs pa bskyed pa la dgyes nas legs so zhes bya ba lan gnyis gsungs te ;
translated: “Excellent! Excellent! Practice well, and I will explain.” Having seen the retinue and pleased them, having made them worthy vessels, having delighted in the generation of eloquence, he said “excellent” twice.

original: ma yengs par 'dzin du bcug pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yengs par 'dzin du bcug pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “listen without distraction.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat Vajrapani, means the Bhagavat Vajrapani himself.

original: sems can thams cad kyi tshe dpag tu med pa spel ba zhes bya ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba yod pa de srid kyi bar du thub pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi tshe dpag tu med pa spel ba zhes bya ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba yod pa de srid kyi bar du thub pa'o //
translated: The phrase increasing the immeasurable life of all sentient beings means that it is effective for as long as the sun and moon exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying bo 'di zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying bo 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase this essence of all the Tathagatas means

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying po 'di'o //
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying po 'di'o //
translated: that it is this essence that will be explained below, which has such qualities.

original: rang gi snying gnas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i ye shes ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gnas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i ye shes ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase emerged from his heart shows that it is the knowledge of certainty.

original: de nyid aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: de nyid aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste de'i phan yon ni /
translated: That itself is the essence that begins with Om punye and so on. Its benefits are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po'i gzungs 'di bshad ma thag tu ngan song thams cad rab tu zhi ste sems can dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags su skyes pa'i sems can rnams grol bar byed pa nyid kyis rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po'i gzungs 'di bshad ma thag tu ngan song thams cad rab tu zhi ste sems can dmyal ba dang byol song dang yi dags su skyes pa'i sems can rnams grol bar byed pa nyid kyis rab tu shes so //
translated: As soon as this essence of the dhāraṇī of all the Tathāgatas was explained, all the lower realms were pacified, and the sentient beings born as hell beings, animals, and pretas were liberated.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bar byas te snang bar byas nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du byas nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzungs 'di gsungs ma thag tu ngan song gsum las zhi zhing grol te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang bar byas te snang bar byas nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du byas nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzungs 'di gsungs ma thag tu ngan song gsum las zhi zhing grol te /
translated: immediately after the Blessed One spoke this dhāraṇī, they were pacified and liberated from the three lower realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus grol zhing zhi bar rang rang shes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus grol zhing zhi bar rang rang shes so //
translated: Through the power of the Blessed One, they knew their own liberation and peace.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa'i sku'i rnam par byas nas sangs @261b rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis yum gyi lhums su gshegs ba dang sku mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ston ba'i bar mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul pa'i sku'i rnam par byas nas sangs @261b rgyas kyi mdzad pa bcu gnyis yum gyi lhums su gshegs ba dang sku mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshul ston ba'i bar mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having manifested in all world systems in the form of nirmāṇakāya emanations, having performed the twelve deeds of a buddha, from entering the womb of one's mother up to demonstrating the transcendence of suffering, this is the meaning.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa gnyis dang / mdzad ba bdun dang / mdzad pa bcu drug dang / mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / mdzad pa brgya rtsa bcu dang / mdzad pa mtha' yas pa yang mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa gnyis dang / mdzad ba bdun dang / mdzad pa bcu drug dang / mdzad pa nyi shu rtsa bdun dang / mdzad pa brgya rtsa bcu dang / mdzad pa mtha' yas pa yang mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Also means that he also performed two deeds, seven deeds, sixteen deeds, twenty-seven deeds, one hundred and ten deeds, and infinite deeds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi chos kyi yi ge 'di nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs ba thams cad de ni 'dir phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi chos kyi yi ge 'di nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs ba thams cad de ni 'dir phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: This is the meaning. All the tathāgatas entered into this very letter of the Dharma of the mind means that all the tathāgatas are here Vajrapāṇi.

original: thugs kyi chos kyi zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ye shes so yi ge zhes bya ba ni de'i rtags zla ba'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi chos kyi zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i ye shes so yi ge zhes bya ba ni de'i rtags zla ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of the mind is the wisdom of arousing the mind of enlightenment. Letter means the sign of that, which is the moon.

original: de la bkod pa'i yig 'bru la yang yi ge zhes bya ba bshad de ji skad du /
analyzed: de la bkod pa'i yig 'bru la yang yi ge zhes bya ba bshad de ji skad du /
translated: Among them, the letter that is arranged is also explained as letter, as it is said:

original: yi ge byang chub sems yin te //
analyzed: yi ge byang chub sems yin te //
translated: The letter is the mind of enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa sgra zhes bya bar bshad //
analyzed: gnyis pa sgra zhes bya bar bshad //
translated: The second is explained as sound.

original: ces bya ba bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained.

original: 'di nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni sprul ba'i sku de dag kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba ni sprul ba'i sku de dag kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de nyid du zhugs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “They entered right there” means that those emanated bodies entered right into that moon disk.

original: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog sgom pa rnams kyis phyag na rdo rje lte ba'i dbus su bzhugs pa la snying gnas 'od zer byung ste sngags kyi 'od des brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa bkug nas bstod cing gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog sgom pa rnams kyis phyag na rdo rje lte ba'i dbus su bzhugs pa la snying gnas 'od zer byung ste sngags kyi 'od des brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa bkug nas bstod cing gsol ba btab nas /
translated: This means that those who meditate on the supreme king of mandalas, Vajrapāṇi residing in the center of the navel, light rays emerge from the heart, and with that mantra light, Indra, Brahmā, and so on are summoned, praised, and supplicated.

original: yang rang gi snying gar zla ba la sngags bkod de /
analyzed: yang rang gi snying gar zla ba la sngags bkod de /
translated: Then, the mantra is arranged on the moon in one’s heart.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams mdzad nas sngags dang 'dres pa las zhu bar gyur pa te thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid las gtso bo bskyed par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams mdzad nas sngags dang 'dres pa las zhu bar gyur pa te thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid las gtso bo bskyed par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having performed the deeds of the buddhas, they melt into the mantra and are generated as the principal deity from the nature of method and wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni /🔽tshe dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje 'od byed pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te bri ba dang zad ba med pas tshe dpag tu med pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rtog pas mi phyed pas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje'i 'od ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni / tshe dpag tu med pa'i rdo rje 'od byed pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes te bri ba dang zad ba med pas tshe dpag tu med pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rtog pas mi phyed pas /
translated: Then the Bhagavat entered the samadhi called “Vajra Light of Infinite Life” means

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis dag pas 'od byed pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyis dag pas 'od byed pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: the vajra light of infinite life is the mirror-like wisdom, which is called “light” because it is inexhaustible, and “vajra” because it is pure by nature, since the concepts of subject and object cannot divide it.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang ming de skad ces bya ste snyoms par byas pa ni de gzhan la sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang ming de skad ces bya ste snyoms par byas pa ni de gzhan la sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The samadhi that focuses on that is called by that name. “ Entered” means he made his mind one-pointed by giving it to others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshe dang ye shes dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das tshe tshad med pa'i phyag rgya @262a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshe dang ye shes dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das tshe tshad med pa'i phyag rgya @262a * //
translated: The “infinite life and wisdom of all tathagatas” means the Bhagavat’s life span is immeasurable.

original: chen po'o // snying po'i gzungs 'di bshad do zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba 'di bshad do //
analyzed: chen po'o // snying po'i gzungs 'di bshad do zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba 'di bshad do //
translated: That which is stated below will be explained.

original: de nyid aom a'a mi ta zhes bya ba nas sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: de nyid aom a'a mi ta zhes bya ba nas sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: That very [dhāraṇī] is from Oṃ Amitābha up to svāhā.

original: de nas 'di bshad ma thag tu ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi'o zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas 'di bshad ma thag tu ni sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi'o zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, as soon as this is explained, the suffering of all sentient beings is completely pacified, as stated before.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdon mi za bar sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par gzung 'dzin gyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'joms shing 'khrud pa
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdon mi za bar sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te zhes bya ba ni the tshom med par gzung 'dzin gyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'joms shing 'khrud pa
translated: Then, the Blessed One again entered the samādhi called Destroying All Obscurations Without Doubt, which means that without doubt, all the obscurations of grasping and fixation are destroyed and washed away.

original: ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: This is the wisdom of equality.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ming de skad ces bya ba zhing gzhan la sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ming de skad ces bya ba zhing gzhan la sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The samādhi that takes that as its object is called by that name. The meaning is that in another realm, the mind is one-pointedly focused on the aspect of generosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa gcod pa zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa gcod pa zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: All the Tathagatas means Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: snying po 'di thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags te /
analyzed: snying po 'di thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags te /
translated: This essence was emitted from the heart means the mantra that will be stated below.

original: de nyid aom ka ka ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid aom ka ka ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is Oṃ kakani and so forth.

original: 'di bshad ma thag tu yang thams cad de bzhin gyur to zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di bshad ma thag tu yang thams cad de bzhin gyur to zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As soon as this was explained, all became just so means as before.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽sgrib pa thams cad dri med cing //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / sgrib pa thams cad dri med cing //
translated: Then again, the Blessed One and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung 'dzin gyi dri ma dang bral ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: All obscurations are stainless means the individually discriminating wisdom free from the stains of subject and object.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'i rdo rje zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'i rdo rje zhes pa'o //
translated: That itself is the vajra of discrimination.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having entered into such a samādhi means having one-pointedly focused on the aspect of generosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa rnams ma lus par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sgrib pa rnams ma lus par 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'o//
translated: All the Tathagatas is Amitabha.

original: snying po'i gzungs 'di rang gi thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni de skyed par byed pa dang lam sbyang ba'i sngags te /
analyzed: snying po'i gzungs 'di rang gi thugs ka nas phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni de skyed par byed pa dang lam sbyang ba'i sngags te /
translated: The spell of the essence, which was emitted from his heart, is the spell of the path of purification,

original: aom ratne zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom ratne zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om Ratne, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te phan yon no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te phan yon no //
translated: Then, etc. is as before. The benefit.

original: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gdon mi za bar mi 'joms pa thams cad rnam par 'joms nas zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gdon mi za bar mi 'joms pa thams cad rnam par 'joms nas zhes bya ba ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes te /
translated: Then again, etc. Having destroyed all the indestructible, etc. is the knowledge of duty fulfillment,

original: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it destroys the five sense consciousnesses, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i rnam pa thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad nas so //
translated: Having entered into samadhi is having one-pointedly made the aspect of giving.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni don yod grub @262b pa'o ;
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni don yod grub @262b pa'o ;
translated: Then, all the Tathagatas are Amoghasiddhi.

original: / snying po'i gzungs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: / snying po'i gzungs 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no /
translated: This is the essence-dhâraṇî, etc., as before.

original: gsang sngags 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsum du g-yos shing ya mtshan 'jig rten du snang bas sngags kyi che ba bstan to //
analyzed: gsang sngags 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsum du g-yos shing ya mtshan 'jig rten du snang bas sngags kyi che ba bstan to //
translated: This mantra, etc., is the teaching of the greatness of the mantra by the shaking of the world three times and the appearance of a wonder.

original: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
translated: Then, one should know the gathering, consecration, etc., as explained before.

original: / de nas dkyil 'khor ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga ston to //
analyzed: / de nas dkyil 'khor ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga ston to //
translated: Then, this is the maṇḍala, etc., teaches the ritual of the master’s acts and the disciples’ entrance, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then means subsequently.

original: de yang 'dir dang por re zhig nyams dga' ba'i sa phyogs su stan la 'dug la /
analyzed: de yang 'dir dang por re zhig nyams dga' ba'i sa phyogs su stan la 'dug la /
translated: Here, first of all, one should sit on a seat in a place that is pleasing.

original: lce dang lag pa byin gyis brlab pa dang rdo rje 'jigs byed nas brtsams te 'og bcing pa'i mthar thug pa dang / nam mkhar dkyil 'khor bsams la /
analyzed: lce dang lag pa byin gyis brlab pa dang rdo rje 'jigs byed nas brtsams te 'og bcing pa'i mthar thug pa dang / nam mkhar dkyil 'khor bsams la /
translated: The consecration of the tongue and hands, beginning with Vajrabhairava, ending with the binding below, and imagining the mandala in space,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod pa la sogs pa dang lha dang lha ma yin gyis bstod de mi snang bar gyur pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid dang aa las zla ba dang sa bon dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lha'i rnal 'byor dang byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang phyag na rdo rje thugs yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bskyed de /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod pa la sogs pa dang lha dang lha ma yin gyis bstod de mi snang bar gyur pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid dang aa las zla ba dang sa bon dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang lha'i rnal 'byor dang byin gyis brlab pa dang dbang bskur ba dang phyag na rdo rje thugs yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bskyed de /
translated: the offering with the five offerings, and so forth, the praise by the gods and demigods, and the disappearance, and the emptiness and the moon from A, the seed, the pledge seal, the deity yoga, the consecration, the empowerment, and the generation of the mandala by the method of the complete mind of Vajrapāṇi,

original: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor dgug pa dang / ngan 'gro sbyong zhing dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor dgug pa dang / ngan 'gro sbyong zhing dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang dbang bskur nas /
translated: the invocation of the mandala in space, the purification of the lower realms, the entry into the mandala, the empowerment,🔽and the praise:

original: sangs rgyas kun pas sngar sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun pas sngar sangs rgyas //
translated: All buddhas are buddhas before.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod pa dang / dkyil 'khor lus la brtags ba dang bcas pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstod pa dang / dkyil 'khor lus la brtags ba dang bcas pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This and other praises, together with the examination of the body mandala, are the first yoga, the concentration of the initial union.

original: de nas stong pa nyid du bsgom pa dang khang pa brtsegs ma dang 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa'i lte ba la babs te phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi thugs kar /🔽aom pu n+ye pu n+ye /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid du bsgom pa dang khang pa brtsegs ma dang 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa'i lte ba la babs te phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi thugs kar / aom pu n+ye pu n+ye /
translated: Then, having meditated on emptiness, he descends to the center of the four-spoked wheel in the stacked-up houses.

original: ma h'a pu n+ye aa pa ri mi ta pu n+ye dzny'a na samba ro pa tsitte ka ri ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ma h'a pu n+ye aa pa ri mi ta pu n+ye dzny'a na samba ro pa tsitte ka ri ni sv'a h'a /
translated: There, Vajrapāṇi arranges the mantra Oṃ puṇye puṇye mahāpuṇye 'parimitapuṇyajñānasambhāropacite caryāpratipadāyāṃ karuṇāmaitre-hi-tādhyāśayapratiṣṭhite svāhā.

original: zhes bya ba bkod nas 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te gsol ba 'debs pa'i lha rnams dang bcas pa thugs ka'i zla bar zhugs pas zla ba dang bcas pa zhu nas shes rab dang thabs su gyur nas sngags de nyid gyur pa las phyag
analyzed: zhes bya ba bkod nas 'od zer gyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas te gsol ba 'debs pa'i lha rnams dang bcas pa thugs ka'i zla bar zhugs pas zla ba dang bcas pa zhu nas shes rab dang thabs su gyur nas sngags de nyid gyur pa las phyag
translated: Then, having performed the deeds of a buddha with light rays, he dissolves the supplicating deities into the moon at his heart. The moon and the deities melt and become wisdom and method, which transform into the mantra.

original: na rdo rjer gyur nas de'i thugs kyi zla ba'i aom a'a: ni ti zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa bskyed de /
analyzed: na rdo rjer gyur nas de'i thugs kyi zla ba'i aom a'a: ni ti zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa bskyed de /
translated: Having become Vajranāḍī, one generates Akṣobhya with “oṃ āḥ hūṃ” and so on, on the moon in his heart.

original: shar gyi rtsibs pa la gdon /
analyzed: shar gyi rtsibs pa la gdon /
translated: One should place him on the eastern spoke.

original: aom ka ka ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lho phyogs kyi rin chen 'byung ldan gdon /🔽aom ratne zhes bya ba la @263a * //
analyzed: aom ka ka ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas lho phyogs kyi rin chen 'byung ldan gdon / aom ratne zhes bya ba la @263a * //
translated: With “oṃ kakani” and so on, one should place Ratnasaṃbhava in the southern direction.

original: sogs pas nub phyogs kyi 'od dpag tu med pa gdon /
analyzed: sogs pas nub phyogs kyi 'od dpag tu med pa gdon /
translated: With “oṃ ratne” and so on, one should place Amitābha in the western direction.

original: aom aa ka ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang phyogs su don yod grub pa gdon /
analyzed: aom aa ka ka zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang phyogs su don yod grub pa gdon /
translated: With “oṃ a kakani” and so on, one should place Amoghasiddhi in the northern direction.

original: h'um tram hr'i aa zhes pas l'a sya la sogs pa brgyad de mtshams kyi cha la gzhag / de nas gtso bo dang tha mi dad pas bsdu /
analyzed: h'um tram hr'i aa zhes pas l'a sya la sogs pa brgyad de mtshams kyi cha la gzhag / de nas gtso bo dang tha mi dad pas bsdu /
