translated: With “hūṃ traṃ hrīḥ a,” one should place the eight goddesses beginning with Lāsyā in the intermediate directions.🔽Then, having dissolved them inseparably into the principal deity, one should make offerings and praises, take the empowerment, perform the activities with the iron hook and so on, confer empowerment, and apply the activity of prolonging life.

original: phyag dang ched du brjod de dbang blang lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing dbang bskur te tshe bsring ba'i las la sbyar las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: phyag dang ched du brjod de dbang blang lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing dbang bskur te tshe bsring ba'i las la sbyar las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: This is the supreme king of activities.

original: de nas bzla bar bya ba brjod cing sgo dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas bsdu /
analyzed: de nas bzla bar bya ba brjod cing sgo dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas bsdu /
translated: Then, having recited the mantra to be repeated, one should gather in the deities, preceded by opening the door.

original: lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing mchod yon sngon du 'go bas phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab /
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing mchod yon sngon du 'go bas phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab /
translated: One should perform the rites with the hook and so forth, and seal with the four seals, preceded by offering water for the feet.

original: dbang bskur mchod pa sna tshogs kyis mchod de /
analyzed: dbang bskur mchod pa sna tshogs kyis mchod de /
translated: One should confer initiation and make offerings with various offerings.

original: lha thams cad kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la sngags bkod nas bzlas brjod bya /
analyzed: lha thams cad kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la sngags bkod nas bzlas brjod bya /
translated: Having arranged the mantra on the moon at the heart of all deities, one should perform repetition.

original: thun bzhi'i tha mar bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa dang phyag dang dbang bskur ba dang go bgo ba dang dge ba'i rtsa pa bsngo ba dang brjod par gsol ba dang rdo rje sems ma'i phyag rgya bkrol te gshegs su gsol ba dang sprul pa dang
analyzed: thun bzhi'i tha mar bstod pa sngon du 'gro bas mchod pa dang phyag dang dbang bskur ba dang go bgo ba dang dge ba'i rtsa pa bsngo ba dang brjod par gsol ba dang rdo rje sems ma'i phyag rgya bkrol te gshegs su gsol ba dang sprul pa dang
translated: At the end of the four sessions, preceded by praise, one should make offerings, pay homage, confer initiation, don the armor, dedicate the roots of virtue, request forbearance, release the seal of Vajrasattva, request departure, and gather the emanations into one’s body.

original: lus la bsdu ba brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: lus la bsdu ba brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize that.

original: de nas langs te glegs bam bklag pa la sogs pa ci nus bya'o //
analyzed: de nas langs te glegs bam bklag pa la sogs pa ci nus bya'o //
translated: Then, having risen, one should read scriptures and so forth as much as one can.

original: de ltar byas pas zla ba drug gam lo gcig gam lha rnams las gnang ba thob pa dang 'bum phrag gcig gi bar du byas te sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas zla ba drug gam lo gcig gam lha rnams las gnang ba thob pa dang 'bum phrag gcig gi bar du byas te sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having done it in this way, for six months, or one year, or until one obtains permission from the deities, or having done it one hundred thousand times, is the preliminary rite.

original: de nas sngar bshad pa bzhin dus gzung ba dang lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / thig byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas sngar bshad pa bzhin dus gzung ba dang lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / thig byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, as previously explained, the rite of taking the time and the rite of consecration, and the consecration of the chalk line, etc., are the preliminaries.

original: dkyil 'khor ni 'di yin te /🔽gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //🔽sgo ba bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni 'di yin te / gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa // sgo ba bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: This is the mandala:🔽It has four corners and four doors,🔽and is endowed with four porticos.

original: rta babs bzhi dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: rta babs bzhi dang ldan par bya //
translated: It should have four arches.

original: zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //🔽phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor spyir lte bar bcas shing sgo khyud dang ldan pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o // phyi dang nang gi dkyil 'khor spyir lte bar bcas shing sgo khyud dang ldan pa /
translated: It should be understood as previously explained.🔽The outer and inner mandalas are generally with a center and endowed with door jambs.

original: lte ba dang ni sgo khyud ldan //
analyzed: lte ba dang ni sgo khyud ldan //
translated: With a center and door jambs.

original: zhes bya'o // nang gi dkyil 'khor rtsibs bzhi'i lte ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // nang gi dkyil 'khor rtsibs bzhi'i lte ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The inner mandala has four spokes with a center.

original: de yi dbus su 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de yi dbus su 'khor lo'o //
translated: In its center is a wheel.

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bri bya ste //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bri bya ste //
translated: One should draw the holy mandala

original: rtsibs bzhi pa dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: rtsibs bzhi pa dang ldan pa la //
translated: endowed with four spokes,

original: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor ldan par bya //
analyzed: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor ldan par bya //
translated: with a center mandala.

original: zhes bya ba ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ston to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de ru lha gang bri zhe na //
analyzed: de ru lha gang bri zhe na //
translated: What deities should be drawn there?

original: de yi dbus su gtso bo ni //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gtso bo ni //
translated: In its center, the principal one

original: phyag na rdo rje dril bsnams shing //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje dril bsnams shing //
translated: is Vajrapāṇi, holding a bell,

original: zla ba 'dra ba'i zhal @263b 'dzum bri //
analyzed: zla ba 'dra ba'i zhal @263b 'dzum bri //
translated: with a face like the moon, smiling.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bri ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bri ba gsungs so //
translated: This and so forth is taught as what should be drawn.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lte bar gtso bo rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba phyag na rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams shing kha dog dkar po zhal 'dzum par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lte bar gtso bo rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba phyag na rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams shing kha dog dkar po zhal 'dzum par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of the mandala circle, one should draw the peaceful Vajradhara, the principal one, holding a vajra and bell, white in color, with a smiling face.

original: 'khor lo'i rtsibs bzhi la shar du mi bskyod pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsibs bzhi la shar du mi bskyod pa /
translated: On the four spokes of the wheel, in the east is Akṣobhya,

original: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan ;
analyzed: lhor rin chen 'byung ldan ;
translated: in the south is Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: nub tu 'od dpag med /
analyzed: nub tu 'od dpag med /
translated: in the west is Amitābha,🔽and in the north is Amoghasiddhi.

original: byang du don yod grub pa bri ste thams cad kyang 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs can kha dog dkar po dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin du byed pa /
analyzed: byang du don yod grub pa bri ste thams cad kyang 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs can kha dog dkar po dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin du byed pa /
translated: In the north, Amoghasiddhi is drawn. All of them have the accouterments of a universal monarch, are white in color, and are adorned with various ornaments such as crown ornaments and so forth. They make the gesture of supreme giving with the right hand,

original: g-yon mi 'jigs pa rdo rje'i skyil krung gis so //
analyzed: g-yon mi 'jigs pa rdo rje'i skyil krung gis so //
translated: and the gesture of fearlessness with the left. They sit in vajra posture.

original: nang gi grva la l'a sye la sogs pa bri'o //
analyzed: nang gi grva la l'a sye la sogs pa bri'o //
translated: Lāsyā and so forth are drawn in the inner corners.

original: phyi'i grva la dhuppe la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i grva la dhuppe la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dhūpā and so forth are in the outer corners.

original: sgo bzhi la sgom bzhi bri ste g-yon brkyang ba dang / zlum po dang / mthun pa'i rkang thams cad kyis gnas par bri ste /
analyzed: sgo bzhi la sgom bzhi bri ste g-yon brkyang ba dang / zlum po dang / mthun pa'i rkang thams cad kyis gnas par bri ste /
translated: The four door guardians are drawn at the four doors, standing with the left leg extended and the right leg drawn in, with all the limbs in accord.

original: de nas gzhan yang bris pa ltar bar snang las 'ongs te gcig tu bsre ba dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan bum pa'i mchog dang gtor ma dang rta babs dang chos klog pa dang / me tog sil ma bkram pa dang bcas pa ni de nas zhes bya bas ston te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang bris pa ltar bar snang las 'ongs te gcig tu bsre ba dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan bum pa'i mchog dang gtor ma dang rta babs dang chos klog pa dang / me tog sil ma bkram pa dang bcas pa ni de nas zhes bya bas ston te /
translated: Then, as if drawn, they come from space and merge into one. The supreme parasol, victory banner, and vase, the bali offering, the archway, the reading of the Dharma, and the scattering of flower petals are taught by “then.”

original: rnal 'byor bdag nyid zhugs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag nyid zhugs zhes bya ste /
translated: The yogi himself enters, and so on.

original: zhugs nas lhag chad bskang ba dang sgo dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par gnas pas sgo dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: zhugs nas lhag chad bskang ba dang sgo dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par gnas pas sgo dbye ba ston to //
translated: Having entered, he makes up for any deficiencies, opens the door, and then, abiding in the three meditative stabilizations, he opens the door.

original: de nas bsdu zhing spyan drang ba ni sngags kyis lha rnams spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing spyan drang ba ni sngags kyis lha rnams spyan drangs te /
translated: Then, gathering and inviting, he invites the deities with the mantra:

original: dza: h'um bam ho:bha ga b'a na badzra ae hya hi sa ma ya stvam /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho:bha ga b'a na badzra ae hya hi sa ma ya stvam /
translated: JAH HUM BAM HO: Bhagavan Vajra, come! Come! Be present!

original: de nas gtso bo byon pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas gtso bo byon pa dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the principal one arrives, and so on.

original: mdor na mchod pa byas nas kyang //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor na mchod pa byas nas kyang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In brief, having made offerings,

original: mdor bsdun lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing bgegs bsal sgo bcad pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: mdor bsdun lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing bgegs bsal sgo bcad pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
translated: In brief, having performed the activities with the hook and so forth, having dispelled obstructors, closed the doors, and so forth, as before,

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab dbang bskur bzlas brjod bya ba rnams ni mdor na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab dbang bskur bzlas brjod bya ba rnams ni mdor na zhes bya'o //
translated: sealing with the four seals, conferring empowerment, and doing repetition are called in brief.

original: mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having made offerings,

original: aarga mchog bstabs pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: aarga mchog bstabs pa la sogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings such as presenting the supreme argha.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang gnang ba nod pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang gnang ba nod pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word also includes the bali offering, fire sacrifice, and the bestowal of permission.

original: 'chi bdag sbrul gyi 'jigs ldan rnams //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sbrul gyi 'jigs ldan rnams //
translated: Those who are frightened by the fear of the snake of the Lord of Death,🔽 etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa bstan to //
translated: teaches the entrance into the mandala.

original: 'chi bdag sbrul dang 'dra bas 'jigs ldan rnams gzhom pa'i phyir gzhug par bya ste /🔽mdor na / aom badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya @264a * //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sbrul dang 'dra bas 'jigs ldan rnams gzhom pa'i phyir gzhug par bya ste / mdor na / aom badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya @264a * //
translated: One should enter in order to conquer the fear of those who are frightened by the snake of the Lord of Death.🔽 In brief, having formed the mudra of Ratnatreh with the mantra Om Vajra Samaya Hum, one should enter, holding a jewel or a garland.

original: bas ti r'inti ri'i phyag rgya bcings la rin chen thogs te yang na phreng ba thogs te gzhug / h'um pra t'itstsha badzra h'um zhes bya bas me tog dor /
analyzed: bas ti r'inti ri'i phyag rgya bcings la rin chen thogs te yang na phreng ba thogs te gzhug / h'um pra t'itstsha badzra h'um zhes bya bas me tog dor /
translated: Having cast the flower with Hum Pratichchha Vajra Hum,

original: badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya bas dam tshig sbyin /
analyzed: badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya bas dam tshig sbyin /
translated: one should give the pledge with Vajra Samaya Hum.

original: aom badzra h'a syod gha tra ya zhes bya bas gdong g-yogs dgrol /
analyzed: aom badzra h'a syod gha tra ya zhes bya bas gdong g-yogs dgrol /
translated: Having removed the blindfold with Om Vajra Pashya Hum,

original: aom badzra p'a shya h'um zhes bya bas dkyil 'khor bstan nas snying gar phyag rgya dgrol /
analyzed: aom badzra p'a shya h'um zhes bya bas dkyil 'khor bstan nas snying gar phyag rgya dgrol /
translated: one should show the mandala, and release the mudra at the heart.

original: 'di'i sgrub pa'i go rims ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i sgrub pa'i go rims ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad zin to //
translated: The sequence of the rite is explained in the Root Tantra.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. teaches the consecration.

original: de yang dang bor dbu rgyan dang / bum pa dang / phreng ba dang / phyag rgya dang / rdo rje dang / las kyi rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab kyis dbang bskur ba rnams yin te /
analyzed: de yang dang bor dbu rgyan dang / bum pa dang / phreng ba dang / phyag rgya dang / rdo rje dang / las kyi rdo rje dang / 'khor lo dang / thabs dang / shes rab dang / gsang ba dang / shes rab kyis dbang bskur ba rnams yin te /
translated: That is, first the consecration of the diadem, the vase, the garland, the seal, the vajra, the action vajra, the wheel, the method, the wisdom, the secret, and the wisdom consecration.

original: 'di yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o //🔽de ltar dbang bskur na tshe ring ba'i rig pa 'di sbyin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang bskur ba dang dam tshig thob pa la dngos grub sbyin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa de bzhin du shes par bya'o // de ltar dbang bskur na tshe ring ba'i rig pa 'di sbyin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang bskur ba dang dam tshig thob pa la dngos grub sbyin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This should be understood as explained in the Root Tantra.🔽Having thus consecrated, one should give this knowledge of longevity, etc. teaches that one should give the power to those who have received consecration and the commitments in this very life.

original: de ltar sngar bshad pa ltar bskur nas tshe ring ba thob par byed pa'i rig pa 'di slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin no //
analyzed: de ltar sngar bshad pa ltar bskur nas tshe ring ba thob par byed pa'i rig pa 'di slob dpon gyis slob ma la sbyin no //
translated: Having thus consecrated as previously explained, the master should give this knowledge which brings about the attainment of longevity to the disciple.

original: de nyid aom bh'um badzra a'a yu she h'um aa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid aom bh'um badzra a'a yu she h'um aa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is Oṃ bhrūṃ vajra āyuṣe hūṃ a.🔽Then, this is the means of accomplishment:

original: de nas sgrub pa 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dis sgrub pas na bsgrub ste 'og gnas 'byung ba'i chogs so //
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni 'dis sgrub pas na bsgrub ste 'og gnas 'byung ba'i chogs so //
translated: since one accomplishes by this, it is the means of accomplishment, the ritual of the assembly of the lower abode.🔽This is it:

original: 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni ston pas rtsom pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das rdo rje tshe dpag med zla ba'i 'od can zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po bri ba dang bsnyen pa ston te bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kha dog dkar po rgyan kun gyis brgyan pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin dang g-yon pa mi 'jigs
analyzed: 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni ston pas rtsom pa'o // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje tshe dpag med zla ba'i 'od can zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po bri ba dang bsnyen pa ston te bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med kha dog dkar po rgyan kun gyis brgyan pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin dang g-yon pa mi 'jigs
translated: the teacher begins.🔽The Bhagavān, the white-rayed Amitāyus,

original: pa sbyin pa de las bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bri'o //
analyzed: pa sbyin pa de las bdud rtsi 'dzag pa bri'o //
translated: and so on, teaches the first drawing and recitation. The Bhagavān Amitāyus, white in color, adorned with all ornaments, with the right hand in the boon-granting gesture and the left in the fear-not gesture, from which nectar drips, is drawn.

original: de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor pa thal mo sbyar ba gdong gyen du bltas pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor pa thal mo sbyar ba gdong gyen du bltas pa /
translated: Below that, the yogī, with palms joined, face upturned,

original: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang bcas pa ras la bris te spyan dbye ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa bzhin du byas la /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lnga dang bcas pa ras la bris te spyan dbye ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa bzhin du byas la /
translated: together with the five offerings, is drawn on cloth. The rite of opening the eyes is performed as previously explained.

original: de'i spyan sngar dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste bcom ldan 'das la sems bzhin du 'bum bzlas so //
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste bcom ldan 'das la sems bzhin du 'bum bzlas so //
translated: In his presence, one should cultivate the samādhi of the initial application and, like the Bhagavān, repeat the mantra one hundred thousand times.

original: de nas zla ba nya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa ston te /
translated: Then, on the full moon, etc., he teaches the means of accomplishment.

original: nya'i nub mo dkyil 'khor chen po brtsams te mchod pa byas la ba dmar ser gyi mar snod gsar bar bcug la rdo rje khu tshur g-yon pas mnan la /
analyzed: nya'i nub mo dkyil 'khor chen po brtsams te mchod pa byas la ba dmar ser gyi mar snod gsar bar bcug la rdo rje khu tshur g-yon pas mnan la /
translated: On the night of the full moon, one should commence the great maṇḍala, make offerings, and place reddish-yellow butter in a new vessel, pressing it down with the left vajra fist.

original: bcom ldan 'das srog @264b dang bcas pa lta bur sems shing mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das srog @264b dang bcas pa lta bur sems shing mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod bya ba yin no //
translated: Thinking that the Bhagavān is alive, one should perform the recitation throughout the night.

original: de nas dri sna tshogs bsnams shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma dang dngos grub ston to //
analyzed: de nas dri sna tshogs bsnams shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan ma dang dngos grub ston to //
translated: Then, smelling various scents, etc., he teaches the signs and accomplishments.

original: de nas dri dang ldan pa 'am rlangs pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas dri dang ldan pa 'am rlangs pa 'am /
translated: Then, having a scent, or vapor,

original: du ba'am me 'am 'od zer ram me sgron nam 'od la sogs pa'i mtshan ma byung na mar me de yang mar sar pa la sogs pa rdza sa bcu gcig po gang yang rung ba la bsres te /🔽nang par sngar srung ba dang / khrus la sogs pas bdag nyid dkyil 'khor brtags pa'i tshul du sbyangs nas /
analyzed: du ba'am me 'am 'od zer ram me sgron nam 'od la sogs pa'i mtshan ma byung na mar me de yang mar sar pa la sogs pa rdza sa bcu gcig po gang yang rung ba la bsres te / nang par sngar srung ba dang / khrus la sogs pas bdag nyid dkyil 'khor brtags pa'i tshul du sbyangs nas /
translated: If a sign such as smoke, fire, light rays, a lamp, or light occurs, then that lamp oil should be mixed with any of the eleven substances, such as fresh butter.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor du byas te 'thungs sam zos na nyi ma dang zla ba yod kyi bar du tshe ring ba rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor du byas te 'thungs sam zos na nyi ma dang zla ba yod kyi bar du tshe ring ba rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the morning, having purified oneself with protection, bathing, and so on, one should perform the deity yoga and drink or eat it. If one does so, one will become like a vajra, with a long life until the end of the sun and moon.

original: mtshan ma tha ma byung na /
analyzed: mtshan ma tha ma byung na /
translated: If the final sign occurs,

original: nad med zo mdog bde skra dkar dang gnyer ba med pa'i tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad med zo mdog bde skra dkar dang gnyer ba med pa'i tshe lo brgya par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become free of disease, with a healthy complexion, without gray hair or wrinkles, and will live for one hundred years.

original: gzhan yang des nyungs kar la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las 'grub par 'gyur te the tshom med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang des nyungs kar la sogs pas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las 'grub par 'gyur te the tshom med do //
translated: Moreover, one will accomplish the activities of pacification and so on with mustard seed and so on. There is no doubt.

original: de ltar tshe tshad med pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshe tshad med pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the maṇḍala of immeasurable life,🔽now, the explanation of the maṇḍala of the vase empowerment:

original: da ni 'jig rten pa'i lha la mos pa'i don du 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor drug bstan te /
analyzed: da ni 'jig rten pa'i lha la mos pa'i don du 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor drug bstan te /
translated: Now, for the sake of those who are devoted to worldly deities, the six worldly maṇḍalas are taught.

original: de yang dang por de nas rgyal po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyal po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
analyzed: de yang dang por de nas rgyal po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyal po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
translated: And there, first, from “Then, the four kings” and so forth, the maṇḍala of the four kings is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i rjes thogs so //
translated: “Then” is immediately after the first yoga.

original: de yang 'dir gtsug tor du bshad pa las /
analyzed: de yang 'dir gtsug tor du bshad pa las /
translated: And here, in the explanation of the uṣṇīṣa,

original: rgyal po bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi dang bcas pa'o //
translated: it is together with the four kings.

original: de nyid kyi snying gar dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i dus su gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba la sngags bkod de //
analyzed: de nyid kyi snying gar dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i dus su gtso bo'i thugs kar zla ba la sngags bkod de //
translated: At the time of emanating the maṇḍala at the heart of that [uṣṇṣa], the mantra is arranged on the moon at the heart of the principal one.

original: ngan 'gro sbyong ba'i dus su rgyal po bzhi yang dgug pa dang bcas pa bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngan 'gro sbyong ba'i dus su rgyal po bzhi yang dgug pa dang bcas pa bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the time of purifying the lower realms, the four kings are also visualized together with the summoning. This is the meaning.

original: rgyal po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bshad du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “The four kings” and so forth, the meaning is “please explain.”

original: de yang rgyal chen bzhis mos pa byed pa'i sa thob pa'i phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal nas sems can ngan 'gro las bskyab ba dang / tshe phyi ma dang 'di'i don du rang rang dgod ba'i snying po dang / sprul pa la sogs pa bshad kyis /
analyzed: de yang rgyal chen bzhis mos pa byed pa'i sa thob pa'i phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal nas sems can ngan 'gro las bskyab ba dang / tshe phyi ma dang 'di'i don du rang rang dgod ba'i snying po dang / sprul pa la sogs pa bshad kyis /
translated: The Four Great Kings, having paid homage to Vajrapani, who has attained the level of devoted interest, explain the essence of the joy of protecting beings from the lower realms, the essence of the joy of the next life and this one, and the essence of the joy of emanations and so forth.

original: de la brten ba'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal du gsol zhes gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: de la brten ba'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje 'dzin pas bka' stsal du gsol zhes gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: Then, having bowed to Vajrapani, who has attained the stage of devoted interest, the Four Great Kings, for the sake of protecting sentient beings from the lower realms, and for the sake of this and the next life, each offer their own essence mantra, emanations, and so forth, and request the mandala that is based on them to be taught by the Vajra Holder.

original: rgyal po chen po dag legs kyis shod cig dang ngas rjes su yi rang zhing byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis zhus pa bzhin du ngas byin gyis brlab cing bshad pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po dag legs kyis shod cig dang ngas rjes su yi rang zhing byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis zhus pa bzhin du ngas byin gyis brlab cing bshad pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The reply is, Great Kings, speak well, and I will rejoice and bless you. This means, I will bless and explain according to your request.

original: de nas @265a * //
analyzed: de nas @265a * //
translated: Then,

original: gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po la bos te zhes bya ba nas rang rang gi snying po phul te /🔽aom bee gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po la bos te zhes bya ba nas rang rang gi snying po phul te / aom bee gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i'o //
translated: having addressed the king of the yakshas, up to offering their own essence mantras,🔽Om is the essence mantra of the king of the yakshas.

original: aom dhi dri za'i rgyal po'i'o //
analyzed: aom dhi dri za'i rgyal po'i'o //
translated: Om is the essence mantra of the king of the gandharvas.

original: aom bi grul bum gyi rgyal po'i'o //
analyzed: aom bi grul bum gyi rgyal po'i'o //
translated: Om is the king of the Vighnas.

original: aom khya klu'i rgyal po ste 'di dag gis de rnams dgod pa la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: aom khya klu'i rgyal po ste 'di dag gis de rnams dgod pa la sogs pa ston to //
translated: Om is the king of the Nagas. By these one shows the arraying, etc.

original: sgo ba rnams kyi ni dza: h'um bam ho:zhes bya ba yin no //🔽'dis kyang 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: sgo ba rnams kyi ni dza: h'um bam ho:zhes bya ba yin no // 'dis kyang 'di skad du ston te /
translated: of those. The door-guardians have jriim hriim kham hriim.

original: sbyor ba dang po bsgom pa la khang pa la brtsigs ma dang gdan bskyed la rgyal po bzhi dang bcas pa bsams nas snying po de rnams kyis rgyal po gnas rnams su bkod de /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang po bsgom pa la khang pa la brtsigs ma dang gdan bskyed la rgyal po bzhi dang bcas pa bsams nas snying po de rnams kyis rgyal po gnas rnams su bkod de /
translated: This also teaches that one should meditate on the first yoga, having generated the palace and the seats, and having contemplated the four kings, one should array the kings in their places with those essence-mantras.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka las sgo ba bzhi bton nas bsgom pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka las sgo ba bzhi bton nas bsgom pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Having emitted the four door-guardians from the heart of Vajrapani, one should meditate on them. This is the samadhi of the supreme king mandala.

original: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, the gathering and consecration should be known as the samadhi of the supreme king of actions.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, the explanation of their mandalas.

original: slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te /
translated: The master's actions and the disciples' entry, etc. are taught.

original: de yang rgyal po chen po de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de yang rgyal po chen po de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the explanation of the maṇḍala of those great kings

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa nang gi dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi sgo bzhi pa nang gi dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: is the outer maṇḍala with four corners and four doors, adorned with the inner maṇḍala with four spokes.

original: de'i lte ba la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba bri pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lte ba la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba bri pa'o //
translated: In its center, Vajradhara, peaceful, is drawn as before.

original: byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la lus ngan po ne'u le'i rgyal ba thogs pa rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa sboms pa seng ge'i gdan la gser gyi mdog can bum pa bzang po'i kha nas chu 'bab pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang bcas par bri'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la lus ngan po ne'u le'i rgyal ba thogs pa rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa sboms pa seng ge'i gdan la gser gyi mdog can bum pa bzang po'i kha nas chu 'bab pa dang / dpag bsam gyi shing dang bcas par bri'o //
translated: In the northern spoke, Kubera, the king of the yakṣas, is drawn holding a mongoose, adorned with precious ornaments, stout, on a lion throne, golden in color, with a flowing stream from the mouth of an excellent vase, and with a wish-fulfilling tree.

original: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la yul 'khor srung pi wang bsgreng ba ljang gu rgyan rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la yul 'khor srung pi wang bsgreng ba ljang gu rgyan rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the eastern spoke, Dhṛtarāṣṭra is drawn standing with a lute, green, and adorned with ornaments.

original: lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la lus 'phags ral gri lag na thogs pa bri'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la lus 'phags ral gri lag na thogs pa bri'o //
translated: In the southern spoke, Virūḍhaka is drawn holding a sword in his hand.

original: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la mig mi bzang rdo rje dang zhags pa 'dzin pa mgo bo la sbrul mgo bdun gyis bskor pa mig dmar zhing shin tu 'bur ba bri'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la mig mi bzang rdo rje dang zhags pa 'dzin pa mgo bo la sbrul mgo bdun gyis bskor pa mig dmar zhing shin tu 'bur ba bri'o //
translated: On the western spoke, draw the red, very protruding eye of Virūpākṣa holding a vajra and a noose, with seven snake heads surrounding his head.

original: sgo bzhi'i phyogs su lcags kyu ma la sogs pa bri'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi'i phyogs su lcags kyu ma la sogs pa bri'o //
translated: Draw the hook and so forth in the four directions of the gate.🔽Then, when the time of the evening has arrived, enter into the yoga with the vajra fist and make offerings to the guru, and so forth, as before.

original: de nas dgongs ka'i dus la bab pa dang rdo rje'i phyag rgyas rnal 'byor pa nyid du zhugs la lhag chad zhi bar bya ba dang / me tog dor ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang yang sgo phye ste dang po rdo rje 'dzin pa spyan drang /🔽de nas aom bee zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: de nas dgongs ka'i dus la bab pa dang rdo rje'i phyag rgyas rnal 'byor pa nyid du zhugs la lhag chad zhi bar bya ba dang / me tog dor ba la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang yang sgo phye ste dang po rdo rje 'dzin pa spyan drang / de nas aom bee zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: Then, at the time of the three samādhis, open the door and first invite the vajra holder.

original: btags pas rgyal po spyan drang /
analyzed: btags pas rgyal po spyan drang /
translated: Then, by adding jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ to oṃ bhe, invite the king.

original: @265b lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya /
analyzed: @265b lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya /
translated: Do the action with the hook and so forth.

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab /
translated: Seal with the four mudras.

original: dbang bskur ba dang mchod pa bya ba dang cho ga bzhin du phyi rol tu gtor ma dbul sbyin sreg bya zhing gnang ba nod ces bya ba ston to //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang mchod pa bya ba dang cho ga bzhin du phyi rol tu gtor ma dbul sbyin sreg bya zhing gnang ba nod ces bya ba ston to //
translated: The consecration, worship, and external bali offering according to the rite, and the fire sacrifice and receiving permission are taught.

original: de nas sngags mkhan sngags 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba phan yon dang bcas pa ston to //
analyzed: de nas sngags mkhan sngags 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba phan yon dang bcas pa ston to //
translated: Then, the mantra adept, with this mantra om vajra samaya hum and so forth, teaches the introduction and consecration with benefits.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas /🔽aom badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgyas rigs bzhi po gang yang rung ba me tog gam /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas / aom badzra sa ma ya h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags 'di dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgyas rigs bzhi po gang yang rung ba me tog gam /
translated: Then, the yogi,

original: rin chen thogs su gzhug go //
analyzed: rin chen thogs su gzhug go //
translated: with this mantra om vajra samaya hum and the vajra-holder seal, should introduce the four families, whichever is appropriate, with flowers or jewels.

original: de nas pra t'itstsha ba ma ho dha ma zhes bya bas dor ro //
analyzed: de nas pra t'itstsha ba ma ho dha ma zhes bya bas dor ro //
translated: Then, with pratīccha mahoṃdham, they should be cast.

original: gang la babs pa de 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la babs pa de 'dis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever it falls on, that one will be successful.

original: de nas sngar bshad pa bzhin du padma la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas sngar bshad pa bzhin du padma la bzhag ste /
translated: Then, as previously explained, place it on the lotus,

original: phyi rol du gnas pa'i bum pa bzhis dbang bskur zhing phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar bskyed la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du gnas pa'i bum pa bzhis dbang bskur zhing phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar bskyed la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: One should generate oneself as Vajrapāṇi and confer initiation with the four vases located outside.

original: de nas dbang nyi shu rtsa gcig po kun snga ma bzhin du bskur nas rgyal por gyur pa dang / rgyal po yang gling gcig dang / gling bzhi la dbang bskur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dbang nyi shu rtsa gcig po kun snga ma bzhin du bskur nas rgyal por gyur pa dang / rgyal po yang gling gcig dang / gling bzhi la dbang bskur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having conferred all twenty-one initiations as before, one will become a king, and also a king who rules over one continent and over the four continents.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar bskyed pa bzhin du gzhan yang rgyal po bzhi'i phyag rgya bskyed de lan bzhir dbang bskur zhing zhugs na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang rgyal po bzhi 'khor dang bcas pas rtag tu skyong ba dang gzhan gyi gnod pa dang nad dang 'chi
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i phyag rgyar bskyed pa bzhin du gzhan yang rgyal po bzhi'i phyag rgya bskyed de lan bzhir dbang bskur zhing zhugs na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang rgyal po bzhi 'khor dang bcas pas rtag tu skyong ba dang gzhan gyi gnod pa dang nad dang 'chi
translated: Just as one generates oneself as Vajrapāṇi, one should also generate oneself as the four kings. If one enters into the four initiations, one will always be protected by Vajradhara and the four kings together with their retinues.

original: bdag gi 'jigs pa dang mu ge la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'joms so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'jigs pa dang mu ge la sogs pa'i gnod pa 'joms so //
translated: One will be protected from the harm of others, from disease, from the fear of death, from famine, and so forth.

original: rgyal po bzhis khyad par du zhi ba dang mngon spyod dang dbang dang rgyas pa byed de /
analyzed: rgyal po bzhis khyad par du zhi ba dang mngon spyod dang dbang dang rgyas pa byed de /
translated: The four kings in particular perform pacifying, violent action, controlling, and increasing.

original: de ltar ma byas na phyag na rdo rje la 'khrus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na phyag na rdo rje la 'khrus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, one would be insulting Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Then, etc. shows the maṇḍala of the ten direction protectors.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs skyong bcu dang bcas pa'i phyag na rdo rje ste mdor na dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin te de'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyogs skyong bcu dang bcas pa'i phyag na rdo rje ste mdor na dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin te de'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then means after the samādhi of the first application of Vajrapāṇi together with the ten direction protectors.

original: phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The ten direction protectors, etc.

original: phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas te sems can gyi don du rang gi snying po dang dbul bar gsol ba btab pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang bas rang gi snying po phul ba /
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba bcu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas te sems can gyi don du rang gi snying po dang dbul bar gsol ba btab pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang bas rang gi snying po phul ba /
translated: The ten direction protectors bowed to the Bhagavān and requested to offer their own essence mantras for the benefit of sentient beings, and the Bhagavān, having granted permission, offered their own essence mantras.

original: aom ai zhes bya ba nas aom bra zhes bya ba'i bar brgya byin dang / gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / gnod sbyin dang / me lha dang / srin po dang / rlung lha dang / dbang @266a * //
analyzed: aom ai zhes bya ba nas aom bra zhes bya ba'i bar brgya byin dang / gshin rje dang / chu lha dang / gnod sbyin dang / me lha dang / srin po dang / rlung lha dang / dbang @266a * //
translated: The essence mantras of Indra, Yama, Varuna, Kubera, Agni, Raksasa, Vayu, Isana, Surya, and Varaha are Om i up to Om bra.

original: ldan dang / nyi ma dang / phag rnams kyi snying po yin ta 'dis ni 'di rnams dgod pa ston to //
analyzed: ldan dang / nyi ma dang / phag rnams kyi snying po yin ta 'dis ni 'di rnams dgod pa ston to //
translated: This shows their placement.

original: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, the gathering and consecration are as before.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las dang slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te /
translated: Then, the explanation of their maṇḍala and so on teaches the master's tasks, the disciples' entrance, and so on.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum dang sa dang lhag par gnas pa byas pa de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor zur bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris la /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum dang sa dang lhag par gnas pa byas pa de'i rjes la dkyil 'khor zur bzhi pa sgo bzhi pa la sogs pa'i dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa bris la /
translated: After the three samādhis and the ground consecration, in the center of a maṇḍala with four corners, four doors, and so on, draw an eight-spoked wheel.

original: de'i lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa snga ma bzhin gzhag / phyogs skyong rnams shar la sogs ba'i char brgya byin la sogs pa gzhag / lte ba la spyan sngar nyi ma dang phag kyang gzhag / sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa yang gzhag /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa snga ma bzhin gzhag / phyogs skyong rnams shar la sogs ba'i char brgya byin la sogs pa gzhag / lte ba la spyan sngar nyi ma dang phag kyang gzhag / sgo rnams su lcags kyu la sogs pa yang gzhag /
translated: One should place the sun and pig in front of the center, and also place the hook, etc., at the gates.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum la sogs pa dang sbyan drang ba dang mchod pa bya /
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum la sogs pa dang sbyan drang ba dang mchod pa bya /
translated: Then one should perform the three meditative stabilizations, etc., and the invocation and offering.

original: de nas slob ma gzhug pa'i don du yang bdag nyid gcig pu zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas slob ma gzhug pa'i don du yang bdag nyid gcig pu zhugs nas /
translated: Then, for the sake of inducting the disciples, one should enter alone,

original: gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: and perform the rite up to the bestowal of permission.

original: slob ma rnams ni gzhug byas shing //
analyzed: slob ma rnams ni gzhug byas shing //
translated: The disciples should be inducted,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba dang phan yon ston to /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba dang phan yon ston to /
translated: etc., teaches the induction into the maṇḍala, the conferral of initiation, and the benefits.

original: dang po slob ma rnams sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du gzhug cing /
analyzed: dang po slob ma rnams sngar rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du gzhug cing /
translated: First, one should induct the disciples as previously explained in the root tantra.

original: phyogs skyong ba'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur te /
translated: One should confer initiation with the vases of the directional guardians.

original: dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur te snying po sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba gzhan rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur te snying po sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The other consecrations should also consecrate, and should give the essence.

original: de nas bsgrubs na 'grub par the tshom med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas bsgrubs na 'grub par the tshom med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, if one practices, there is no doubt of success.

original: de nas de dag mgu nas ni //
analyzed: de nas de dag mgu nas ni //
translated: Then, they, being pleased,🔽said these words:

original: 'di skad du ni tshig gsol to //
analyzed: 'di skad du ni tshig gsol to //
translated: We will do all that you have said.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgya byin la sogs pas zhus pa ste dbang bskur ba'i phan yon yin te go sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa brgya byin la sogs pas zhus pa ste dbang bskur ba'i phan yon yin te go sla bsam bshad do //
translated: Thus, Indra and so forth requested, and this is the benefit of consecration, which is easy to understand, so it is not explained.

original: de nas gza' chen po brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pas gza' chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor ston to //
analyzed: de nas gza' chen po brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pas gza' chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor ston to //
translated: Then, the eight great planets and so forth teach the maṇḍala of the eight great planets.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la de nas zhes bya ba ni dang po'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Then, then and so forth, then is the first application.🔽 Here, the first application is Vajrapāṇi, the great planet, along with the lunar mansions.🔽

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba ni phyag na rdo rje gza' chen po rgyu skar dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba ni phyag na rdo rje gza' chen po rgyu skar dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The eight great planets are Rāhu, Ketu, the sun, the moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, and Venus.🔽 The lunar mansions are Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, Kṛttikā, Rohiṇī, Mṛgaśirā, Ārdrā, Punarvasu, Puṣya, Āśleṣā, Maghā, Pūrvāphālgunī, Uttarāphālgunī, Hasta, Citrā, Svātī, Viśākhā, Anurādhā, Jyeṣṭhā, Mūlā, Pūrvāṣāḍhā, Uttarāṣāḍhā, Śravaṇa, Dhaniṣṭhā, Śatabhiṣā, Pūrvāproṣṭhapadā, Uttarāproṣṭhapadā, Revatī, Aśvinī, and Bharaṇī.

original: gza' chen po brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gza' 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rang rang gi snying po phul ba la byin gyis brlabs nas rang rang gi snying po bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: gza' chen po brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa la gza' 'khor dang bcas pa rnams rang rang gi snying po phul ba la byin gyis brlabs nas rang rang gi snying po bzlas pa ni /
translated: The eight great planets and so forth are the planets together with their retinues. Having blessed the offerings of their respective essences, one recites their respective essences.

original: aom aa zhes bya ba nas aom ra zhes bya ba'i bar pa bsangs dang / phur bu dang / zla ba dang / gza' @266b lag dang / mi ga dmar dang / sgra gcan dang / nyi ma dang / spen pa la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: aom aa zhes bya ba nas aom ra zhes bya ba'i bar pa bsangs dang / phur bu dang / zla ba dang / gza' @266b lag dang / mi ga dmar dang / sgra gcan dang / nyi ma dang / spen pa la sogs pa dang /
translated: From Om A up to Om Ra, one recites the essences of Ketu, Rāhu, the moon, the planet Mars, the planet Mercury, Ketu, the sun, Saturn, and so forth.

original: smin drug la sogs rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: smin drug la sogs rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Together with the twenty-eight lunar mansions, such as Pleiades and so forth.

original: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin te ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin te ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Then the gathering and consecration are the same as before, the three aspects of meditative concentration.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis bsnyen pa byas nas sa dang lhag par gnas pa'i rjes la thig gdab pa sngon du 'gro bas ji skad du bshad
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te de yang ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis bsnyen pa byas nas sa dang lhag par gnas pa'i rjes la thig gdab pa sngon du 'gro bas ji skad du bshad
translated: Having performed the service with the three meditative absorptions, after the consecration of the ground, having first cast the crossed vajra, one should draw the maṇḍala as explained,

original: pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / nang gi chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa bris la /
analyzed: pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / nang gi chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa bris la /
translated: and the inner dharmacakra with eight spokes and a hub.

original: dbus kyi padmo'i lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i khro bo gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi padmo'i lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa'i khro bo gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place the wrathful Vajradhara in the center of the lotus.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad kyi mtshams bzhi bor ba'i phyogs bzhi la rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad kyi mtshams bzhi bor ba'i phyogs bzhi la rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rje bri'o //
translated: In the four directions, excluding the four intermediate directions of the eight lotus petals, one should draw a vajra, a jewel, a lotus, and a crossed vajra.

original: rtsibs la shar du pa bsangs /
analyzed: rtsibs la shar du pa bsangs /
translated: In the east on the spoke, one should draw Mercury.

original: lhor phur bu /
analyzed: lhor phur bu /
translated: In the south, Mars;

original: nub tu zla ba /
analyzed: nub tu zla ba /
translated: in the west, the moon;

original: byang du gza' lag / shar lhor mig dmar /
analyzed: byang du gza' lag / shar lhor mig dmar /
translated: in the north, Rāhu; in the southeast, Ketu;

original: lho nub tu sgra gcan 'dzin /
analyzed: lho nub tu sgra gcan 'dzin /
translated: in the southwest, Saturn;

original: nub byang du nyi ma /🔽byang shar du spen pa /
analyzed: nub byang du nyi ma /🔽byang shar du spen pa /
translated: in the northwest, the sun;🔽and in the northeast, Jupiter.

original: sgo bzhir lcags kyu la sogs pa khros pa bri /
analyzed: sgo bzhir lcags kyu la sogs pa khros pa bri /
translated: The four doors should be drawn with the wrathful iron hook and so forth.

original: khor yug gi phyi rol du smin drug nas bra nye'i mthar thug par rgyu skar bdun bdun phyogs re rer bri'o //
analyzed: khor yug gi phyi rol du smin drug nas bra nye'i mthar thug par rgyu skar bdun bdun phyogs re rer bri'o //
translated: Outside the surrounding wall, the seven stars of the asterisms from śravaṇa to bharaṇī should be drawn in each direction.

original: 'dir l'a sye la sogs pa rnams mi bri ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lhar dngos grub stsol ba'i rgyur gyur pas mchod pa bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir l'a sye la sogs pa rnams mi bri ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lhar dngos grub stsol ba'i rgyur gyur pas mchod pa bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, one should not draw Lāsyā and so forth, because they are not to be worshipped as the cause for granting spiritual powers as worldly deities.

original: de nas khrus la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pas lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas khrus la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pas lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing /
translated: Then, having performed the preliminary ablutions and so forth, one should perform the rites with the iron hook and so forth, endowed with the three meditative stabilizations.

original: mchod pa dang gnang ba nod pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mchod pa dang gnang ba nod pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The offerings and request for permission are as before.

original: de nas slob ma rnams gzhug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba'i phan yon dang bcas pa ston to //
analyzed: de nas slob ma rnams gzhug ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhug pa dang dbang bskur ba'i phan yon dang bcas pa ston to //
translated: Then, having caused the disciples to enter and so forth, it teaches the entry and the benefits of empowerment.

original: aom badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis gzhug pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: aom badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsum gyis gzhug pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: The entry is taught with the three [mantras] beginning with oṃ vajra.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as previously explained.

original: de nas gza' brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bum pas dbang bskur rdo rje'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur /
analyzed: de nas gza' brgyad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bum pas dbang bskur rdo rje'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur /
translated: Then, the empowerment is conferred with the vase blessed by the eight planets, and the empowerment is conferred with the vajra gesture.

original: dbang bskur ba lhag ma rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba lhag ma rnams kyis kyang dbang bskur /
translated: The remaining empowerments are also conferred.

original: gza' yi dam 'di ltar bzung ste snying po don tsam gyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gza' yi dam 'di ltar bzung ste snying po don tsam gyi sgo nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The planets are taken as one's deity and accomplished through the mere essence of the meaning.

original: 'dir sgrub pa'i khyad par ma bshad pa ni rgyu ni gsum yin te /🔽dbang dang dam tshig kho na gtsor zung shig / dbang gi 'bras bu gza'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gsum @267a * //
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa'i khyad par ma bshad pa ni rgyu ni gsum yin te / dbang dang dam tshig kho na gtsor zung shig / dbang gi 'bras bu gza'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gsum @267a * //
translated: Here, the special practice is not explained, but the cause is threefold.🔽The result of the empowerment is the three, such as the maṇḍala of the planets, and so on.

original: yin no // klu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gsum ni dbang dang dam tshig dang dngos grub thams cad sgrub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yin no // klu'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa gsum ni dbang dang dam tshig dang dngos grub thams cad sgrub pa kho na'o //
translated: The three, such as the maṇḍala of the nāgas, and so on, are the accomplishment of all the empowerments, samayas, and siddhis.

original: 'di ltar bstan pa de yang des 'dul ba'i gang zag la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa de yang des 'dul ba'i gang zag la sogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching in this way is for the person to be tamed by that.

original: de nas phan yon gza' rnams kyis 'dod pa thams cad sgrub po //
analyzed: de nas phan yon gza' rnams kyis 'dod pa thams cad sgrub po //
translated: Then, the benefit is that the planets accomplish all desires.

original: rgyu skar dang skad cig dang yud tsam dang thang gcig dang / dus gcig dang zla tshigs dang sbyor ba dang khyim dang dus sbyor dang 'jug phod la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar de dag nyid skad cig la sogs pa la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu skar dang skad cig dang yud tsam dang thang gcig dang / dus gcig dang zla tshigs dang sbyor ba dang khyim dang dus sbyor dang 'jug phod la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu skar de dag nyid skad cig la sogs pa la dbang ba dang /
translated: The stars, moments, muhurtas, instants,🔽conjunctions, houses, and periods are the lords of the stars, moments, and so on.

original: dus drug pa la sogs pa nas zla tshigs la dbang ba dang / dpal la sogs pa'i 'byor pa dang / khyim dang dus sbyor ba la sogs pa 'grub pa dang 'jug phod bzang ngan byed pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dus drug pa la sogs pa nas zla tshigs la dbang ba dang / dpal la sogs pa'i 'byor pa dang / khyim dang dus sbyor ba la sogs pa 'grub pa dang 'jug phod bzang ngan byed pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The six times and so on are the lords of the conjunctions, and the prosperity of glory and so on, the accomplishment of the houses, periods, and so on, and the good and bad periods are the lords of the periods.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: de nas klu chen brgyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: de nas klu chen brgyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas klu'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Then, the eight great nāgas and so on teach the nāga maṇḍala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Then and so on is the yoga samādhi.

original: de yang snga ma las klu chen brgyad dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma las klu chen brgyad dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is preceded by the eight great nāgas.

original: klu chen brgyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rang gi skad cig tsam gyis mtshon pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das mnyes par byas te snying po dbul bar zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rang rang gi snying po phul ba /
analyzed: klu chen brgyad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rang gi skad cig tsam gyis mtshon pa'i sgras bcom ldan 'das mnyes par byas te snying po dbul bar zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rang rang gi snying po phul ba /
translated: The eight great nāgas, etc.

original: aom phu: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: aom phu: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: means that by the mere sound of their own names, they pleased the Blessed One and requested the offering of the essence, and the Blessed One, having given his consent, they offered their own essence.

original: aom phu: zhes bya ba'i bar mtha' yas dang / 'jog po dang / karko ta dang rigs ldan dang / nor rgyas dang dung skyong dang padma dang chu lha rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: aom phu: zhes bya ba'i bar mtha' yas dang / 'jog po dang / karko ta dang rigs ldan dang / nor rgyas dang dung skyong dang padma dang chu lha rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Om pūṃ up to Om pūṃ are the essences of Ananta, Śaṅkhapāla, Karkoṭaka, Kulika, Vāsuki, Śaṅkhapālo, Padma, and Varuna.

original: de snga ma bzhin du bshad pas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: de snga ma bzhin du bshad pas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: Since that is explained as before, it teaches the samādhi of the supreme king maṇḍala.

original: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin du las rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: de nas bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni snga ma bzhin du las rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: Then, the gathering and consecration are the samādhi of the supreme action king.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. teaches the ritual of the master.

original: de yang sngon du bsnyen pa dang sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / thig gdab pa dang bcas par bya ba la de nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sngon du bsnyen pa dang sa lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga dang / thig gdab pa dang bcas par bya ba la de nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said then in order to perform the preliminary service, the consecration ritual of the ground, and the drawing of the maṇḍala with lines.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad de /
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad de /
translated: The maṇḍala with eight lotus petals is explained.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa kha dog dkar po de'i lte bar rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo dbu la sbrul mgo bdun mtha' yas pa yod par bri'o //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa kha dog dkar po de'i lte bar rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo dbu la sbrul mgo bdun mtha' yas pa yod par bri'o //
translated: In the center of that white eight-petaled lotus, one should draw the wrathful Vajradhara with seven snake heads at the end.

original: dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas mtha' yas nas chu lha'i bar mthar thug par padma re re la sbrul @267b mgo bdun bdun mgo la yod pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams nas mtha' yas nas chu lha'i bar mthar thug par padma re re la sbrul @267b mgo bdun bdun mgo la yod pa /
translated: Beginning from the northeast, up to Ananta and Varuṇa, on each lotus, there are seven snake heads.

original: chung mas lag pa g-yas pas mgul nas 'khyud par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: chung mas lag pa g-yas pas mgul nas 'khyud par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The wives should be drawn embracing around the neck with the right hand.

original: 'di dag dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang sgo la sogs pa med na ni rgya mtsho chen po la brten pa'i dbang du byas nas dus de la dgongs nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang sgo la sogs pa med na ni rgya mtsho chen po la brten pa'i dbang du byas nas dus de la dgongs nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: If these and the outer maṇḍala, door, and so on are not present, then it is explained with the intention of that time, taking as the basis the great ocean.

original: de'i phyir padma yang chu dang 'dam las skye ste 'di dag kyang padma la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir padma yang chu dang 'dam las skye ste 'di dag kyang padma la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the lotus is born from water and mud, and these are also the very abode of the lotus.

original: gzhan dag tu ni gzhal yas khang dang bcas par yang bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag tu ni gzhal yas khang dang bcas par yang bshad do //
translated: In other (texts), it is explained as being together with the celestial mansion.

original: gzhan yang bum pa brgyad dang / gtor ma dang shin tu mdzes pa'i bshos dang / 'byung po'i gtor ma mar dang 'o ma dang sbrang rtsir bcas par bri'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bum pa brgyad dang / gtor ma dang shin tu mdzes pa'i bshos dang / 'byung po'i gtor ma mar dang 'o ma dang sbrang rtsir bcas par bri'o //
translated: Moreover, one should draw eight vases, a sacrificial cake, a very beautiful oblation, and an oblation for the bhūtas together with ghee, milk, and honey.

original: de nas khrus bya ba sngon du 'gro bas zhugs la ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khrus bya ba sngon du 'gro bas zhugs la ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Then, having gone in with the ablution as the preliminary, one should be endowed with the three meditative stabilizations.

original: sbrul mgo'i phyag rgyas rang gi skad mtshon pa phu: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod de /
analyzed: sbrul mgo'i phyag rgyas rang gi skad mtshon pa phu: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod de /
translated: One should display one's voice with the hood-cobra gesture, saying PHUH JAH HUM VAM HOH.

original: lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya ba snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya ba snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the activities with the hook and so forth as before.

original: de nas bu ni rgyal po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa ston to /
analyzed: de nas bu ni rgyal po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa ston to /
translated: Then, the disciple who is like a son of the king, etc., shows the entry of the disciple.

original: de nas rgyal po dang rgyal rigs rtsa ba'i rgyud du bstan pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor du bcug nas dug gi nyes pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po dang rgyal rigs rtsa ba'i rgyud du bstan pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor du bcug nas dug gi nyes pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, just as in the root tantra, the king and the royal family are introduced into the mandala in order to remove the fault of poison.

original: phu: zhes bya bas drangs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i sngags rnams kyis snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: phu: zhes bya bas drangs pa'i sngar bshad pa'i sngags rnams kyis snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, with the mantras explained above, beginning with “PHU,” the empowerment is conferred as before.

original: de nas aom be'u zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po tsam brjod nas klu rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas aom be'u zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i snying po tsam brjod nas klu rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, having merely recited the essence mantra beginning with “Oṃ bhu,” the nāgas are accomplished.

original: de nas de dag mgu nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas de dag mgu nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: Then, “they are pleased,” and so on, is not explained because it is easy to understand.

original: klu'i dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du dbang thob pa rnams la dngos grub bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: klu'i dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du dbang thob pa rnams la dngos grub bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the accomplishments to those who have obtained empowerment in this very maṇḍala of the nāgas,

original: de nas sgrub pa bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas dngos grub bshad de /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas dngos grub bshad de /
translated: the explanation of the accomplishments is explained by “Then, the accomplishment is explained,” and so on.

original: de yang dang por gnas dpen par khrus byas pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag rdo rje 'dzin par bsams te /
analyzed: de yang dang por gnas dpen par khrus byas pa sngon du 'gro bas bdag rdo rje 'dzin par bsams te /
translated: First, having gone to a solitary place, having performed ablutions, and so on, imagine oneself as Vajradhara.

original: de'i dbul sbrul mgo de las lha rdzas kyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba dkar po bdud rtsi 'bab pa lta bur bsams ta /
analyzed: de'i dbul sbrul mgo de las lha rdzas kyi 'od zer gyi phreng ba dkar po bdud rtsi 'bab pa lta bur bsams ta /
translated: From the head of that snake, imagine a garland of divine light rays like a flowing nectar.

original: phu: zhes bya ba thun mong gi snying po 'bum bzlas la bsnyen pa byas te /
analyzed: phu: zhes bya ba thun mong gi snying po 'bum bzlas la bsnyen pa byas te /
translated: Recite the common essence mantra “PHUH” one hundred thousand times and do the familiarization.

original: de nas klu'i dkyil 'khor bsams te mchod la dug gis zin pa'am /
analyzed: de nas klu'i dkyil 'khor bsams te mchod la dug gis zin pa'am /
translated: Then, having imagined the maṇḍala of the nāgas, make offerings.🔽For someone who is afflicted by poison,

original: g-yan pa'am 'tshe ba la sogs pas zin pa la dbu'i lha rdzas 'od zer gyi phreng bas bkang ste /
analyzed: g-yan pa'am 'tshe ba la sogs pas zin pa la dbu'i lha rdzas 'od zer gyi phreng bas bkang ste /
translated: or who is afflicted by leprosy, or by harm, and so on, fill the head with the garland of divine light rays.

original: de'i don du phu: zhes bya bas klu'i dkyil 'khor bsams te lag pa sbrul mgo'i zhags pa 'dra bas drang zhing @268a * //
analyzed: de'i don du phu: zhes bya bas klu'i dkyil 'khor bsams te lag pa sbrul mgo'i zhags pa 'dra bas drang zhing @268a * //
translated: For that purpose, having imagined the maṇḍala of the nāgas with “PHUH,” draw them out with the hand like a snake-headed noose.

original: phu: zhes brjod la 'od zer gyi rlung gis gtor la /
analyzed: phu: zhes brjod la 'od zer gyi rlung gis gtor la /
translated: Recite “PHUH” and scatter them with the wind of light rays.

original: dang por pags pa /
analyzed: dang por pags pa /
translated: First, the skin;

original: de nas sha dang / tha mar dus pa la gnas pa'i dug rnams phu: zhes bya ba dang sbrul mgos drangs na 'drongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ni sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas sha dang / tha mar dus pa la gnas pa'i dug rnams phu: zhes bya ba dang sbrul mgos drangs na 'drongs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don ni sgrub pa yin no //
translated: then, the flesh; and finally, the poison that resides in the bones is drawn out with “PHUH” and the snake head.

original: de nas las thams cad byed cing dug rims dang dug sbyar ma la sogs kyi dus su snga ma bzhin du spyar na khu tshur gyis kyang 'byin te /
analyzed: de nas las thams cad byed cing dug rims dang dug sbyar ma la sogs kyi dus su snga ma bzhin du spyar na khu tshur gyis kyang 'byin te /
translated: Then, when all actions are performed, if one applies as before at the time of poison, epidemic, and poison-compound, one will remove even with a fist,

original: sbrul mgo'i phyag rgya smos ci dgos //
analyzed: sbrul mgo'i phyag rgya smos ci dgos //
translated: what need to mention the snake-head mudra?

original: zhes bya ba khyad par du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba khyad par du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is said to be especially effective.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jigs byed chen po'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jigs byed chen po'i dkyil 'khor ston to //
translated: Then, etc. indicates the mandala of Mahadeva.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs byed chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs byed chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then, as before, along with the mandala of Mahadeva.

original: lha chen po rnams kyi bdag po 'jigs byed chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jigs byed rang gi 'khor bud med brgyad dang bcas pas bskor bas phyag byas te zhus pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha chen po rnams kyi bdag po 'jigs byed chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'jigs byed rang gi 'khor bud med brgyad dang bcas pas bskor bas phyag byas te zhus pa'i don to //
translated: The lord of the great gods, Mahadeva, etc. means that Mahadeva, surrounded by his retinue of eight women, made obeisance and asked the meaning of the question.

original: skrag cing smyo ba la sogs pa la phan gdags pa'i slad du snying po phul la gsol pa btab pa dang / bshad par gnang nas 'jigs byed chen po kho nas 'jigs pa'i sgra phyung ste smras pa ni aom bhe ra zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: skrag cing smyo ba la sogs pa la phan gdags pa'i slad du snying po phul la gsol pa btab pa dang / bshad par gnang nas 'jigs byed chen po kho nas 'jigs pa'i sgra phyung ste smras pa ni aom bhe ra zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In order to benefit those who are frightened, insane, and so forth, the essence of the mantra was requested and permission to explain was granted.

original: aom ba sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: aom ba sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
translated: Then, Mahābhairava alone uttered a frightening sound and said, Om bheru up to Om vasva ha.

original: 'jigs byed chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / brgya byin dang / gzhon nu ka rti ka dang / bhridgi ri ti dang / stobs bzangs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po khros pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'jigs byed chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / brgya byin dang / gzhon nu ka rti ka dang / bhridgi ri ti dang / stobs bzangs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po khros pa dang bcas pa /
translated: This is the essence of Mahābhairava, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Indra, Kumāra Kārttikeya, Bhṛṅgiriṭi, Vṛtra, and the angry Gaṇapati.

original: chung ma dang bcas pa rnams kyi snying po yin te /
analyzed: chung ma dang bcas pa rnams kyi snying po yin te /
translated: It is the essence of those with their wives.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin ston te gang gi phyir 'jigs byed chen po kho nas smras she na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog gi ting nge 'dzin ston te gang gi phyir 'jigs byed chen po kho nas smras she na /
translated: The samādhi of the supreme king of maṇḍalas is taught. Why is it that Mahābhairava alone spoke?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jigs byed chen po ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jigs byed chen po ni /
translated: The Bhagavān Mahābhairava

original: brgyad po de dag bdag ngag nyan //
analyzed: brgyad po de dag bdag ngag nyan //
translated: listened to my words.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ngag nyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ngag nyan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, because he is the principal one, he is the one who listens to speech.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The third meditative concentration should be understood in the same way.🔽Then, the master's activities are taught beginning with then, the maṇḍala of those is explained.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te de bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa thams cad byas pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i nang du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa bris
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te de bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa thams cad byas pa phyi'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i nang du 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa lte ba dang bcas pa bris
translated: Having performed all the preliminaries such as that, inside the drawn outer maṇḍala, an eight-spoked wheel with a hub is drawn.

original: nas / rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo 'jigs byed chen po chung ma dang bcas pa zhabs 'og tu non par bri /
analyzed: nas / rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo 'jigs byed chen po chung ma dang bcas pa zhabs 'og tu non par bri /
translated: In the lower part, Vajradhara, the great terrifying one, is drawn with his consort, trampling on the feet.

original: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs su brgya byin la sogs pa /🔽lho'i phyogs kyi rtsibs @268b la tshangs pa khros pa /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs su brgya byin la sogs pa / lho'i phyogs kyi rtsibs @268b la tshangs pa khros pa /
translated: In the eastern spoke, Indra, and so on,🔽in the southern spoke, angry Brahmā,

original: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la gtogs 'dod khros pa /🔽byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la gzhon nu karti ka khros pa /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la gtogs 'dod khros pa / byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la gzhon nu karti ka khros pa /
translated: in the western spoke, angry Viṣṇu,🔽in the northern spoke, angry Kumāra Kārttikeya,

original: shar lho'i rtsibs la tshogs kyi bdag po khros pa /
analyzed: shar lho'i rtsibs la tshogs kyi bdag po khros pa /
translated: in the southeastern spoke, angry Gaṇeśa,

original: lho nub kyi mtshams su bhridgi ri ti khros pa /🔽nub byang gi mtshams su dga' byed dbang phyug khros pa /
analyzed: lho nub kyi mtshams su bhridgi ri ti khros pa / nub byang gi mtshams su dga' byed dbang phyug khros pa /
translated: In the southwest corner, Bhrkutī is enraged.🔽In the northwest corner, Manibhadra is enraged.

original: byang shar gyi rtsibs la stobs bzangs khros pa chung ma dang bcas ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang shar gyi rtsibs la stobs bzangs khros pa chung ma dang bcas ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: On the spoke in the northeast, Subhadra is enraged, together with his wife.

original: rgyud 'dir ni lha rnams kyi kha dog dang phyag mtshan dang gdan dang dbyibs la sogs ba ma bstan pa ni 'gro ba 'dul ba rnams kyi phyag mtshan la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud 'dir ni lha rnams kyi kha dog dang phyag mtshan dang gdan dang dbyibs la sogs ba ma bstan pa ni 'gro ba 'dul ba rnams kyi phyag mtshan la sogs pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: In this Tantra, the colors, implements, seats, shapes, and so forth of the deities are not taught, because the implements and so forth of the deities who tame migrators are not definite.

original: yang dkyil 'khor du dgod pa'i dus su ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan rnams las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor du dgod pa'i dus su ni bya ba dang spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud gzhan rnams las shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, at the time of arranging the mandala, one should know the actions, conduct, and so forth from other Action, Conduct, and Yoga Tantras.

original: 'dir yang sgo ba rnams ni khro ba dang ldan par bri la /
analyzed: 'dir yang sgo ba rnams ni khro ba dang ldan par bri la /
translated: Here, the gatekeepers are drawn with wrathful expressions.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa rnams gzhag par bya'o //
translated: As explained above, the vases and so forth should be arranged.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pas sgo dbye ba la sogs pa lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya ste khrag gis bkang pa'i thod pas mchod pa dang / sha chang gi gtor ma dang / snod mgo'i thod rnams khrag chang gis bkang ba gzhag / bum pa brgyad 'jigs byed kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyis mchod cing phyi rol du gtor ma byin la gnang ba nod pa'i bar du bya'o //🔽de nas 'jig rten gsum rgyal po'i //
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang ldan pas sgo dbye ba la sogs pa lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya ste khrag gis bkang pa'i thod pas mchod pa dang / sha chang gi gtor ma dang / snod mgo'i thod rnams khrag chang gis bkang ba gzhag / bum pa brgyad 'jigs byed kyis byin gyis brlabs pa rnams kyis mchod cing phyi rol du gtor ma byin la gnang ba nod pa'i bar du bya'o // de nas 'jig rten gsum rgyal po'i //
translated: One should make offerings with the eight vases consecrated by Bhairava, give sacrificial cakes outside, and take the permission.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa ton to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa ton to //
translated: Then, with “The Victorious One over the Three Worlds,” and so forth, one should recite the entrance of the disciple.

original: slob dpon gyi las rnams kyi rjes thogs la 'dir 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ni drag po yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum rgyal gyi phyag rgyas sngar bshad pa bzhin du bcug la /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las rnams kyi rjes thogs la 'dir 'jug pa'i phyag rgya ni drag po yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten gsum rgyal gyi phyag rgyas sngar bshad pa bzhin du bcug la /
translated: Immediately after the rites of the master, here the entrance seal is the Victorious One over the Three Worlds, as explained previously, because it is fierce.

original: bum pa'am mgo'i thod pa brgyad kyi khrag lce la myang du gzhug cing dbang bskur ba thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa'am mgo'i thod pa brgyad kyi khrag lce la myang du gzhug cing dbang bskur ba thams cad kyis dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The eight skull-cups are the skull-cups of a man, woman, ox, elephant, horse, dog, lion, and a Brahmin.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang thob pa la sbyin par ston to //🔽de nas dang por re zhig bud med kyi khyim mam /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang thob pa la sbyin par ston to // de nas dang por re zhig bud med kyi khyim mam /
translated: Then, etc. shows that the gift is to be given to one who has received initiation in this very mandala.
