original: shing gcig par lce dang lag pa byin rlabs nas brtsams te 'jig rten gsum rgyal du bskyed nas mchod de /
analyzed: shing gcig par lce dang lag pa byin rlabs nas brtsams te 'jig rten gsum rgyal du bskyed nas mchod de /
translated: Then, first of all, in a woman's house or under a solitary tree, having consecrated his tongue and hand, he should generate the Three Worlds, worship them,

original: aom bhee ra zhes bya ba 'bum phrag bzhir bzlas pa nas tha mar mtshan yal nas su gnas te de nas sgra thos nas khrag gi thod pa phul te 'jigs byed de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aom bhee ra zhes bya ba 'bum phrag bzhir bzlas pa nas tha mar mtshan yal nas su gnas te de nas sgra thos nas khrag gi thod pa phul te 'jigs byed de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and recite the mantra Om bhairva four hundred thousand times. At the end, when the night is gone, he should remain, and then, hearing a sound, he should offer the skull-cup of blood. He will see Bhairava.

original: khams gsum rnam @269a * //
analyzed: khams gsum rnam @269a * //
translated: The Three Worlds are the desire, form, and formless worlds.

original: rgyal h'um zhes bya ba dran par byed cing thod pa bkang ste yang phul na grub nas ci 'dod ces bya bar smra bar byed de sa sbyin pa ma gtogs par khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi nga rgyal du bsgoms pas gsol ba btab na khu ba la sogs
analyzed: rgyal h'um zhes bya ba dran par byed cing thod pa bkang ste yang phul na grub nas ci 'dod ces bya bar smra bar byed de sa sbyin pa ma gtogs par khams gsum rnam rgyal gyi nga rgyal du bsgoms pas gsol ba btab na khu ba la sogs
translated: If one recalls the name of the king Hum, and again offers the skull filled with blood, then having become accomplished, he will say, “What do you desire?”🔽If one supplicates him, he will give everything, blood, etc.,

original: pa thams cad sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: pa thams cad sbyin par byed do //
translated: except for earth, by meditating on the pride of the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: mi skrag par bya ste skrang na de ma thag tu gsod do //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha chen po rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: mi skrag par bya ste skrang na de ma thag tu gsod do // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha chen po rnams kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: One should not be afraid of him, for if one swells up, he will kill one immediately.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te tshangs pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽tshangs pa la sogs pa lha chen po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin te tshangs pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o // tshangs pa la sogs pa lha chen po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Then, as before, with Brahma, etc.🔽The great gods, etc.

original: lha chen po rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la phyag byas te zhus pa'i don rang gi snying po bshad par 'dod pa la byin gyis brlab par gsol ba btab nas /
analyzed: lha chen po rnams kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa la phyag byas te zhus pa'i don rang gi snying po bshad par 'dod pa la byin gyis brlab par gsol ba btab nas /
translated: The great gods, etc., having bowed to the vajra-holder, having supplicated the meaning of the request, and having been blessed by the desire to explain the essence of the great gods, etc.,

original: rang gi snying po smras pa zhes bya ba nas kra zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par te dbang phyug chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / brgya byin dang / gtogs 'dod dang / gzhon nu kati ka dang tshogs kyi bdag po dang bhridgi ti ti dang stobs bzangs rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: rang gi snying po smras pa zhes bya ba nas kra zhes bya ba'i mthar thug par te dbang phyug chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / brgya byin dang / gtogs 'dod dang / gzhon nu kati ka dang tshogs kyi bdag po dang bhridgi ti ti dang stobs bzangs rnams kyi yin no //
translated: They are of Maheśvara, Brahmā, Indra, Viṣṇu, Kumāra, Gaṇapati, Bhṛṅgiriṭi, and Vīra.

original: 'di'i bshad pa snga ma bzhin dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa snga ma bzhin dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The explanation of this is the same as before.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The third meditative absorption should be understood in the same way.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan to //
translated: Then, etc. teaches the ritual of the master.

original: bsnyen pa la sogs pa thams cad byas la de nas tshe dpag tu med pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa bris la /
analyzed: bsnyen pa la sogs pa thams cad byas la de nas tshe dpag tu med pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa bris la /
translated: Having performed all the rites of propitiation, etc., then, like in the Amitāyus [sādhana], one should draw a four-spoked wheel maṇḍala.

original: lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo /
analyzed: lte ba la rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo /
translated: In the center, one should draw the wrathful Vajradhara.

original: shar gyi rtsibs la dbang phyug chen po //
analyzed: shar gyi rtsibs la dbang phyug chen po //
translated: On the eastern spoke, Maheśvara.

original: lho'i rtsibs la brgya byin /
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs la brgya byin /
translated: On the southern spoke, Indra.

original: nub kyi rtsibs la tshangs pa /
analyzed: nub kyi rtsibs la tshangs pa /
translated: Brahma on the western spoke,

original: byang gi rtsibs la gtogs 'dod ;
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs la gtogs 'dod ;
translated: and Kamadeva on the northern spoke.

original: rang rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa bri ste lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi yang khros pa dang bcas pa bris la /
analyzed: rang rang gi chung ma dang bcas pa bri ste lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi yang khros pa dang bcas pa bris la /
translated: Each is drawn with his wife, and the four beginning with the iron hook are drawn with anger.🔽Outside the mandala, beginning from the northeast, one should place Subhadra, Ganapati, Bhrngiriti, and Kumara Kārtikeya.🔽All the birds, vases, and so forth are also placed as before.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du dbang ldan gyi mtshams nas brtsams nas stobs bzangs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po dang / bhridgi ri ti dang / gzhon nu karti ka gzhag / bya dang bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang snga ma bzhin du gzhag / de nas zhugs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang phyag rgya bzhis rgyas bdab pa la sogs pa mchod pa'i mthar thug pa thams cad
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du dbang ldan gyi mtshams nas brtsams nas stobs bzangs dang / tshogs kyi bdag po dang / bhridgi ri ti dang / gzhon nu karti ka gzhag / bya dang bum pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang snga ma bzhin du gzhag / de nas zhugs pa sngon du 'gro bas ting nge 'dzin gsum dang phyag rgya bzhis rgyas bdab pa la sogs pa mchod pa'i mthar thug pa thams cad
translated: Then, having gone through the entrance ritual, one should make all the offerings up to the conclusion of the offering, such as the three meditative stabilizations, the extensive mudra offering, and so forth,

original: dga' ba chen pos mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen pos mchod par bya'o //
translated: with great joy.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa ni //
translated: Then, the vajra holder

original: zhes bya ba la @269b sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa'i las la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @269b sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa'i las la sogs pa ston to //
translated: and so forth teaches the ritual of inducting the disciple and so forth.

original: 'dir rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya bcings la snga ma bzhin du bcug nas /
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya bcings la snga ma bzhin du bcug nas /
translated: Here, having bound the mudra of the vajra holder and entered as before,

original: aom pra t'i tstsha zhes bya ba la sogs pas me tog dor ba /
analyzed: aom pra t'i tstsha zhes bya ba la sogs pas me tog dor ba /
translated: with “Oṃ pratīccha” and so on, one should scatter flowers,

original: mig dbye ba /
analyzed: mig dbye ba /
translated: open the eyes,

original: bstan par bya ba la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba la sogs pa thams cad snga ma bzhin du'o //
translated: and show the mandala and so on, all as before.

original: de nas sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pa brgyad kyis dbang bskur /
analyzed: de nas sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pa brgyad kyis dbang bskur /
translated: Then one should confer empowerment with the eight vases empowered by mantra.

original: dbang bskur ba lhag ma yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad ba bzhin shes par bya'o //🔽de nas lha rnams gang dga' ba'i //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba lhag ma yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad ba bzhin shes par bya'o // de nas lha rnams gang dga' ba'i //
translated: One should understand the remaining empowerments according to the explanation in the Root Tantra.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pa la dngos grub sbyin pa ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pa la dngos grub sbyin pa ston to //
translated: Then, “whatever deities are pleased” and so on teaches the bestowal of spiritual powers to those who have obtained empowerment and the sacred pledges in this very life.

original: gang la dga' ba'i sngags byin la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa bsams te 'bum phrag gnyis bsnyen pa byas nas shes pa'i gnas su dkyil 'khor chen po bsams te bsgrubs na nas phyed na lha 'ongs nas ci 'dod pa sbyin gyis soms te smros shig
analyzed: gang la dga' ba'i sngags byin la snga ma bzhin du rdo rje 'dzin pa bsams te 'bum phrag gnyis bsnyen pa byas nas shes pa'i gnas su dkyil 'khor chen po bsams te bsgrubs na nas phyed na lha 'ongs nas ci 'dod pa sbyin gyis soms te smros shig
translated: Having given the mantra of one's choice, one should imagine oneself as Vajradhara as before, and having performed the familiarization of two hundred thousand [recitations], one should imagine the great mandala in the place of knowledge and accomplish it.🔽When the deity arrives at midnight, one should think of what one desires and speak.

original: / de nas lha la gsol ba ci 'dod pa gdab bo /
analyzed: / de nas lha la gsol ba ci 'dod pa gdab bo /
translated: Then, one should make a request to the deity of what one desires.

original: de nas bla ma dang slob dpon la cha re dbul ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bla ma dang slob dpon la cha re dbul ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should offer a portion to the guru and master, as explained in the root tantra.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu gnyis po mtha' dag tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lam bco lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mtha' dag kyang bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor bcu gnyis po mtha' dag tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu lam bco lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mtha' dag kyang bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: From Then and so forth, the result of entering the entire twelve-part supramundane mandala, the fifteen paths, and all mundane qualities are taught, but since they are easy to understand, they are not explained.

original: 'jig rten pa'i drug bar du ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i drug bar du ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the six mundane [qualities] taught in the middle?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang sku gsum dang rigs gsum gyi bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang sku gsum dang rigs gsum gyi bsdus pa'o //
translated: All the qualities of the Buddha are included in the three bodies and the three families.

original: de yang kun rig dang / gtsug tor dag /
analyzed: de yang kun rig dang / gtsug tor dag /
translated: Moreover, the three mandalas of the Sarvatathagata-kâya-vâk-citta-guhya-sarva-samaya-râja, the Usnîsavisnu,

original: tshe dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi bstan pa de dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang por ston to //
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum gyi bstan pa de dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang por ston to //
translated: and the Amitâyus are taught first in order to realize those teachings of the three mandalas.

original: de nas de dag la 'jug pa yang byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i sa yan chad thob pa yin pas sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa thob pa'i rang bzhin can rgyal po bzhi dang phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor dang dbang dang dam tshig dang gtso bor gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: de nas de dag la 'jug pa yang byang chub sems dpa' mos pa'i sa yan chad thob pa yin pas sbyor ba'i lam la gnas pa thob pa'i rang bzhin can rgyal po bzhi dang phyogs skyong bcu dang / gza' chen po brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor dang dbang dang dam tshig dang gtso bor gyur pa ston to //
translated: Then, in order to enter into those, since the bodhisattvas have attained the stage of conviction and so forth, the mandalas of the four kings, the ten directions protectors, and the eight great planets, which are the nature of attaining the stage of abiding on the path of preparation, are taught as the chief initiations, pledges, and principals.

original: sbyor ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin la gzhan gyi don byed pa gtso bor 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel ba'i rang bzhin la gzhan gyi don byed pa gtso bor 'gyur bas /
translated: Since the nature of the path of preparation is connected with realization, it becomes the chief activity for the benefit of others.

original: klu chen po brgyad dang 'jigs byed chen po dang / lha chen po'i dkyil 'khor gtso bor gyur pa bstan to //🔽de dag byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas @270a * //
analyzed: klu chen po brgyad dang 'jigs byed chen po dang / lha chen po'i dkyil 'khor gtso bor gyur pa bstan to // de dag byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas @270a * //
translated: The eight great nāgas, the great fearful ones, and the principal ones of the maṇḍala of the great gods are taught.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “the bodhisattvas abiding on the ground of practice through belief.”

original: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: Moreover, in the root tantra it says:

original: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang rgyal po bzhi dang 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nor bu bzang po dang nor bzangs po chen po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa rnams dang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang rgyal po bzhi dang 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po nor bu bzang po dang nor bzangs po chen po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa rnams dang zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then the sons of the gods such as Śakra and Brahmā, the four kings, the eight guardians of the world, the twenty-eight great generals of the yakṣas, the great generals of the yakṣas such as Maṇibhadra and Mahābhadra, and so on, who abide on the bodhisattva levels.

original: de nas yang sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sku gsung thugs nyid du 'byung bas 'chi bdag 'joms pa gsung dang / bde ba chen po sku dang / khro bo thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te gsum gyis bshad do //
analyzed: de nas yang sa bcu dang sangs rgyas kyi sa la sku gsung thugs nyid du 'byung bas 'chi bdag 'joms pa gsung dang / bde ba chen po sku dang / khro bo thugs kyi dkyil 'khor te gsum gyis bshad do //
translated: Then, since the body, speech, and mind arise on the ten stages and the stage of buddhahood, the explanation is by three: the mandala of speech that conquers the Lord of Death, the mandala of the body of great bliss, and the mandala of the mind of wrath.

original: de ltar na rgyu 'bras kyi go rims su bshad nas zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu 'bras kyi go rims su bshad nas zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, it is explained in the order of cause and effect.

original: grangs kyang nges pa 'di tsam gyis bstan to //
analyzed: grangs kyang nges pa 'di tsam gyis bstan to //
translated: The number is also taught by just this much.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor drug bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa'i dkyil 'khor drug bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the six worldly mandalas in that way,

original: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chib bdag 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chib bdag 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: now, from “Then,” and so on, the mandala that conquers the Lord of Death is taught.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: “ Then” is the immediate continuation of the first application, as before.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gzigs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthu chen po'i rig bshad du gsol zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gzigs nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mthu chen po'i rig bshad du gsol zhes bya ba sbyar ro //
translated: “ The Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi himself, having seen the retinue mandala,” and so on, is applied to “please explain the great power.”

original: de yang phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis 'khor la gzigs te 'dzum pa dang / 'khor g-yos pa dang / 'gul ba dang / 'bar ba dang / dgod pa dang / rtse ba dang rmad kyi ya mtshan snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de yang phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis 'khor la gzigs te 'dzum pa dang / 'khor g-yos pa dang / 'gul ba dang / 'bar ba dang / dgod pa dang / rtse ba dang rmad kyi ya mtshan snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi himself looked at the retinue and smiled, and the retinue shook, trembled, blazed, laughed, played, and wondrous marvels appeared.

original: de la lha rnams dam par gyur nas phyag 'tshal te 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu dris pa dang / phyag na rdo rjes gsan nas lha rnams la 'chi bdag 'joms bar byed pa'i rig pa thos sam zhes bka' stsal pa dang / phyag 'tshal zhing mgu zhing dang ba'i dad pa skyes te legs so zhes bya ba sngon du 'gro bas tshe bsring zhing 'chi bdag zhi bar bya ba dang ngan song grol bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la lha rnams dam par gyur nas phyag 'tshal te 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu dris pa dang / phyag na rdo rjes gsan nas lha rnams la 'chi bdag 'joms bar byed pa'i rig pa thos sam zhes bka' stsal pa dang / phyag 'tshal zhing mgu zhing dang ba'i dad pa skyes te legs so zhes bya ba sngon du 'gro bas tshe bsring zhing 'chi bdag zhi bar bya ba dang ngan song grol bar bya ba dang /
translated: Then the gods, having become the best, prostrated, and asked the reason for the smile. Vajrapāṇi heard and said to the gods, “Have you heard the vidyā that conquers the Lord of Death?” They prostrated, and with the exclamation “Excellent!” that preceded their joy and faith, they asked, “Please extend our life spans and pacify the Lord of Death and liberate us from the lower realms.”

original: 'khor ba spangs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bgyi ba'i slad du rig pa bshad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba spangs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bgyi ba'i slad du rig pa bshad du gsol zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: Please explain the knowledge for the sake of abandoning cyclic existence and attaining unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: snga ma ni tshe 'di la gnas pa'i don du bshad pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni tshe 'di la gnas pa'i don du bshad pa kho na yin la /
translated: The former was explained only for the purpose of abiding in this life,

original: 'di ni 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka nas thams cad yin pa'i phyir khyad par de yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dang phyi ma gnyis ka nas thams cad yin pa'i phyir khyad par de yod do //
translated: but this one is superior because it is for the sake of both this and the next life.🔽Then the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, having heard the words of the request of the gods,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes lha rnams kyis gsol ba'i tshig gsan nas zhes bya ba ni sngar gsol ba @270b btab pa'i tshig gsan nas so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes lha rnams kyis gsol ba'i tshig gsan nas zhes bya ba ni sngar gsol ba @270b btab pa'i tshig gsan nas so //
translated: means that having heard the words of the previous request,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po rig sngags 'di nyid sku gsung thugs rdo rje las phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rig sngags 'di nyis sku las 'od zer /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po rig sngags 'di nyid sku gsung thugs rdo rje las phyung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rig sngags 'di nyis sku las 'od zer /
translated: this knowledge essence of all the tathāgatas was brought forth from the vajra body, speech, and mind. The meaning is that from the body, light rays;

original: gsung las sgra /
analyzed: gsung las sgra /
translated: from the speech, sound;

original: thugs las nges pa'i ye shes phyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: thugs las nges pa'i ye shes phyung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: and from the mind, definitive pristine awareness were brought forth.

original: / de nyid aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de nyid aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That itself is “om punye” and so forth.

original: snying po rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying po ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: snying po rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying po ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The essence is knowledge. The essence is the five gnoses.

original: de nyid ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rig pa'o //
translated: That itself is knowledge.

original: de ston pa'i sgra la yang de skad ces gdags so //
analyzed: de ston pa'i sgra la yang de skad ces gdags so //
translated: The sound that teaches that is designated in that way.

original: 'dis ni thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor la bri ba'i rig pa dang bzlas brjod du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor la bri ba'i rig pa dang bzlas brjod du bya ba bstan to //
translated: This teaches the knowledge to be drawn in the maṇḍala of light of all and the recitation.

original: aom dhi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom dhi sv'a h'a /
translated: Om dhi svāhā.

original: nye ba'i snying po'i rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum pa'i rgyu'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po'i rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum pa'i rgyu'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The essence of the knowledge is the cause of the direct realization, the vajra-like samādhi.

original: de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The sound of that is as before.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i snying po'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i snying po'o //
translated: The essence of Vajrapāṇi.

original: aom bhrum sv'a h'a snying po'o //
analyzed: aom bhrum sv'a h'a snying po'o //
translated: Om bhrūṃ svāhā. The essence.

original: nye ba'i snying po rig pa zhes byas pa la snying po ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po rig pa zhes byas pa la snying po ni gzugs kyi sku'o //
translated: The essence is the form body.

original: nye ba'i snying po ni rig pa'o//
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po ni rig pa'o//
translated: The essence is knowledge.

original: mngon sum pa'i rgyu ye shes te de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum pa'i rgyu ye shes te de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The cause of the direct realization is gnosis. The sound of that is as before.

original: gtso bo ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ni rig pa'o //
translated: The principal is knowledge.

original: aom grum sv'a h'a snying po yang dag par bskul ba'o zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes thugs yang dag par bskul ba'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: aom grum sv'a h'a snying po yang dag par bskul ba'o zhes bya ba ni thugs rjes thugs yang dag par bskul ba'i rig pa'o //
translated: Oṃ grūṃ svāhā. The essence is invoked is the knowledge of the mind being invoked by compassion.

original: de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i sgra yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The sound is the same as before.

original: khro bo'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rig pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the wrathful one.

original: aom tram sv'a h'a snying po dam ba'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te sgral yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: aom tram sv'a h'a snying po dam ba'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te sgral yang de bzhin no //
translated: Oṃ traṃ svāhā. The essence is excellent is the gnosis of equanimity. The sound is the same as before.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i rig pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of Ākāśagarbha.

original: aom hri sv'am h'a /
analyzed: aom hri sv'am h'a /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ svāhā.

original: gsang ba'i snying po'o zhes bya ba ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes te spyan ras gzigs kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i snying po'o zhes bya ba ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes te spyan ras gzigs kyi rig pa'o //
translated: The secret essence is the gnosis of discernment. This is the knowledge of Avalokiteśvara.

original: 'di dag gis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to ;
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan to ;
translated: By these, the samādhi of the supreme king maṇḍala is taught.

original: / snga ma bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / snga ma bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is one should meditate as before.

original: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin ni snga ma bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The samādhi of the supreme king of actions should be understood as before.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan te snga ma bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris te /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bstan te zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las bstan te snga ma bzhin du bsnyen pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris te /
translated: Having previously gone for refuge and generated bodhicitta, one should draw the outer maṇḍala as before.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor du 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi ba bris la dbul su de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dang tshogs dang gzi brjid tshad med pa gzhag pa bhr'um zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor du 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi ba bris la dbul su de bzhin gshegs pa tshe dang tshogs dang gzi brjid tshad med pa gzhag pa bhr'um zhes bya bas so //
translated: In the inner maṇḍala, one should draw a four-spoked wheel. In the center, one should place the Tathāgata Amitāyus, with the essence BHRŪM.

original: spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje ste hri zhes bya ba'i snying pos gzhag go //🔽byang phyogs su khro bo ste krum @271a * //
analyzed: spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje ste hri zhes bya ba'i snying pos gzhag go // byang phyogs su khro bo ste krum @271a * //
translated: In front, one should place Vajrapāṇi, with the essence HRĪḤ.

original: zhes bya ba'i snying pos so //🔽lho phyogs su nam mkha' snying po'i snying po ste /🔽tram zhes bya ba'i snying pos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i snying pos so // lho phyogs su nam mkha' snying po'i snying po ste / tram zhes bya ba'i snying pos so //
translated: In the north, one should place Krodha, with the essence KṢUM.🔽In the south, one should place Ākāśagarbha, with the essence TRAM.

original: nub phyogs su spyan ras gzigs te hri zhes bya ba'i snying pos so //
analyzed: nub phyogs su spyan ras gzigs te hri zhes bya ba'i snying pos so //
translated: In the west, one should place Avalokiteśvara, with the essence HRĪḤ.

original: kun gyi 'od la aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig pa bri'o //
analyzed: kun gyi 'od la aom pu n+ye zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig pa bri'o //
translated: In all the lights, one should write the awareness mantras Oṃ puṇye, etc.

original: dbang bskur ba'i bum pa lnga dang / mchod pa'i bum pa brgyad dang / tram zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi bzlas brjod byas te gzhag go //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i bum pa lnga dang / mchod pa'i bum pa brgyad dang / tram zhes bya ba'i sngags kyi bzlas brjod byas te gzhag go //
translated: The five vases for the consecration, the eight vases for the offerings, and the mantra recitation of TRAM should be placed.

original: bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod rdzas kun la /
analyzed: bdug pa la sogs pa'i mchod rdzas kun la /
translated: For all the offering substances such as incense,

original: krum zhes bya ba'i bzlas pas gzhag /
analyzed: krum zhes bya ba'i bzlas pas gzhag /
translated: the recitation of TRUM should be placed.

original: gzhan yang mchod pa'i lha mo brgyad dang sgo ba bzhi snga ma bzhin du bri'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mchod pa'i lha mo brgyad dang sgo ba bzhi snga ma bzhin du bri'o //
translated: Furthermore, the eight offering goddesses and the four gatekeepers should be drawn as before.

original: de nas / dgongs ka'i dus la bab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de nas sngags mkhan bdag nyid zhugs la bde bar gshegs pa sras dang 'bangs su bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor te rig pa dang lhan cig spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: de nas / dgongs ka'i dus la bab pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de nas sngags mkhan bdag nyid zhugs la bde bar gshegs pa sras dang 'bangs su bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor te rig pa dang lhan cig spyan drang ngo //
translated: Then, when the time of evening arrives, means that then the mantra practitioner himself should enter, and together with the knowledge, invite the Sugata surrounded by the retinue of sons and subjects.

original: de nas bdag nyid dbang bskur te //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid dbang bskur te //
translated: Then, having consecrated oneself,

original: skyil krung bcas te 'dug la stong phrag brgyar bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: skyil krung bcas te 'dug la stong phrag brgyar bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa'am rdo rje 'dzin pa'am /
translated: sitting cross-legged, if one recites one thousand times, one will become a Tathagata or a Vajra Holder.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug kyang rung ste mngon sum du mthong nas 'dod pa'i mtshan ma so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug kyang rung ste mngon sum du mthong nas 'dod pa'i mtshan ma so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see either Vajradhara or Avalokiteśvara in person and obtain the desired signs.

original: ci ste mnyam par ma bzhag na yid kyis thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mnyam par ma bzhag na yid kyis thams cad nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not in equipoise, one will be able to do everything mentally.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
translated: Then, having formed the mudrā of Vajradhātvīśvarī,

original: aom badzra dh'a ra /
analyzed: aom badzra dh'a ra /
translated: one should generate the pride with the mantra Oṃ vajra-dhara,

original: ratna dh'a ra /
analyzed: ratna dh'a ra /
translated: ratna-dhara,

original: padma dh'a ra /
analyzed: padma dh'a ra /
translated: padma-dhara,

original: bi shva dh'a ra /
analyzed: bi shva dh'a ra /
translated: viśva-dhara,🔽tathāgata-samaya-mati-krama-tathāgata-samaya-dhara ātmako’haṃ.

original: ta th'a ga ta sa ma ya ma ti kra ma tha ta th'a ga ta sa ma ya dh'a ra a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal bskyed la zhes bya ba ni sngags pa nyid zhugs la lhag chad zhi bar byas nas ting nge 'dzin gsum sngon🔽du 'gro bas sgo phye ste /
analyzed: ta th'a ga ta sa ma ya ma ti kra ma tha ta th'a ga ta sa ma ya dh'a ra a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal bskyed la zhes bya ba ni sngags pa nyid zhugs la lhag chad zhi bar byas nas ting nge 'dzin gsum sngon du 'gro bas sgo phye ste /
translated: Having entered into the state of mantra recitation, having corrected any omissions or additions, having opened the door with the three samādhis as the preliminary,

original: rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa rig pa dang lhan cig spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa rig pa dang lhan cig spyan drang ngo //
translated: one should invite the victors together with their spiritual heirs and the awareness beings.

original: de nas lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya /
analyzed: de nas lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya /
translated: Then, one should perform the rites with the hook and so forth.

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab /
translated: One should seal with the four mudrās.

original: dbang bskur / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg dang gnang ba nong pa'i bar du bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg dang gnang ba nong pa'i bar du bya'o //
translated: One should confer initiation, recite [mantras], make offerings, offer sacrificial cakes, perform fire offerings, and receive permission.

original: de nas slob ma 'jug pa'i cho gas zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas slob ma 'jug pa'i cho gas zhugs te /
translated: Then, having entered by the rite of inducting the disciples,

original: bdag nyid dbang nyi shu rtsa gcig bskur nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid dbang nyi shu rtsa gcig bskur nas /
translated: having conferred the twenty-one initiations on oneself,

original: skyil krung bcas nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo mngon sum du mthong nas 'bras bu mchog thob po //
analyzed: skyil krung bcas nas 'bum bzlas na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo mngon sum du mthong nas 'bras bu mchog thob po //
translated: having sat cross-legged, and having recited [mantras] one hundred thousand times, one will see the principal deity of the mandala, such as the Tathāgata, face to face, and will attain the supreme fruit.

original: bzlas brjod ma byas kyang yid kyis las thams cad byed nus bar @271b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas brjod ma byas kyang yid kyis las thams cad byed nus bar @271b 'gyur ro //
translated: Even without reciting [mantras], one will be able to perform all activities mentally.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings nas /
translated: Then, having formed the Vajradhara mudrā,

original: rdo rje 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin gyi phyag rgyas 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: one should enter with the Vajradhara mudrā, or

original: rin chen 'dzin dang / padma 'dzin dang / khro bo dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jug pa ni nga yin zhes nga rgyal bskyed la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rin chen 'dzin dang / padma 'dzin dang / khro bo dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jug pa ni nga yin zhes nga rgyal bskyed la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should generate pride, thinking, “I am the one who enters with the Ratnadhara, Padmadhara, Krodha, and Tathāgata mudrās.”

original: de nas slob ma rnams gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du ye shes dbab pa'i mthar thug pa byas la 'dir me tog dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slob ma rnams gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa ston te de yang rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du ye shes dbab pa'i mthar thug pa byas la 'dir me tog dor bar bya'o //
translated: One should perform the descent of the awarenesses as explained in the Root Tantra, and here one should cast the flowers.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pra t'i tstsha ho sa ma ya stv'am /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pra t'i tstsha ho sa ma ya stv'am /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata praticcha hoḥ samaya stvam

original: de nyid brjod la mgo la bcings gdong g-yogs dgrol //
analyzed: de nyid brjod la mgo la bcings gdong g-yogs dgrol //
translated: Reciting that, tie it on the head and remove the blindfold.

original: lha ngo bstan 'jug pa'i phyag rgya snying gar bstan /
analyzed: lha ngo bstan 'jug pa'i phyag rgya snying gar bstan /
translated: Show the deity’s form, display the entrance mudra at the heart,🔽and confer the empowerment.

original: dbang bskur bar bya ste snga ma bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sgor ba zhag la /
analyzed: dbang bskur bar bya ste snga ma bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sgor ba zhag la /
translated: As before, at the eastern door,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinytsa badzra dh'a tu aa dzny'a h'um bhr'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi shinytsa badzra dh'a tu aa dzny'a h'um bhr'um /
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata abhiṣiñca vajra dhātu a jñāna hūṃ bhrūṃ

original: zhes bya ba dang gtso bo'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang gtso bo'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Recite that and confer the empowerment with the principal’s vase.

original: aom badzra badzra aabhi shinytsa h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra badzra aabhi shinytsa h'um h'um /
translated: oṃ vajra vajra abhiṣiñca hūṃ hūṃ

original: zhes byas pas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: zhes byas pas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Recite that and confer the empowerment with the Vajradhara vase.

original: aom ratna aa bhi shinytsa h'um tram /
analyzed: aom ratna aa bhi shinytsa h'um tram /
translated: Oṃ ratnābhiṣiñca hūṃ traṃ.

original: zhes bya bas nam mkha'i snying po'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas nam mkha'i snying po'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: With this, one should confer the empowerment with the vase of Akāśagarbha.

original: aom padma aa bhe shinytsa h'um hr'i:/
analyzed: aom padma aa bhe shinytsa h'um hr'i:/
translated: Oṃ padmābha iṣiñca hūṃ hrīḥ.

original: zhes pas spyan ras gzigs kyi bum pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: zhes pas spyan ras gzigs kyi bum pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: With this, one should confer the empowerment with the vase of Avalokiteśvara.

original: de nas karma aa bhi shinytsa h'um krum zhes bya ba dang khro bo'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas karma aa bhi shinytsa h'um krum zhes bya ba dang khro bo'i bum pas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, with Oṃ karma abhiṣiñca hūṃ kṣuṃ, one should confer the empowerment with the vase of the wrathful one.

original: dbang lhag ma nyi shus kyang dbang bskur bar bya ste /🔽de la dam tshig ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: dbang lhag ma nyi shus kyang dbang bskur bar bya ste / de la dam tshig ni 'di yin no //
translated: One should also confer the empowerment with the remaining twenty empowerments.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang byang chub kyi sems dang bla ma mi spang ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang byang chub kyi sems dang bla ma mi spang ngo //
translated: The commitments are as follows: I will not abandon the Three Jewels, the awakening mind, and the master.

original: srog chags mi gsad ma byin par mi blang /🔽brdzun du smra bar mi bya /
analyzed: srog chags mi gsad ma byin par mi blang / brdzun du smra bar mi bya /
translated: I will not kill living beings, take what is not given,🔽or lie.

original: gzhan gyi bud med la mi spyad //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med la mi spyad //
translated: I will not engage in sexual misconduct or step over the master's seat.

original: bla ma'i grib ma la mi 'gom //
analyzed: bla ma'i grib ma la mi 'gom //
translated: I will not step over the master's shadow.

original: slob dpon du yon tan can ma yin pa mi gzung /
analyzed: slob dpon du yon tan can ma yin pa mi gzung /
translated: I will not take as my master someone who is not qualified.

original: slob dpon gyi mtshan nas mi brjod /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi mtshan nas mi brjod /
translated: I will not utter the master's name.

original: sngags dang phyag rgya dang lha la mi smad gal te glen pas smad na nad kyis thebs nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya dang lha la mi smad gal te glen pas smad na nad kyis thebs nas 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Do not disparage the mantra, the seal, or the deity. If a fool disparages them, he will be struck down by disease and die.

original: snying po dang lha'i grib ma dang phyag rgya dang gom bas mi 'gom /
analyzed: snying po dang lha'i grib ma dang phyag rgya dang gom bas mi 'gom /
translated: Do not step over the essence, the deity’s shadow, the seal, or the mantra.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang bstan pa la gnod pa dang bla ma la smod pa rnams ngan sngags kyis gsad par bya'o //🔽log par lta ba dang sdig pa spyod pa dang sems can la gnod pa dang dam tshig la sdang ba rnams snying rje chen pos ngan sngags kyis gsad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang bstan pa la gnod pa dang bla ma la smod pa rnams ngan sngags kyis gsad par bya'o // log par lta ba dang sdig pa spyod pa dang sems can la gnod pa dang dam tshig la sdang ba rnams snying rje chen pos ngan sngags kyis gsad par bya'o //
translated: Those who harm the Three Jewels, the doctrine, and the guru should be killed with evil mantras.

original: 'jungs @272a * //🔽pa can gyi nor blangs la //
analyzed: 'jungs @272a * // pa can gyi nor blangs la //
translated: Those who have wrong views, who engage in negative actions, who harm sentient beings, and who hate the commitments should be killed with evil mantras out of great compassion.🔽Take the wealth of the miser

original: phongs pa rnams la sbyin par bya //
analyzed: phongs pa rnams la sbyin par bya //
translated: and give it to the poor.

original: bla ma la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / dam tshig bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor mchod pa'i phyir dang / dam tshig can la phan pa'i phyir dang / rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa la mchod pa'i phyir du 'jungs pa rnams kyi nor da brog go //
analyzed: bla ma la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / dam tshig bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor mchod pa'i phyir dang / dam tshig can la phan pa'i phyir dang / rgyal ba sras dang bcas pa la mchod pa'i phyir du 'jungs pa rnams kyi nor da brog go //
translated: In order to make offerings to the guru, in order to accomplish the commitments, in order to make offerings to the maṇḍala, in order to benefit those with commitments, and in order to make offerings to the victors and their sons, the wealth of the miserly is stolen.

original: sems can la phan par 'dod pas bla ma'i nor dang / srog chags kyi srog bsrung ba'i phyir brdzun du smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems can la phan par 'dod pas bla ma'i nor dang / srog chags kyi srog bsrung ba'i phyir brdzun du smra bar bya'o //
translated: In order to benefit sentient beings, one should lie in order to protect the wealth of the guru and the lives of living beings.

original: sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig srung ba dang bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi bud med bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mnyes par bya ba'i phyir dam tshig srung ba dang bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi bud med bsten par bya'o //
translated: In order to please the buddhas, one should rely on the wives of others in order to guard and accomplish the commitments.

original: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas thams cad spyad cing bsgrubs na 'grub par 'gyur te mnyes par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas thams cad spyad cing bsgrubs na 'grub par 'gyur te mnyes par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If one practices and accomplishes everything while possessing the yoga of Vajrasattva, one will not please the buddhas if one does not accomplish them.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i thabs kyis smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i thabs kyis smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What need is there to mention the method endowed with great compassion?

original: de nas bka'i dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bka'i dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, one should confer the empowerment of the command.

original: de nas las kyi rdo rje lag tu byin la las kyi dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas las kyi rdo rje lag tu byin la las kyi dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having given the activity vajra into the hand, one should confer the empowerment of activity.

original: dbang bskur ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud du bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The empowerment should be understood according to the explanation in the Root Tantra.

original: de nas bla ma la lus dang nor dang dbyig dang 'bru dang stan dang bran dang khang pa dang rgyal po yin na rgyal srid dang bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang ma dang sring mo dang tsha bo dang / gzhan yang ci bzhed pa thams cad rang la phan pa'i phyir bla ma la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nas bla ma la lus dang nor dang dbyig dang 'bru dang stan dang bran dang khang pa dang rgyal po yin na rgyal srid dang bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang ma dang sring mo dang tsha bo dang / gzhan yang ci bzhed pa thams cad rang la phan pa'i phyir bla ma la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Then, for one's own benefit, one should offer to the guru one's body, wealth, jewels, grain, seat, servants, house, and if one is a king, one's kingdom, sons, daughters, wife, mother, sister, and nephew, and also whatever else one desires.

original: de nas byang chub bar du ni //
analyzed: de nas byang chub bar du ni //
translated: Then, from now until enlightenment,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos grub ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos grub ston te /
translated: and so forth teaches the spiritual powers.

original: 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pa de nas byang chub thob pa'i bar du sangs rgyas nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang 'jig rten pa'i mthu chen rnams sgrub par 'dod pas slob dpon la dngos grub rnams gsol ba gdab bo //
analyzed: 'di nyid du dbang dang dam tshig thob pa de nas byang chub thob pa'i bar du sangs rgyas nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang 'jig rten pa'i mthu chen rnams sgrub par 'dod pas slob dpon la dngos grub rnams gsol ba gdab bo //
translated: Having obtained initiation and the commitments in this very life, one should request the accomplishments from the master, desiring to accomplish the state of a buddha, or a bodhisattva, or a great worldly power, until one attains enlightenment.

original: de nas slob ma la phan pa'i phyir slob dpon ser sna med cing sems dad pa dang ldan pa'i slob ma la dngos grub rnams sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas slob ma la phan pa'i phyir slob dpon ser sna med cing sems dad pa dang ldan pa'i slob ma la dngos grub rnams sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba sbyin no //
translated: Then, for the sake of benefiting the disciple, the master should grant the accomplishments to the disciple who is free from avarice and endowed with faith.

original: ji lta bu sbyin zhen /
analyzed: ji lta bu sbyin zhen /
translated: How should one grant them?

original: chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
translated: All phenomena are unreal,

original: sems kyis bsgom pa byas nas kyang //
analyzed: sems kyis bsgom pa byas nas kyang //
translated: having cultivated the mind in this way,

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam //
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam //
translated: one should imagine a moon disk from the syllable A.

original: rang gi sa bon de dbus su //🔽bsams nas dam tshig phyag rgya dag / bsams shing de bzhin de nyid du //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de dbus su // bsams nas dam tshig phyag rgya dag / bsams shing de bzhin de nyid du //
translated: In its center, one should imagine one's own seed syllable,

original: sgrub pa yis ni bsgyur bar bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa yis ni bsgyur bar bya //
translated: and having imagined the pledge seal, one should transform it into that very [deity] through the practice.

original: lha yi rnal 'byor tshul du bsgyur /
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor tshul du bsgyur /
translated: One should transform it into the deity's yoga mode.

original: @272b de nas rang gi sa bon dang // phyag rgyas phyag rgya de byin brlab //
analyzed: @272b de nas rang gi sa bon dang // phyag rgyas phyag rgya de byin brlab //
translated: and the seal consecrate that seal.

original: lag 'og go rims ji bzhin du //
analyzed: lag 'og go rims ji bzhin du //
translated: In the order of the hand

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //
translated: the Buddhas confer consecration.

original: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, having generated pride,

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos te dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba ni mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na chos te dngos po thams cad do //
translated: “All phenomena” are things, because they hold their own characteristics.

original: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bral bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po med par zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bral bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Non-existent” means free from cause, that is the meaning.

original: rgyu dang bral ba de yang rgyu yod pa las skye'am med pa las skye'am gnyi ga las skye zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba de yang rgyu yod pa las skye'am med pa las skye'am gnyi ga las skye zhe na /
translated: Moreover, that freedom from cause arises from the existence of a cause, or from the non-existence of a cause, or from both?

original: ci dang por yod pa las ma yin te ngo bo nyid yongs su grub zin pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du skye ba don du mi rigs so //
analyzed: ci dang por yod pa las ma yin te ngo bo nyid yongs su grub zin pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus gzhan du skye ba don du mi rigs so //
translated: First, it is not from the existence of a cause, because the accomplishment of the essence is not reasonable in another future time.

original: gzhan du gal te yod pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni skyes zin pa'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te yod pa skye bar 'gyur ba ni skyes zin pa'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the existent were to arise, then what has already arisen would arise again.

original: med pa las kyang mi skye ste shin tu gzugs med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing skye bar 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan du 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir dngos po'i phyogs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las kyang dngos po thams cad rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa las kyang mi skye ste shin tu gzugs med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing skye bar 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro // gzhan du 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir dngos po'i phyogs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las kyang dngos po thams cad rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It does not arise from that which does not exist because it is like the utterly non-existent horn of a rabbit and so on, and it is not endowed with engagement in arising.🔽Otherwise, all of these would not exist, and because anything whatsoever from any side of an entity would always arise, there would be no definite cause and effect.🔽If the individual definitive potency of these entities does not exist, then since the individual definitive potency of these entities would exist, something would arise from those entities.

original: gal te so so'i nus pa nges par mi 'gyur bar dngos po 'di rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par gyur na ni dngos po de rnams las cung zad cig skye bar 'gyur bas khyad par med pas kyang thams cad med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te so so'i nus pa nges par mi 'gyur bar dngos po 'di rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par gyur na ni dngos po de rnams las cung zad cig skye bar 'gyur bas khyad par med pas kyang thams cad med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is no difference, then everything is nonexistent.

original: de ni mi rigs te 'bras bu rnams dang 'dres pa'i gzugs rnams rkyen du gyur na ni de'i tshe de rnams kyis so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang zhig la nges par nus pa yin /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'bras bu rnams dang 'dres pa'i gzugs rnams rkyen du gyur na ni de'i tshe de rnams kyis so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang zhig la nges par nus pa yin /
translated: If forms mixed with effects were conditions, then at that time they would be related to effects that are individually ascertained, so what effect is definitely able to arise from them?

original: de lta na nus pa nges pa med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na nus pa nges pa med pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the ability to arise would be indefinite.

original: de bas na thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ba dang yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su smras pa'i nyes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ba dang yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su smras pa'i nyes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it follows that everything would arise from everything, it would be difficult to reverse, and it would be mixed with the faults of the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: gnyi ga las kyang mi skye ste gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba med de /🔽gcig pa nyid dang gnyis pa nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir de yang /
analyzed: gnyi ga las kyang mi skye ste gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba med de / gcig pa nyid dang gnyis pa nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir de yang /
translated: It does not arise from both, because a single thing does not have two natures.

original: yod dang med pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: yod dang med pa'i don la yang //
translated: Because singularity and duality are mutually exclusive, that is also stated in the following:

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //🔽yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te // yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: Conditions are not tenable🔽For existent and nonexistent objects.🔽If it exists, what would conditions do?

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, what would conditions do?

original: gang tshe chos @273a * //
analyzed: gang tshe chos @273a * //
translated: When a phenomenon

original: ni yod pa na //
analyzed: ni yod pa na //
translated: exists,

original: med dang yod min mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: med dang yod min mi sgrub pa //
translated: it is not established as nonexistent or not existent.

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu zhes bya //
translated: How can it be called a cause of establishment?

original: de ltar yin na mi rigs so //🔽rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //
analyzed: de ltar yin na mi rigs so // rkyen rnams so so 'dus pa las //
translated: If it were so, it would be illogical.🔽The effect is nonexistent from the assembly

original: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //🔽rkyen rnams las ni gang med pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid // rkyen rnams las ni gang med pa //
translated: of individual conditions.🔽How can that which is nonexistent from conditions

original: de ni rkyen gyis ji ltar skyed //
analyzed: de ni rkyen gyis ji ltar skyed //
translated: be produced by conditions?🔽If it were to arise from those conditions

original: ci ste de ni med par yang //🔽rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //🔽rkyen dag las kyang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: ci ste de ni med par yang // rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na // rkyen dag las kyang 'bras bu ni //
translated: even though it is nonexistent,🔽then why would an effect not arise

original: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur //
translated: from nonconditions as well?

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: sems kyi bsgom pa byas nas kyang //
analyzed: sems kyi bsgom pa byas nas kyang //
translated: Having cultivated the meditation of mind,

original: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du don bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du don bsgom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: as before, it means cultivating the meaning.

original: snga ma las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems nyid zla ba dang po dang gnyis par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgom zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems nyid zla ba dang po dang gnyis par bsgom pa'o //
translated: As before, cultivating the moon maṇḍala means cultivating one’s own mind as the first and second moons.

original: rang gi sa bon de dbus su //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de dbus su //
translated: In the center of that, one’s own seed syllable

original: bsams shing dam tshig phyag rgya dag / ces bya ba ni dbus su rang gi sa bon las dam tshig gi phyag rgya bskyed par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsams shing dam tshig phyag rgya dag / ces bya ba ni dbus su rang gi sa bon las dam tshig gi phyag rgya bskyed par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having contemplated, the pledge seal means that one should generate the pledge seal from one's seed in the center.

original: bsam zhing de bzhin de nyid du//
analyzed: bsam zhing de bzhin de nyid du//
translated: Having contemplated, just so,

original: sgrub pa pos ni bsgyur bar bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos ni bsgyur bar bya //
translated: the adept should transform.

original: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs dpag tu med pa 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sku gsung thugs dpag tu med pa 'dus pa'o //
translated: This means the gathering of the immeasurable body, speech, and mind.

original: lha yi rnal 'byor tshul du bsgyur //
analyzed: lha yi rnal 'byor tshul du bsgyur //
translated: One should transform in the manner of the deity yoga.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid las lha'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid las lha'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
translated: This means the complete body of the deity from just that.

original: de nas rang gi sa bon dang // phyag rgya phyag rgyas de byin brlab //
analyzed: de nas rang gi sa bon dang // phyag rgya phyag rgyas de byin brlab //
translated: Then, one's seed and the seal, with the seal, consecrate that.

original: ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa rang gi sa bon /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa rang gi sa bon /
translated: The consecration is one's seed,

original: aom sarba bid badzra aadhi tishtha dzny'a na sa ma ye h'um zhes bya ba dang phyag rgya gnyis bcings te /
analyzed: aom sarba bid badzra aadhi tishtha dzny'a na sa ma ye h'um zhes bya ba dang phyag rgya gnyis bcings te /
translated: Om sarva-vid vajra-adhisthana jnana samaye hum, and having formed the two seals,

original: snying ga la sogs pa'i gnas bco brgyad du byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga la sogs pa'i gnas bco brgyad du byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: one consecrates the eighteen places such as the heart.

original: lhag 'og go rims ji bzhin du //
analyzed: lhag 'og go rims ji bzhin du //
translated: As for the remaining ones, in the proper order,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur ro //🔽zhes bya ba ni snying gar dkyil 'khor gzhan du sprul te zhugs nas de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan ngang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur ro // zhes bya ba ni snying gar dkyil 'khor gzhan du sprul te zhugs nas de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan ngang /
translated: The buddhas confer empowerment.

original: ngar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming dang / brtul zhugs sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngar dpyangs dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming dang / brtul zhugs sbyin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that having emanated another mandala in the heart, and having entered it, then the five buddha crowns, the long necklace, the vajra, the master, the name, and the vow are given.

original: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang //
analyzed: de nas nga rgyal bskyed nas kyang //
translated: Then, having generated pride,

original: zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pas rgyas btab nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pas rgyas btab nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: this means that having sealed with the pledge, the Dharma, the action, the great seal, and so forth,

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni mchod pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni mchod pa bsdu'o //
translated: also means that the offerings are summarized.

original: 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: rigs rnams kyi zlos pa pos khrus kyi cho ga sngon du 'gro ba las lha la sogs pa mchod de mi snang bar gyur bar byas la dang po chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas stong pa @273b nyid du bsgom /
analyzed: rigs rnams kyi zlos pa pos khrus kyi cho ga sngon du 'gro ba las lha la sogs pa mchod de mi snang bar gyur bar byas la dang po chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas stong pa @273b nyid du bsgom /
translated: The reciter of the families, having performed the rite of bathing, having made offerings to the gods and so forth, having made them disappear, first meditates on the emptiness of all phenomena from the perspective of cause and effect.

original: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / sa bon las dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rjer zhugs pa dang gzugs nyid rdzogs par byed pa dang / rdo rje'i phyag rgya gnyis bcings te sngags brjod la byin gyis brlab pa dang /
analyzed: aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / sa bon las dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rjer zhugs pa dang gzugs nyid rdzogs par byed pa dang / rdo rje'i phyag rgya gnyis bcings te sngags brjod la byin gyis brlab pa dang /
translated: From A, a moon mandala, and from that moon mandala and seed syllable, the pledge seal and the form of the Tathagata's body, speech, and mind enter, and the form is perfected, and the two vajra seals are bound and the mantra is recited, and there is consecration.

original: snying gar sprul te 'jug pa dang / dbang rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab pa dang mchod pa yang bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying gar sprul te 'jug pa dang / dbang rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang rgyas gdab pa dang mchod pa yang bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The emanation enters the heart, and the initiations are conferred, and there is sealing and worship.

original: mkhas pa yis ni bsgrub byas na //
analyzed: mkhas pa yis ni bsgrub byas na //
translated: Having accomplished it, the wise one🔽should practice it all night long.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa dang mtshan thog thag tu bsgoms nas zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa dang mtshan thog thag tu bsgoms nas zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: This means that having accomplished the familiarization and the all-night meditation,

original: 'bras bu cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what will be the result?

original: de bzhin gshegs kyang 'grub 'gyur na /🔽dngos grub gzhan lta ci zhig smos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kyang 'grub 'gyur na / dngos grub gzhan lta ci zhig smos //
translated: If even the Tathagata is accomplished,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: what need is there to mention other powers?

original: 'dis ni rtog pa thams cad kyi dam tshig sems dpa' bskyed pa dang dngos grub kyi cho ga ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa thams cad kyi dam tshig sems dpa' bskyed pa dang dngos grub kyi cho ga ston to //
translated: This shows the generation of the pledge-being of all contemplations and the rite of powers.

original: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa lha chen po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor 'dir gzhug pa'i phan yon bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa lha chen po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor 'dir gzhug pa'i phan yon bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Then, the great gods such as Brahmā, etc., etc., show the benefits of entering this maṇḍala. Since they are easy to understand, they are not explained.

original: de nas lha de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba dang bzlas brjod ston te /
analyzed: de nas lha de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba dang bzlas brjod ston te /
translated: Then, those gods are shown the empowerment of the tathāgatas, etc., and the recitation.

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas zhus pa'i don tshe thung ba dang / ngan song du skyes par 'gyur ba ma mchis na ji ltar bsgrub ces zhus pa dang / lhan du dkyil 'khor du chug cig / chos kyi yi ge zlos su chu gcig / de tshe ring bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal nas zhus pa'i don tshe thung ba dang / ngan song du skyes par 'gyur ba ma mchis na ji ltar bsgrub ces zhus pa dang / lhan du dkyil 'khor du chug cig / chos kyi yi ge zlos su chu gcig / de tshe ring bar 'gyur /
translated: Having bowed to the Blessed One, they ask, “If there is no death and rebirth in the lower realms, how is it accomplished?” and “Let them enter the maṇḍala together.” “Let them recite the Dharma letters.” “At that time, their lifespan will be long.”

original: bsod nams dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: “They will have merit.”

original: ngan song las grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngan song las grol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “They will be liberated from the lower realms.”

original: tshe 'di la gnas pa'i don bshad nas /
analyzed: tshe 'di la gnas pa'i don bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the benefits for this life,

original: pha rol tu 'phos pa rnams kyi don du ngan song du skyes zin pa rnams ming la sogs pa la bkug la lan bdun du dkyil 'khor du bcug la dbang bskur na ngan song las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / shi ba'i ming nas smos te sngar bshad pa'i rig pa'i rgyud nyid 'bum phrag stong gi bar du bzlas brjod byas pa la yang kha dog du klog pa'i tshul gyis byas na /
analyzed: pha rol tu 'phos pa rnams kyi don du ngan song du skyes zin pa rnams ming la sogs pa la bkug la lan bdun du dkyil 'khor du bcug la dbang bskur na ngan song las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / shi ba'i ming nas smos te sngar bshad pa'i rig pa'i rgyud nyid 'bum phrag stong gi bar du bzlas brjod byas pa la yang kha dog du klog pa'i tshul gyis byas na /
translated: For the sake of those who have passed beyond, those who have already been born in the lower realms are summoned by name and so forth, and if they are caused to enter the mandala seven times and are empowered, they will be completely liberated from the lower realms.🔽 And, If one recites the name of the deceased and recites the vidya-mantra explained above a hundred thousand times, even one who possesses the five heinous crimes will be purified, so what need is there to mention a small sin?

original: mtshams med pa lnga dang ldan pa yang 'byang bar 'gyur na sdig pa chung du lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes phan yon gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga dang ldan pa yang 'byang bar 'gyur na sdig pa chung du lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes phan yon gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the benefits are explained.

original: lha'i bu rnams zhi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngan @274a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams zhi ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngan @274a * //
translated: The sons of the gods, peaceful, and so forth.

original: song du skyes zin pa rnams sbyang ba ston te zhi ba'i hom khung tha ma khru gang bar ma khru do mchog khru bzhi pa zlum po nyid du byas nas ming dang sngags spel te nyungs kar gyis brgya phrag stong du sbyin sreg byas na ngan song las
analyzed: song du skyes zin pa rnams sbyang ba ston te zhi ba'i hom khung tha ma khru gang bar ma khru do mchog khru bzhi pa zlum po nyid du byas nas ming dang sngags spel te nyungs kar gyis brgya phrag stong du sbyin sreg byas na ngan song las
translated: Having made a peaceful fire pit one cubit in size, two cubits in size, or four cubits in size, one should recite the name and mantra, and perform a homa with white mustard seeds one thousand times.

original: thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be liberated from the lower realms.

original: de'i sha dang rus pa dang skra dang thal ba dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pas brgya phrag stong du sbyin sreg byas na yang ngan song las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sha dang rus pa dang skra dang thal ba dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pas brgya phrag stong du sbyin sreg byas na yang ngan song las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs a homa one thousand times with their flesh, bones, hair, ashes, effigy, and so on, they will also be liberated from the lower realms.

original: thab khung la sogs pa la ci zhig bri zhe na /
analyzed: thab khung la sogs pa la ci zhig bri zhe na /
translated: What should be drawn in the fire pit and so on?

original: de'i dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad dang 'od zer dkar po bri //
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad dang 'od zer dkar po bri //
translated: In the center, draw an eight-spoked wheel with white light rays.

original: 'khor yug la rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'od zer dkar po bri /
analyzed: 'khor yug la rdo rje rtse lnga pa 'od zer dkar po bri /
translated: Around the perimeter, draw a five-pointed vajra with white light rays.

original: de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa la shar phyogs su rdo rje gzhag / byang du rgya gram /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa la shar phyogs su rdo rje gzhag / byang du rgya gram /
translated: Outside of that, on a four-spoked wheel, place a vajra in the east, a crossed vajra in the north,

original: lho phyogs su rdo rje rin chen /
analyzed: lho phyogs su rdo rje rin chen /
translated: a vajra jewel in the south,🔽and a lotus in the west.

original: nub tu padma /
analyzed: nub tu padma /
translated: In the west, a lotus.🔽In order to destroy evil, one should place various seals.

original: sdig pa gzhom pa'i phyir phyag rgya sna tshogs pa gzhag par bya ste mu rang dkar po'i nang du phyi rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya bri ba ni gza' dang skar ma dang 'jig rten skyong ba dang bcas pa bri /
analyzed: sdig pa gzhom pa'i phyir phyag rgya sna tshogs pa gzhag par bya ste mu rang dkar po'i nang du phyi rdo rje rigs kyi phyag rgya bri ba ni gza' dang skar ma dang 'jig rten skyong ba dang bcas pa bri /
translated: In the center of a white maṇḍala, one should draw the seals of the outer vajra family, which are the planets, the stars, and the world protectors.

original: gtso bo gang zhig tu gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gtso bo gang zhig tu gzhag ce na /
translated: Where should the principal one be placed?

original: ri mo 'am lugs ma yang rung /
analyzed: ri mo 'am lugs ma yang rung /
translated: Whether a painting or a statue,🔽one should place the vajra-holder together with the eastern spoke.🔽Moreover, in the north one should place a vase, a bali, and a cake that are completely filled.

original: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la rdo rje can dang lhan cig gzhag / gzhan yang byang du bum pa dang gtor ma dang lha bshos rab tu bkang ba gzhag / mdor na thig gtab  nas cho ga bzhin du bri bar bya /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la rdo rje can dang lhan cig gzhag / gzhan yang byang du bum pa dang gtor ma dang lha bshos rab tu bkang ba gzhag / mdor na thig gtab  nas cho ga bzhin du bri bar bya /
translated: In brief, having laid out the lines, one should draw according to the rite.

original: de nas dkar po'i gos gon rnal 'byor dang ldan pas ngan song gi rgyud na gnas pa'i sems can drang zhing sdig bzhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang dag pa'i sems kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkar po'i gos gon rnal 'byor dang ldan pas ngan song gi rgyud na gnas pa'i sems can drang zhing sdig bzhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang dag pa'i sems kyis sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then, one who is endowed with yoga, wearing white clothes, should perform the burnt offering with a pure mind in order to attract sentient beings who are situated in the lower realms and to purify their sins.

original: rdzas ci zhig gis bya zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas ci zhig gis bya zhe na /
translated: By what substances should one perform?

original: mar dang 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang / chan dang 'bras yos dang yungs kar dang de'i rus pa la sogs pa bsres te sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: mar dang 'o ma sbrang rtsi dang / chan dang 'bras yos dang yungs kar dang de'i rus pa la sogs pa bsres te sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform the burnt offering with ghee, milk, honey, parched grain, rice, sesame, and his bones, and so forth.

original: rus pa la sogs pa med na ming nas smos te bya'o //
analyzed: rus pa la sogs pa med na ming nas smos te bya'o //
translated: If there are no bones, and so forth, one should do it by mentioning his name.

original: de ltar zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis bde 'gror skyes nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gis bde 'gror skyes nas /
translated: Thus, having been born in a happy realm by the burnt offering of pacification,🔽the wise one should perform the burnt offering of increase.

original: rgyas pa'i sbyin sreg mkhas pas rgyas par bya dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor pas khru do pa dang khru bzhi pa dang / mchog la khru brgyad pa byas nas ho ma khung khru bzhi pa mu ran dang ldan pa de'i dbus su padma dang rin po che'i 'od zer ser po dang ldan par bri'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i sbyin sreg mkhas pas rgyas par bya dgos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor pas khru do pa dang khru bzhi pa dang / mchog la khru brgyad pa byas nas ho ma khung khru bzhi pa mu ran dang ldan pa de'i dbus su padma dang rin po che'i 'od zer ser po dang ldan par bri'o //
translated: In this way, the yogi, having made the hearth two cubits, four cubits, or at most eight cubits, with a border, should draw in the middle of it a lotus and a yellow jewel ray.

original: de'i khor yug tu rin po che /
analyzed: de'i khor yug tu rin po che /
translated: In its circumference, a jewel.

original: mur na la padma /
analyzed: mur na la padma /
translated: On the border, a lotus.

original: phyi rol du rtsibs chen po bzhi la /
analyzed: phyi rol du rtsibs chen po bzhi la /
translated: On the outside, on the four great spokes,

original: shar du rdo rje /🔽@274b lhor rin po che /
analyzed: shar du rdo rje / @274b lhor rin po che /
translated: in the east, a vajra.🔽In the south, a jewel.

original: nub tu padma /
analyzed: nub tu padma /
translated: In the west, a lotus.

original: byang du sna tshogs rdo rje /
analyzed: byang du sna tshogs rdo rje /
translated: In the north, a crossed vajra.

original: shar du 'khor lo'i rtsibs la gtso bo'i ri mo la sogs pa bri'o //
analyzed: shar du 'khor lo'i rtsibs la gtso bo'i ri mo la sogs pa bri'o //
translated: In the east, on the spoke of the wheel, one should draw the image of the principal deity, and so on.

original: grva rnams su lha mo brgyad kyi phyag mtshan /
analyzed: grva rnams su lha mo brgyad kyi phyag mtshan /
translated: In the corners, one should draw the hand implements of the eight goddesses.

original: sgor lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgor lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan bri bar bya'o //
translated: At the gates, one should draw the hand implements such as the iron hook, and so on.

original: de nas gos ser po bgos nas mtho ris na gnas pa dran par byed cing de la phan zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir rgyas pa'i las snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: de nas gos ser po bgos nas mtho ris na gnas pa dran par byed cing de la phan zhing rgyas par bya ba'i phyir rgyas pa'i las snga ma bzhin du byas nas /
translated: Then, having put on yellow garments, one should recollect the gods who dwell in the heavens, and in order to benefit them and to increase their prosperity, one should perform the increasing rite as before.

original: de'i tshe dang dpal dang gzi brjid dang longs spyod 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar rgyas ba'i las bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dang dpal dang gzi brjid dang longs spyod 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar rgyas ba'i las bya'o //
translated: At that time, in order to increase their lifespan, glory, splendor, and enjoyments, one should perform the increasing rite in that way.

original: de nas dbang du bya ba'i las bshad pa ni /🔽de nas phan phyir nges par yang ;
analyzed: de nas dbang du bya ba'i las bshad pa ni / de nas phan phyir nges par yang ;
translated: Next, the rite of subjugation is explained:

original: / dbang du bya ba'i las bshad do //
analyzed: / dbang du bya ba'i las bshad do //
translated: Then, for the sake of benefit, one should definitely explain the rite of subjugation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas par bya ba nas dbang du bya ba'i las ni thab khung gzhu'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / tha ma khru gang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rgyas par bya ba nas dbang du bya ba'i las ni thab khung gzhu'i dbyibs 'dra ba dang / tha ma khru gang /
translated: In the rite of subjugation, the hearth should be shaped like a bow, one cubit in size,

original: bar ma khru do mchog khru bzhi par byas la de'i dbus su padma dmar po bris la /
analyzed: bar ma khru do mchog khru bzhi par byas la de'i dbus su padma dmar po bris la /
translated: The medium is two cubits, and the best is four cubits. In the middle of that one should draw a red lotus.

original: lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bri /
analyzed: lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bri /
translated: In the center one should draw an arrow and a bow.

original: 'khor yug tu mda' dang gzhu bri /
analyzed: 'khor yug tu mda' dang gzhu bri /
translated: All around one should draw arrows and bows.

original: sngags shes pas mu ran la yang mda' dang gzhu bri /
analyzed: sngags shes pas mu ran la yang mda' dang gzhu bri /
translated: One who knows the mantra should also draw arrows and bows on the border.

original: phyi rol lhag ma rnams zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol lhag ma rnams zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: The rest outside should be done like the pacifying and increasing [rites].

original: de nas sems can de dran par byas te gos dmar po gon la padma'am 'bras bu dmar po tshon gyis sbrus nas mar dang gur gum dang bsres nas /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dran par byas te gos dmar po gon la padma'am 'bras bu dmar po tshon gyis sbrus nas mar dang gur gum dang bsres nas /
translated: Then, having reminded that sentient being, one should dress in red garments, and having dyed a lotus or a red fruit with color, mixed with ghee and saffron,
