original: tsandan dmar po'i phye ma'i sbyin sreg byas na thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po'i phye ma'i sbyin sreg byas na thams cad de'i dbang du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: one should perform a burnt offering of red sandalwood powder. All will come under one's power.

original: de nas mngon spyod bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de nas mngon spyod bstan pa ni //
translated: Next, the teaching on the rites of assault:

original: de la gdon rnams gzhom pa'i phyir //🔽mngon spyod kyi las ni brtsam par bya /
analyzed: de la gdon rnams gzhom pa'i phyir // mngon spyod kyi las ni brtsam par bya /
translated: For the purpose of destroying the grahas,🔽one should undertake the rites of assault.

original: dbang du gyur pa de la gzhom pa'i phyir mngon spyod brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa de la gzhom pa'i phyir mngon spyod brtsam par bya ste /
translated: For the purpose of destroying those who have come under one's power, one should undertake the rites of assault.

original: tha ma phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: tha ma phyed dang gsum /
translated: The lowest is one cubit and three🔽inches,

original: bar ma khru gsum /
analyzed: bar ma khru gsum /
translated: the medium is three cubits,

original: mchog khru dgu pa /
analyzed: mchog khru dgu pa /
translated: and the best is nine cubits.

original: thab khung khru gsum pa /
analyzed: thab khung khru gsum pa /
translated: The hearth is three cubits.

original: dbus su rdo rje rtse dgu pa mu khyud la rtse gsum pa dang / rgya gram dang rdo rje dang dbyug pa dang / phyogs gcig rtse gsum pa'i rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang rdo rje rtse gcig pas bskor /
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje rtse dgu pa mu khyud la rtse gsum pa dang / rgya gram dang rdo rje dang dbyug pa dang / phyogs gcig rtse gsum pa'i rdo rje dang / dgra sta dang rdo rje rtse gcig pas bskor /
translated: In the center is a nine-pronged vajra surrounded by a garland of three-pronged vajras, a double vajra, a club, a single-pronged vajra, an axe, and a single-pronged vajra.

original: phyi rol du lha'i gnas 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa dang l'a skye la sogs pa'i gnas dang / rdo rje rigs kyi gnas sum rim du bya /
analyzed: phyi rol du lha'i gnas 'khor lo rtsibs bzhi pa dang l'a skye la sogs pa'i gnas dang / rdo rje rigs kyi gnas sum rim du bya /
translated: Outside of that, the abode of the deities is a four-spoked wheel and the abode of the lotus, and so on, and the abode of the vajra family is made in three tiers.

original: bya dang gtor ma dang bum pa dang bshos cha rnam pa mang po dang / chang dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa gzhag / de nas lus @275a * //
analyzed: bya dang gtor ma dang bum pa dang bshos cha rnam pa mang po dang / chang dang khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa gzhag / de nas lus @275a * //
translated: Many kinds of offerings, such as birds, tormas, vases, and cakes, and skulls filled with beer and blood are set out.

original: can gyi sdig pa dang bgegs gzhom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: can gyi sdig pa dang bgegs gzhom pa'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to destroy the obstacles of embodied beings,

original: gos nag po bgos shing khro bo tshad mar byas la 'jig rten gsum rgyal du bskyed de snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg byas nas /
analyzed: gos nag po bgos shing khro bo tshad mar byas la 'jig rten gsum rgyal du bskyed de snga ma bzhin du sbyin sreg byas nas /
translated: one should don black clothes, generate wrath, and generate [oneself as] Trailokyavijaya.

original: de nas de'i lus la sdig pa bcom nas bgegs dang bral te mtho ris lha dang mi'i nang na ci dga' bar spyod do //
analyzed: de nas de'i lus la sdig pa bcom nas bgegs dang bral te mtho ris lha dang mi'i nang na ci dga' bar spyod do //
translated: Then, having destroyed the body's sins, one is free from obstacles and enjoys the higher realms of gods and humans as one wishes.

original: de nas thab kyi go rims dang po zhi ba dang de las rgyas pa 'byung bas rgyas pa dang / de nas dbang du bya ba de nas mngon spyod kyi las yin te /
analyzed: de nas thab kyi go rims dang po zhi ba dang de las rgyas pa 'byung bas rgyas pa dang / de nas dbang du bya ba de nas mngon spyod kyi las yin te /
translated: Then, since pacification is the first sequence of the hearth and from that prosperity arises, prosperity is the second. Then, after subjugation, the rite of killing is the fourth.

original: go rims 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: go rims 'di dag nyid kyis ni //
translated: By these very sequences,

original: de nas gang gi phyir byas pa //
analyzed: de nas gang gi phyir byas pa //
translated: whatever was done for that reason,

original: de yi phyir yang de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi phyir yang de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: it will be just so for that reason.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: tshe 'di nyid la gnas pa rnams kyi go rims phan yon dang bcas pa /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la gnas pa rnams kyi go rims phan yon dang bcas pa /
translated: The sequence of those who abide in this very life with benefits is as follows:

original: gzhan dag gi las rnams kyang /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi las rnams kyang /
translated: The rites of others

original: snga ma bzhin du de ltar bya //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du de ltar bya //
translated: are done in the same way as before.

original: des ni sems can rnams la yang //
analyzed: des ni sems can rnams la yang //
translated: By that, for sentient beings

original: myur du bde skyid 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: myur du bde skyid 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: happiness will be quickly accomplished.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtag pa'i rgyal po'i phan yon dang / rgyud gtad pa bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas brtag pa'i rgyal po'i phan yon dang / rgyud gtad pa bstan te go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Then, the gods such as Brahma, etc., etc., shows the benefits of the king of contemplations, and the entrusting of the tantra. Since it is easy to understand, it is not explained.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba chen po'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde ba chen po'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, etc., shows the mandala of great bliss.

original: de nas zhes bya ba sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba sbyor ba dang po'i rjes thogs la ste /
translated: Then, immediately after the first union.

original: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba ni phyag na rdo rje nyid yin par gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba ni phyag na rdo rje nyid yin par gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the first union is taken to be Vajrapani himself.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje rje sngags dang phyag rgya dang snying po thams cad ces bya ba ni gsung dang thugs dang las dang sku thams cad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje rje sngags dang phyag rgya dang snying po thams cad ces bya ba ni gsung dang thugs dang las dang sku thams cad do //
translated: The Blessed One Vajrapani, all mantras, seals, and essence means all speech, mind, action, and body.

original: stan par ba ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor yod pa las bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stan par ba ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor yod pa las bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to teach means that the mandala that will be explained below will be taught.

original: nyid kyi snying po 'di bshad do //
analyzed: nyid kyi snying po 'di bshad do //
translated: He explained this essence of his.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi ye shes nges par bstan pa'i sgras gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi ye shes nges par bstan pa'i sgras gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is stated by the sound of the teaching of one's own exalted wisdom.

original: de'i gnas la'ang bya ba ste de nyid aom badzra bhi h'um /
analyzed: de'i gnas la'ang bya ba ste de nyid aom badzra bhi h'um /
translated: One should also perform the rite in the abode of that [exalted wisdom],

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i'o //
translated: the abode of Vajrasattva.

original: aom a'a: h'um kun du bzang po'i'o //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um kun du bzang po'i'o //
translated: Om a hum is the abode of Samantabhadra.

original: badzra h'um phat phyag na rdo rje'i'o //🔽aom badzra kro dha badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: badzra h'um phat phyag na rdo rje'i'o // aom badzra kro dha badzra h'um phat /
translated: Vajra hum phat is the abode of Vajrapani.

original: rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsnams pa'o //
translated: Om vajra krodha vajra hum phat is the abode of Vajradhara.

original: aom badzra dhi sgrib pa rnam par bsal ba'i'o //
analyzed: aom badzra dhi sgrib pa rnam par bsal ba'i'o //
translated: Om vajra dhi is the abode of Sarvanivarana Viskambini.

original: aom badzra h'um aa rgya gram bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra h'um aa rgya gram bsnams pa'o //
translated: Om vajra hum a is the abode of the Svastika Bearer.

original: 'di dag gis kyang dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom pa pos snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor lus la brtags @275b pa'i bar byas nas khang pa brtsegs pa dang gdan bskyed la kun rig gi dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsams la /
analyzed: 'di dag gis kyang dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom pa pos snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor lus la brtags @275b pa'i bar byas nas khang pa brtsegs pa dang gdan bskyed la kun rig gi dkyil 'khor ji lta ba bzhin bsams la /
translated: Also, one who meditates on the supreme king of mandalas should, as before, perform the rite up to the examination of the mandala in the body, and then generate the palace and the seats, and imagine the mandala of the All-Surpassing Wisdom just as it is.

original: dbus su bde ba chen po'am /
analyzed: dbus su bde ba chen po'am /
translated: In the center, one should visualize Mahamudra,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bsams la thabs dang ye shes rab kyi mtshan nyid las sngar bshad pa'i ye shes las sku /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bsams la thabs dang ye shes rab kyi mtshan nyid las sngar bshad pa'i ye shes las sku /
translated: Having visualized Vajrasattva, from the method and wisdom characteristics, the body is generated from the gnosis explained previously.🔽At his heart, the syllables are arranged on a moon.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba la yig 'bru rnams bkod de bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba la yig 'bru rnams bkod de bskyed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of “generated.”

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi of the supreme king of maṇḍalas.

original: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa las rgyal po mchog ces pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsdu zhing byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa las rgyal po mchog ces pa'i ting nge 'dzin snga ma bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: Next, one should understand the samādhi called the supreme king of activities, such as gathering and consecration, as before.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston to //
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston to //
translated: Next, the explanation of their maṇḍala and so on teaches the activities of the master.

original: sngon la bsnyen pa byas pa dang / sa lhag par gnas pa dag /
analyzed: sngon la bsnyen pa byas pa dang / sa lhag par gnas pa dag /
translated: Having performed the prior approximation, and having performed the consecration of the ground,

original: chog thams cad spyad de de nas dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni /🔽rtsa ba'i rgyud ltar dkyil 'khor bris la kun rig gi gnas su rdo rje 'am /
analyzed: chog thams cad spyad de de nas dkyil 'khor bshad pa ni / rtsa ba'i rgyud ltar dkyil 'khor bris la kun rig gi gnas su rdo rje 'am /
translated: having performed all the rites, then the explanation of the maṇḍala is as follows:🔽Having drawn the maṇḍala according to the root tantra, in the location of the all-knowing one, draw either a vajra,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' 'am /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' 'am /
translated: Vajrasattva,

original: bde ba chen po gang rung cig bri /
analyzed: bde ba chen po gang rung cig bri /
translated: or Mahāsukha.

original: de'i spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje g-yas phyogs su rdo rje bsdams pa /
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar phyag na rdo rje g-yas phyogs su rdo rje bsdams pa /
translated: Vajrapāṇi is in front of him, holding a vajra in his right hand.

original: nub phyogs su rnam par gsal ba /
analyzed: nub phyogs su rnam par gsal ba /
translated: Vajravinayaka is in the west,

original: byang phyogs su rgya gram bsnams pa /
analyzed: byang phyogs su rgya gram bsnams pa /
translated: and Vajrāṅkuśa is in the north.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du /
translated: In the outer maṇḍala,

original: shar phyogs su ngan song sbyong ba /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ngan song sbyong ba /
translated: Sukhāvatī is in the east,

original: lhor rin chen tog / nub phyogs su sh'akya'i dbang po /
analyzed: lhor rin chen tog / nub phyogs su sh'akya'i dbang po /
translated: Ratnaketu is in the south, Śākyendra is in the west,

original: byang phyogs su me tog cher rgyas /
analyzed: byang phyogs su me tog cher rgyas /
translated: and Mahāpuṣpa is in the north.

original: de'i phyi rol 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams la sems dpa' bcu drug po go rims bzhin du bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol 'khor lo'i rtsibs rnams la sems dpa' bcu drug po go rims bzhin du bri /
translated: Outside of that, on the spokes of the wheel, the sixteen bodhisattvas are drawn in order.

original: khyams dang grva'i char byams pa dang / l'a sye la sogs pa dang / sgo gnyis pa'i nang du dpe med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bri /
analyzed: khyams dang grva'i char byams pa dang / l'a sye la sogs pa dang / sgo gnyis pa'i nang du dpe med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bri /
translated: Maitreya, Lāsyā, and so on are drawn in the courtyard and the corners, and the bodhisattva Anupama is drawn inside the second gate.

original: rim pa gnyis pa la kun dga' bo la sogs pa'i nyan thos gsum pa la rang sangs rgyas bri'o //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa la kun dga' bo la sogs pa'i nyan thos gsum pa la rang sangs rgyas bri'o //
translated: On the second level, Ānanda and the other śrāvakas are drawn, and on the third level, the pratyekabuddhas are drawn.

original: mu ran dkar po'i nang du 'khor yug la rang rang gi bu dang chung mas bskor ba'i tshangs pa la sogs pa dang / gza' dang skar ma'i lha rnams dang / rgyal po bzhi dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams bri /
analyzed: mu ran dkar po'i nang du 'khor yug la rang rang gi bu dang chung mas bskor ba'i tshangs pa la sogs pa dang / gza' dang skar ma'i lha rnams dang / rgyal po bzhi dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams bri /
translated: Inside the white border, draw Brahmā and so forth, surrounded by their own sons and wives, the planets, the stars, the four kings, and the world guardians.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi mtshams kyi char shar lhor dmyal ba /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi mtshams kyi char shar lhor dmyal ba /
translated: In the outer corners, draw the hell beings in the southeast,🔽the hungry ghosts in the southwest,

original: lho nub tu yi dags /🔽nub byang du byol song /
analyzed: lho nub tu yi dags / nub byang du byol song /
translated: the animals in the northwest,

original: byang shar du mi'i 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang shar du mi'i 'gro ba bri bar bya'o //

original: zhi ba'i rnal 'byor pa rdo rje sems dpa' bsgyur la zhi ba'i las @277b brtsam zhing /
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnal 'byor pa rdo rje sems dpa' bsgyur la zhi ba'i las @277b brtsam zhing /
translated: The yogi/nī of pacification, having transformed into Vajrasattva, should undertake the activity of pacification.🔽In the evil age, one should perform recitation and fire sacrifice, and imagine that a cloud of light rays emanates from one's body, reciting the mantra of beating as it occurs below.

original: dus ngan par bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg byed cing 'od zer sprin gyis de'i lus la 'og nas 'byung ba'i brdung ba'i sngags brjod cing 'phro bar gyur par bsgoms la shar du kha bltas nas gzhan gyi nyes pa sel bar byed la sems can la phan par dga'
analyzed: dus ngan par bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg byed cing 'od zer sprin gyis de'i lus la 'og nas 'byung ba'i brdung ba'i sngags brjod cing 'phro bar gyur par bsgoms la shar du kha bltas nas gzhan gyi nyes pa sel bar byed la sems can la phan par dga'
translated: Facing east, one should remove the faults of others and delight in benefiting sentient beings.

original: bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la mchod cing kun du bzang po'am bde ba chen po bsams nas nang par re re snga ma bzhin thams cad byas pas sdig pa zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la mchod cing kun du bzang po'am bde ba chen po bsams nas nang par re re snga ma bzhin thams cad byas pas sdig pa zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Thus, having made offerings to the Tathāgata family and contemplated Samantabhadra or Mahāsukha, one should do everything as before, each morning, and one’s evil will be pacified.

original: rgyas pa ni 'od zer ser po dang ldan pa'i rin chen 'dzin du bsams la /
analyzed: rgyas pa ni 'od zer ser po dang ldan pa'i rin chen 'dzin du bsams la /
translated: For prosperity, one should contemplate oneself as Ratṇin, endowed with yellow light rays,

original: zas dkar gsum bza' zhing nyi ma'i gung la rgyas pa'i las shis te /
analyzed: zas dkar gsum bza' zhing nyi ma'i gung la rgyas pa'i las shis te /
translated: and eat the three white foods. The rite for prosperity is auspicious at midday.

original: thab khung rin chen lta bur brkos la bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg bya ba ni /
analyzed: thab khung rin chen lta bur brkos la bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg bya ba ni /
translated: One should dig a hearth like a jewel and do the recitation and burnt offerings.

original: sngags pas snga ma bzhin du 'od zer ser pos lus dgong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngags pas snga ma bzhin du 'od zer ser pos lus dgong ngo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mantrin should, as before, fill his body with yellow light rays.

original: dbang du bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas thab khung padmo 'dra bar byas pa spyan ras gzigs su bdag bsgyur la nyi ma rgas pa'i mthar dbang du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas thab khung padmo 'dra bar byas pa spyan ras gzigs su bdag bsgyur la nyi ma rgas pa'i mthar dbang du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For enthrallment, one who is endowed with the deity yoga should make the hearth like a lotus, transform oneself into Avalokiteśvara, and enthrall at the end of the setting of the sun. This is the meaning.

original: de yang lha gang dag gi rnal 'byor gyis 'grub par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de yang lha gang dag gi rnal 'byor gyis 'grub par bstan pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the teaching on which deity yoga accomplishes which activity is as follows.

original: 'dren pa kun tu bzang pos ni zhi ba'i las bya'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa kun tu bzang pos ni zhi ba'i las bya'o //
translated: The guide Samantabhadra accomplishes the activity of pacification.

original: rdo rje rin chen gyi rnal 'byor ni rgyas gdab pa dbang bskur ba 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen gyi rnal 'byor ni rgyas gdab pa dbang bskur ba 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajraratna accomplishes the activity of sealing and empowerment.

original: rdo rje dpal gyi rnal 'byor ni rnam par rgyal ba dang longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang dpal mnyam pa med pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje dpal gyi rnal 'byor ni rnam par rgyal ba dang longs spyod dang / dbang phyug dang dpal mnyam pa med pa 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajraśrī accomplishes the activity of total victory, enjoyment, lordship, and unequaled glory.

original: rdo rje nyi ma ni gzi brjid dang mdog shin tu 'bar ba gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma ni gzi brjid dang mdog shin tu 'bar ba gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajrasūrya primarily accomplishes the activity of blazing splendor and complexion.

original: bzhad pa ni dga' mgu rangs pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: bzhad pa ni dga' mgu rangs pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajrahasita primarily accomplishes the activity of delight, joy, and satisfaction.

original: rdo rje chos ni chos thams cad brtags nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje chos ni chos thams cad brtags nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajradharma primarily accomplishes the activity of pleasing all buddhas and so on by examining all phenomena.

original: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i rigs rnon pos gcod pa nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i rigs rnon pos gcod pa nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajraheruka primarily accomplishes the activity of cutting the sharp edge of the great lord and so on.

original: ma rungs pa rnams rtsad nas gcod pa 'khor los gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: ma rungs pa rnams rtsad nas gcod pa 'khor los gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: The yoga of Vajracakra primarily accomplishes the activity of totally cutting the wicked.

original: mi smra ba smra bar mdzad cing ma rungs pa lkugs pas rdo rje smra ba gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: mi smra ba smra bar mdzad cing ma rungs pa lkugs pas rdo rje smra ba gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: One becomes the chief of the vajra-speech, the one who speaks for the mute, the one who is not a speaker.

original: rdo rje las kyi rnal 'byor gyis mchod pa dang sems can gyi don bya bar gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi rnal 'byor gyis mchod pa dang sems can gyi don bya bar gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: By the yoga of the vajra-action, one becomes the chief of the one who performs worship and benefits sentient beings.

original: rdo rje srung bas bsrung pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: rdo rje srung bas bsrung pa gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: By the vajra-protection, one becomes the chief of the one who protects.

original: ma rungs pa thams cad za ba rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gtso bor 'grub bo //
analyzed: ma rungs pa thams cad za ba rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gtso bor 'grub bo //
translated: By the vajra-yakṣa, one becomes the chief of the one who devours all evildoers.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bcings nas gtso bor 'grub bo //🔽de dag gi lha'i rnal @278a * //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyis bcings nas gtso bor 'grub bo // de dag gi lha'i rnal @278a * //
translated: By the vajra-fist, one becomes the chief of the one who binds.

original: 'byor gyis zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang / mngon spyod rnams la gcig dang bzhi dang bzhis gtso bor 'grub bo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byor gyis zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang / mngon spyod rnams la gcig dang bzhi dang bzhis gtso bor 'grub bo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By their deity yoga, one becomes the chief of the one who accomplishes pacification, increase, power, and destruction, respectively, by one, four, and four [rituals].

original: gzhan yang de dag gi thun mong gi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag gi thun mong gi 'bras bu ni /
translated: Moreover, their common result is

original: bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg gi las kyi dgos pa thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlas pa dang sbyin sreg gi las kyi dgos pa thams cad bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “one should accomplish all the purposes of the rites of mantra recitation and fire sacrifice.”

original: zhi ba la 'od zer gsal bas bsgrub pa'i dngos po gang bar bsgom zhing /
analyzed: zhi ba la 'od zer gsal bas bsgrub pa'i dngos po gang bar bsgom zhing /
translated: Since the light rays of Śāntika are clear, one should meditate on the object of accomplishment as being filled.

original: zhi ba lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zhi ba'i sems kyis zhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa zhi ba'i sems kyis zhi zhes bya'o //
translated: One who possesses the yoga of Śāntika Śiva and has a peaceful mind is called “peaceful.”

original: rang gi lus gser btsom lta bu dang / nyi ma shar ba lta bur bsams la rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus gser btsom lta bu dang / nyi ma shar ba lta bur bsams la rgyas pa'i las bya'o //
translated: One should imagine one’s body to be like refined gold and like the rising sun and perform the rite of increase.

original: 'od zer ser pos dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer ser pos dgang bar bya'o //
translated: One should fill it with yellow light rays.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi rnal 'byor gyis hri dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer btang bas bsgrub par bya ba'i snying la kun du bskor nas byed cing bsams na 'dod pa thams cad dbang du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi rnal 'byor gyis hri dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer btang bas bsgrub par bya ba'i snying la kun du bskor nas byed cing bsams na 'dod pa thams cad dbang du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should imagine that one emanates light rays like the syllable hrīḥ from the yoga of Avalokiteśvara, and one should encircle the heart of the object of the rite with them.

original: de ltar las rnams bshad nas de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i dus su rgyas gdab pa ston te /
analyzed: de ltar las rnams bshad nas de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i dus su rgyas gdab pa ston te /
translated: Having explained the rites in that way, then, beginning with “Then the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi,” he teaches the consecration at the time of the maṇḍala, homa, and so on of all the tantras.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, having bowed to the Blessed Vajrapāṇi, he said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir the tshom thams cad gcod pa ngan song thams cad bzlog pa'i rtog pa dam pa 'di bshad pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni dga' nas lan gnyis su zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir the tshom thams cad gcod pa ngan song thams cad bzlog pa'i rtog pa dam pa 'di bshad pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni dga' nas lan gnyis su zhus pa'o //
translated: Excellent, excellent, Blessed Vajrapāṇi, for the sake of benefiting all sentient beings, for explaining this excellent discourse that cuts through all doubts and averts all lower realms. This is the second request with joy.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes phyag rgya'i le'u 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni bde bar byed pas na phyag rgya ste 'og nas 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes phyag rgya'i le'u 'di bshad do zhes bya ba ni bde bar byed pas na phyag rgya ste 'og nas 'byung ba'o ;
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi explained this chapter on mudrās. Mudrā means that which brings happiness, as will be explained below.

original: / le'u zhes bya ba ni gos dang 'dra ba ste cho ga dang rim pa dang rnam par 'byed pa dang dum bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / le'u zhes bya ba ni gos dang 'dra ba ste cho ga dang rim pa dang rnam par 'byed pa dang dum bu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Chapter means that which is like clothing, with the meaning of ritual, sequence, analysis, and section.

original: 'di bshad do zhes pa ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bshad do zhes pa ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: Explained means taught.

original: lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag la aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag nas aa las zla ba h'um las rdo rje bskyed de thim pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag la aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis mdun du bzhag nas aa las zla ba h'um las rdo rje bskyed de thim pa'o //
translated: This means that having placed the two hands in front, one should generate a moon from the syllable a and a vajra from the syllable hum, and they dissolve.

original: h'um zhes bya ba dang aa zhes zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi byin gyis brlabs la zhes bya ba ni h'um a'a:zhes brjod pas so //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba dang aa zhes zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi byin gyis brlabs la zhes bya ba ni h'um a'a:zhes brjod pas so //
translated: The hum and the a are the blessings of the two moon disks. This means that by reciting hum a:.

original: lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo gnyis ka la aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu drug @278b kun du gang zhing 'phro bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni zla ba la g-yas skor gyis aa a'a la sogs pa bcu drug 'od zer dang bcas te zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi thal mo gnyis ka la aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu drug @278b kun du gang zhing 'phro bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni zla ba la g-yas skor gyis aa a'a la sogs pa bcu drug 'od zer dang bcas te zhes bya ba'i
translated: One should fill and radiate the sixteen syllables beginning with a in both the two palms. This means that on the moon, one should recite the sixteen syllables beginning with a and a: in a clockwise direction, together with light rays.

original: don to // mthe bong gnyis la aom zhes bya ba bzhag nas gung mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba gzhag / mdzub mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba gzhag / srin lag gnyis la hri zhes bya ba gzhag / mthe bong la aa zhes bya ba bzhag ste de ltar
analyzed: don to // mthe bong gnyis la aom zhes bya ba bzhag nas gung mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba gzhag / mdzub mo gnyis la h'um zhes bya ba gzhag / srin lag gnyis la hri zhes bya ba gzhag / mthe bong la aa zhes bya ba bzhag ste de ltar
translated: and place the two little fingers on the syllable aḥ.🔽Having thus placed the syllables, generate the conviction that they are the tathāgatas.

original: yi ge rnams gzhag par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin par mos pa bskyed de zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa la aom las rnam par snang mdzad /
analyzed: yi ge rnams gzhag par byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yin par mos pa bskyed de zhes bya ba ni g-yas pa la aom las rnam par snang mdzad /
translated: The meaning is: having placed the syllable oṃ on the right hand, generate Vairocana;

original: h'um la sogs pa la ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bskyed /
analyzed: h'um la sogs pa la ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bskyed /
translated: having placed the syllable hūṃ and so on, generate Akṣobhya and so on;

original: g-yon phyogs la aom las rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma /
analyzed: g-yon phyogs la aom las rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma /
translated: having placed the syllable oṃ on the left hand, generate Vajradhātvīśvarī;

original: h'um la sogs pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: h'um la sogs pa la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bskyed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: having placed the syllable hūṃ and so on, generate Vajrasattva and so on.

original: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres pa dang gdan rjes su mthun par byas te zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa yab yum rnams badzra aanydza li zhes bya bas rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba dang bdag gis kyang de'i don bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: chos thams cad gcig la gcig 'dres pa dang gdan rjes su mthun par byas te zhes bya ba ni bde bar gshegs pa yab yum rnams badzra aanydza li zhes bya bas rdo rje thal mo sbyar ba dang bdag gis kyang de'i don bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: All phenomena are mixed with each other means that the Sugatas, male and female, with vajra añjali, make a vajra-folded-hand gesture, and one should meditate on the meaning of that.

original: // lag pa gnyis padma lta bur sbyar ba byas nas /
analyzed: // lag pa gnyis padma lta bur sbyar ba byas nas /
translated: Having made the two hands like a lotus,

original: aom zhes bya ba gnyis brkyang ba dang aa zhes bya ba gnyis ba kug ste /
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba gnyis brkyang ba dang aa zhes bya ba gnyis ba kug ste /
translated: the two oṃs are extended, and the two aḥs are bent.🔽Likewise, the two hūṃs and the two hrīḥs are extended side by side. This is the pledge of all activities of the root mudra of the Bhagavān.

original: de bzhin du h'um zhes pa dang / hri zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi'o zhes bya ba ni mthe bong gnyis brkyang mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag gnyis padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du h'um zhes pa dang / hri zhes bya ba gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rtsa ba'i phyag rgya las thams cad dang ldan pa'i dam tshig gi'o zhes bya ba ni mthe bong gnyis brkyang mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag gnyis padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar bya /
translated: The two thumbs are extended, and the two index fingers and two ring fingers are like lotus petals.

original: gung mo gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba ni sdig pa sbyang ba la sogs pa las thams cad las mi 'da' ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gung mo gnyis gshibs te brkyang ba ni sdig pa sbyang ba la sogs pa las thams cad las mi 'da' ba'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The two index fingers extended side by side is the mudra of not transgressing all activities such as purifying evil and so on.

original: de nyid rnon po dang ldan pa dang / de las rab tu 'khor lo dang 'dra ba dang 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid rnon po ltar byas te bskor na 'khor lo'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid rnon po dang ldan pa dang / de las rab tu 'khor lo dang 'dra ba dang 'khor lo'i zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid rnon po ltar byas te bskor na 'khor lo'i phyag rgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: That very vajra añjali, made like a sword and rotated, is the wheel mudra.

original: de nyid las khar gzhag pa ni sgra ste 'di ni phyag rgya'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid khar gzhag pa sgra'i ste phyag rgya'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid las khar gzhag pa ni sgra ste 'di ni phyag rgya'i tshogs so zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid khar gzhag pa sgra'i ste phyag rgya'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: That very vajra añjali placed at the mouth is the sound mudra.

original: de nyid gnyis su byas nas las kyi phyag rgyar byas nas las kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su byas nas las kyi phyag rgyar byas nas las kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That very añjali, made into two, is the action mudra.

original: rdo rje thal mo de nyid gnyis su byas nas rdo rje khu tshur du byas te rang rang gi snying @279a * //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo de nyid gnyis su byas nas rdo rje khu tshur du byas te rang rang gi snying @279a * //
translated: That very vajra añjali, made into two, is made into vajra fists and applied to one’s heart.

original: gar sbyar na las su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gar sbyar na las su 'gyur ro //
translated: That is the action mudra.

original: g-yon pa mgo thod thogs 'dra dang // g-yas pa mdung rtse gsum pa zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa mgo thod thogs pa 'dra bar byas la g-yas pa mthe bos mthe'u chung mnan te /
analyzed: g-yon pa mgo thod thogs 'dra dang // g-yas pa mdung rtse gsum pa zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa mgo thod thogs pa 'dra bar byas la g-yas pa mthe bos mthe'u chung mnan te /
translated: The left hand is like holding a skull, and the right hand is like a trident.

original: lhag ma gsum mdung rtse gsum pa ltar byas pa ni ma mo dang gshin rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum mdung rtse gsum pa ltar byas pa ni ma mo dang gshin rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The left hand is like holding a skull, and the right hand presses the little finger with the thumb, and the remaining three fingers are like a trident.🔽The left hand is like a closed lotus, and the right hand is like an Om.

original: g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum dang // g-yas pa aom zhes bya ba gzhag / ces bya ba ni g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum pa lta bu byas la /🔽g-yas pa'i mtho bong kha'i phyogs su gzhag pa ni tshangs pa'i'o //🔽g-yon pa 'khor lo dbyug rtse gsum ;
analyzed: g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum dang // g-yas pa aom zhes bya ba gzhag / ces bya ba ni g-yon pa padma kha 'dzum pa lta bu byas la / g-yas pa'i mtho bong kha'i phyogs su gzhag pa ni tshangs pa'i'o // g-yon pa 'khor lo dbyug rtse gsum ;
translated: The left hand is like a closed lotus, and the right hand is placed near the mouth.🔽The left hand is like a wheel, and the right hand is like a trident.🔽The left hand is like holding a wheel, and the right hand is like a trident.🔽The left hand is like a wheel, and the right hand is like a trident.

original: / zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa 'khor lo thogs pa ltar byas la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni g-yon pa 'khor lo thogs pa ltar byas la /
translated: The left hand is like a wheel, and the right hand is like a trident.

analyzed: de nyid tshig dbang gsungs pa ste //

translated: This means that the index finger and thumb are like the nose of an elephant or crocodile. This is known as Rahu's.

original: @279b rgyu skar me stag 'phro ba 'dra //
analyzed: @279b rgyu skar me stag 'phro ba 'dra //
translated: The constellation is like sparks flying.

original: de nyid bskor na glog phreng gi //
analyzed: de nyid bskor na glog phreng gi //

original: bla 'og gzhag pa sprin phyag rgya //
analyzed: bla 'og gzhag pa sprin phyag rgya //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me stag 'phro ba ltar byas ba rgyu skar gyi'o //

original: de nyid bskor ba glog gi'o //
analyzed: de nyid bskor ba glog gi'o //

original: thal mo gnyis bla 'og tu gzhag pa sprin gyi'o //
analyzed: thal mo gnyis bla 'og tu gzhag pa sprin gyi'o //

original: 'di dag snying po phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: 'di dag snying po phyag rgya ste //

original: las kyi phyag rgya yang 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba ni thugs dam tshig snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya yang 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba ni thugs dam tshig snying po'i phyag rgya'o //

original: 'jig rten pa'i las kyi phyag rgya yang 'di dag nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i las kyi phyag rgya yang 'di dag nyid do //
translated: And these are also the mundane karma mudrās.🔽From that very mudrā, the ring fingers concealed is for Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nyid las srin lag sbas pa ni phyag na rdo rje'i zhes pa ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid las mdzub mo'i tshigs bar ma bcag pa ste dbang bskur ba rdo rje rin chen gyi phyag rgya ste /

translated: From that vajra-folded palms, the middle joint of the index fingers not bent is the mudrā of the consecration-bestowing vajra jewel.

original: de nyid las h'um zhes bya bas tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid las h'um zhes bya bas tshigs bar ma bcag pa ni dbang bskur ba sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: From that very mudrā, the middle joint of the index fingers not bent by the syllable hūṃ is the mudrā of bestowing consecration.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Ākāśagarbha.

original: de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba ni gshibs la srin lag padma 'dra bar byas pa 'di padma 'byung ba'i chags pa'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis gshibs srin lag padma 'dra bar bya ba ni rnam par gsal ba'i phyag rgya'o //

translated: The mudra of clarity is the two index fingers placed side by side and the ring fingers like a lotus.

original: mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag gnyis bsgreng ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba dang // hri zhes bya bas gshibs te bsgreng ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis dang srin lag gnyis bsgreng ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste de nyid las h'um zhes bya ba dang // hri zhes bya bas gshibs te bsgreng ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two index fingers and two ring fingers extended is Vajrasattva. From that same [mudra], with the two index fingers and ring fingers extended and touching, it is the mudra of Bhagavān Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni bde ba chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las padma 'dra bar byas pa ni bde ba chen po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: From that same [mudra], with the ring fingers like a lotus, it is the mudra of Mahasukha.

original: de nyid las 'od zer 'phro ba'i tshul du byas pa ni kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo padma 'dra bar byas pa dang // 'od zer 'phro ba ni bde ba chen po dang kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'od zer 'phro ba'i tshul du byas pa ni kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo padma 'dra bar byas pa dang // 'od zer 'phro ba ni bde ba chen po dang kun du bzang po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The same [mudra] made in the manner of emitting light rays is the mudra of Samantabhadra. The vajra palms made like a lotus and emitting light rays are the mudras of Great Bliss and Samantabhadra.

original: de nyid nang du bkug na ni //
analyzed: de nyid nang du bkug na ni //
translated: If one draws it in,

original: khro bo sna tshogs gzi can no //
analyzed: khro bo sna tshogs gzi can no //
translated: it is the wrathful one of various splendors.

original: zhes bya ba ni thal mo nang du bkug pa khro bo'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thal mo nang du bkug pa khro bo'i'o //
translated: The palms drawn in are the wrathful one's.

original: de nyid las shin tu bsdams pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid las shin tu bsdams pa ni rdo rje bsdams pa'o //
translated: If one binds it tightly, it is the vajra binding.

original: brkyang pa ni srung ba'o //
analyzed: brkyang pa ni srung ba'o //
translated: If extended, it is the protection [mudra].

original: hri zhes bya ba'i sa bon ni gnod sbyin gyi'o zhes bya ba sor mo rnams bsdams pa rdo rje dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rgyu dang / brkyang nas mgul du 'khyud pa srung ba'i dang // mdzub mo mche ba gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: hri zhes bya ba'i sa bon ni gnod sbyin gyi'o zhes bya ba sor mo rnams bsdams pa rdo rje dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rgyu dang / brkyang nas mgul du 'khyud pa srung ba'i dang // mdzub mo mche ba gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The seed syllable hri is the yaksha's. The cause of the vajra commitment mudra with the fingers bound, the protection with the fingers extended and embracing the neck, and the index finger fangs are the yaksha mudra.

original: h'um zhes bya ba lcags kyur byas pa ni bkug pa'o //
analyzed: h'um zhes bya ba lcags kyur byas pa ni bkug pa'o //
translated: The syllable hum made into a hook is the summoning [mudra].

original: de nyid mdar byas pa ni 'dod pa'o //🔽aom dang h'um gnyis sbyar ba dgyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyur byas pa rgyal po'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid mdar byas pa ni 'dod pa'o // aom dang h'um gnyis sbyar ba dgyes pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyur byas pa rgyal po'i'o //
translated: The same gesture with the tips of the index fingers touching is the gesture of desire.🔽The gesture of the two index fingers in the form of hooks is the gesture of the king.

original: mdzub mo gnyis mdar byas pa chags pa'i'o //🔽mthe bong dang @280a * //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis mdar byas pa chags pa'i'o // mthe bong dang @280a * //
translated: The gesture of the two index fingers in the form of tips is the gesture of passion.

original: mdzub mo gnyis se gol gtogs pa ni legs pa'i'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis se gol gtogs pa ni legs pa'i'o //
translated: The gesture of the two index fingers and thumbs in the form of a circle is the gesture of the excellent.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor lta bur byas pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor lta bur byas pa ni gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: The same gesture in the form of a circle is the gesture of splendor.

original: de nyid nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
translated: The same gesture in the form of a jewel is the gesture of the victory banner.

original: bskor na gzhag pa ste de nyid khar gzhag na dgyes shing 'dzum par mdzad pa ya mtshan no zhes bya ba rdo rje bsdams pa las 'od zer 'bar ba ltar byas pa gzi brjid kyi'o //
analyzed: bskor na gzhag pa ste de nyid khar gzhag na dgyes shing 'dzum par mdzad pa ya mtshan no zhes bya ba rdo rje bsdams pa las 'od zer 'bar ba ltar byas pa gzi brjid kyi'o //
translated: The gesture of the vajra fist is the gesture of the amazing, since it is placed in the mouth with a smile of delight.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nyid thal mor byas pa nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nyid thal mor byas pa nor bu 'dra bar byas pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi'o //
translated: The gesture of the vajra fist is the gesture of the victory banner, since it is made into a fist with the index finger and thumb in the form of a jewel.

original: de nyid bskor nas kha'i phyogs su gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
analyzed: de nyid bskor nas kha'i phyogs su gzhag pa ni bzhad pa'i'o //
translated: The same gesture placed in the direction of the mouth is the gesture of laughter.

original: thal mo padmo bkug pa ni padmo'i'o //
analyzed: thal mo padmo bkug pa ni padmo'i'o //
translated: The lotus gesture is the lotus.

original: aa zhes bya ba dang aom zhes bya ba gnyis nang du bkug pa ni ral gri'o //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba dang aom zhes bya ba gnyis nang du bkug pa ni ral gri'o //
translated: The sword is the two, the a and the om, drawn in.

original: gcig la gcig sbyar ba ni 'khor lo'i'o //🔽snga ma las aom zhes bya ba gnyis khar gzhag pa ni 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba thal mo padmo dang mthe'u chung dang mthe bong bkug nas lhag ma ral gri dang thal mo sbyar ba dang / mthe bong gnyis khar gzhag pa ni go rims bzhin du chos dang rnon po dang /
analyzed: gcig la gcig sbyar ba ni 'khor lo'i'o // snga ma las aom zhes bya ba gnyis khar gzhag pa ni 'byung ba ste zhes bya ba thal mo padmo dang mthe'u chung dang mthe bong bkug nas lhag ma ral gri dang thal mo sbyar ba dang / mthe bong gnyis khar gzhag pa ni go rims bzhin du chos dang rnon po dang /
translated: The wheel is the two joined together.🔽The emergence is the two oms placed in the mouth, as before.

original: 'khor lo dang smra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang smra ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The Dharma, the sharp, the wheel, and the speech are the lotus gesture, the little finger and the thumb drawn in, the rest like a sword, the lotus gesture, and the two thumbs placed in the mouth, respectively.🔽In brief, the seal is the seal that grants the activity.

original: mdor na phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni yon tan mdor bsdu na las thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na phyag rgya ni las kyi phyag rgya sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni yon tan mdor bsdu na las thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In brief, the quality is that it grants all activities.

original: de nyid bsdus mdud sprul mgor 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid bsdus mdud sprul mgor 'gyur //
translated: The snake's hood is the gathering of those.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid las mtshams gnyis bsdus la sor mo'i rtse mo bsdus nas btud de sprul mgo ltar byas pa ni klu dang chu lha'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo de nyid las mtshams gnyis bsdus la sor mo'i rtse mo bsdus nas btud de sprul mgo ltar byas pa ni klu dang chu lha'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudra of the naga and Varuna.

original: kun du gnod sbyin mche ba 'dra //
analyzed: kun du gnod sbyin mche ba 'dra //
translated: The universal yaksha is like fangs.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mche ba 'dra bar byas pa ni gnod sbyin no //🔽srin po yi ni khrag 'phrog pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo gnyis mche ba 'dra bar byas pa ni gnod sbyin no // srin po yi ni khrag 'phrog pa //
translated: This is the yaksha, with the two index fingers like fangs.🔽The rakshasa is the blood-drinking.

original: zhes bya ba khrag 'thung pa ltar byed pa srin po'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba khrag 'thung pa ltar byed pa srin po'i'o //
translated: This is the rakshasa, with the hands like blood-drinkers.

original: lag pa bskor ba rlung gi ste //
analyzed: lag pa bskor ba rlung gi ste //
translated: The wind is the circling of the hands.

original: dbyug to ldan pa gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: dbyug to ldan pa gnod sbyin no //
translated: The yaksha is the one with a club.

original: bum pa gzhag pa nor gyi'o //
analyzed: bum pa gzhag pa nor gyi'o //
translated: The wealth god is the one with the vase.

original: zhes bya ba ni lag pa bskor ba rlung lha'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lag pa bskor ba rlung lha'i'o //
translated: This is the wind god, with the circling of the hands.

original: dbyug to ltar byed pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
analyzed: dbyug to ltar byed pa ni gnod sbyin gyi'o //
translated: This is the yaksha, with the hands like a club.

original: lag pa gnyis bum pa ltar byed pa ni nor lha'i'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis bum pa ltar byed pa ni nor lha'i'o //
translated: This is the wealth god, with the two hands like a vase.

original: mthe bong ne le'i rna 'drar bya //
analyzed: mthe bong ne le'i rna 'drar bya //
translated: The thumbs are like the ears of an elephant.

original: mgo bo thod pa nag po ste //
analyzed: mgo bo thod pa nag po ste //
translated: The black skull is the head.

original: bhridgi ri ti lag brkyang pa //
analyzed: bhridgi ri ti lag brkyang pa //
translated: The extended hand is the bhrkuti.

original: pi wang g-yon thogs dri za'o //🔽lag gnyis 'bar ba me 'bar ba //
analyzed: pi wang g-yon thogs dri za'o // lag gnyis 'bar ba me 'bar ba //
translated: The left hand holding a lute is that of Gandharva.

original: gung mo dbyug 'dra gshin rje yi //
analyzed: gung mo dbyug 'dra gshin rje yi //
translated: The two hands blazing like fire is that of Agni.🔽The middle fingers like a club is that of Yama.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo nyid mthe bong gnyis rna ba dang 'dra bar bya ba ni rnam thos bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo nyid mthe bong gnyis rna ba dang 'dra bar bya ba ni rnam thos bu'o //
translated: The vajra-folded hands with the two thumbs like ears is that of Vaishravana.

original: g-yon pa mgo thod mkhal ma'i phyogs su @280b 'jog pa ni nag po chen po'i'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa mgo thod mkhal ma'i phyogs su @280b 'jog pa ni nag po chen po'i'o //
translated: The left hand placed on the head with the kidneys is that of Mahakala.

original: tha ma brkyang ba ni bhridgi ri ti'i'o //
analyzed: tha ma brkyang ba ni bhridgi ri ti'i'o //
translated: The extended little finger is that of Bhrigutari.

original: g-yon pa pi wang thogs pa ni dri za'i'o //🔽lhag ma gnyis kyi sor mo me 'dra bar byas pa ni me lha'i'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa pi wang thogs pa ni dri za'i'o // lhag ma gnyis kyi sor mo me 'dra bar byas pa ni me lha'i'o //
translated: The left hand holding a lute is that of Gandharva.🔽The fingers of the remaining two hands made like fire is that of Agni.

original: lag pa gnyis kyi gung mo dbyug pa 'dra bar byas pa ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi gung mo dbyug pa 'dra bar byas pa ni gshin rje'o //
translated: The middle fingers of the two hands made like a club is that of Yama.

original: rnal 'byor khro dang dbang sbyin pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor khro dang dbang sbyin pa //
translated: The yoga is wrathful, granting power,

original: mthe'u chung ral gri mdzub gzhag can //
analyzed: mthe'u chung ral gri mdzub gzhag can //
translated: with the little finger a sword and the index finger

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo las mthe'u chung gnyis ral gri ltar byas pa ni rna ba la gzhag la khro bo'i tshul du bya ba dang mdzub mo gnyis zhags pa ltar byas pa ste gzhan la dbang du byed pa sbyin pa dang bcas pa chu
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje thal mo las mthe'u chung gnyis ral gri ltar byas pa ni rna ba la gzhag la khro bo'i tshul du bya ba dang mdzub mo gnyis zhags pa ltar byas pa ste gzhan la dbang du byed pa sbyin pa dang bcas pa chu
translated: This is the mudrā of the ear, made from the vajra-folded palms with the two little fingers like swords, placed at the ear, with a wrathful expression, and the two index fingers like a noose, bestowing subjugation on others.

original: lha 'khor dang bcas pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lha 'khor dang bcas pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of the water god and his retinue.

original: rlung gi rgyal mtshan rang gi gdong //

analyzed: phyir ro // de nas lha rnams kun mgu nas //
translated: Then, all the gods delighted

original: phyag na rdo rje phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje phyag 'tshal te //
translated: and having bowed to Vajrapāṇi,

original: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bshad pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to explain the maṇḍala of the wrathful one,

original: gsol ba 'debs pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: they became supplicants.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi ma'i rgyud bshad pas lha rnams mgu nas phyag 'tshal nas khros pas khro bo spangs pa'i phyir gsol ba 'de bas pa nyid du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang phyi ma'i rgyud bshad pas lha rnams mgu nas phyag 'tshal nas khros pas khro bo spangs pa'i phyir gsol ba 'de bas pa nyid du gyur to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, having explained the root tantra and the continuation of the tantra, the gods, delighted and having bowed, became supplicants in order to abandon wrath by means of wrath.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes rang gi sku bor te zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i skur bor te'o //🔽rdo rje sems dpa'i skur zhugs nas //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes rang gi sku bor te zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i skur bor te'o // rdo rje sems dpa'i skur zhugs nas //
translated: Then, the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi cast off his own body means he cast off his peaceful body.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo sems dpa'i skur gyur pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo sems dpa'i skur gyur pa'o /
translated: Having entered the body of Vajrasattva means he became the body of the wrathful being.

original: 'dis ni sbyor ba dang po'i ting nge 'dzin ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor ba dang po'i ting nge 'dzin ston to //
translated: This teaches the first stage of union samādhi.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis phyag na rdo rje'i skur bskyed la /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis phyag na rdo rje'i skur bskyed la /
translated: Those who wish to practice the gateway of mantra should generate the body of Vajrapāṇi.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsang sngags kyis khro bo'i skur bsgyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gsang sngags kyis khro bo'i skur bsgyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they should transform into the body of the wrathful one through the mantra that will be explained below.

original: rdo rje gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa zhes bya bas ni sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa thugs rje chen po mtshungs pa'i khro bo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa zhes bya bas ni sems dang sems las byung ba gnyis su med pa thugs rje chen po mtshungs pa'i khro bo'o //
translated: The non-dual equality of the two vajras refers to the wrathful one who is equal in great compassion, without the duality of mind and mental factors.

original: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The samādhi that focuses on that is also called by that name.

original: de'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni mngon du mdzad pa'o //
translated: The one who enters into union with that is the one who actualizes it.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' khro bo zhes bya ba ni khro bo sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' khro bo zhes bya ba ni khro bo sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: The wrathful Vajrasattva is the wrathful one himself.

original: me'i rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba ni khro bo lhag ma rnams te dbyer mi phyed pa'i 'od dan ldan pa'o //
analyzed: me'i rdo rje nyi ma zhes bya ba ni khro bo lhag ma rnams te dbyer mi phyed pa'i 'od dan ldan pa'o //
translated: The fire-vajra sun is the remaining wrathful ones, who are endowed with indivisible light.

original: snying po 'di nyid kyi thugs ka nas byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: snying po 'di nyid kyi thugs ka nas byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying po'o //
translated: This essence itself arose from his heart means the essence that will be stated below.

original: de nyid kyi nges pa'i ye shes las phyung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nges pa'i ye shes las phyung ba'o //
translated: It was extracted from the definitive pristine consciousness of that very one.

original: de nyid aom badzra kro dha aa na l'arka ma h'a badzra /
analyzed: de nyid aom badzra kro dha aa na l'arka ma h'a badzra /
translated: That very one is OṂ VAJRA KRODHA ĀNALA ĀRKA MAHĀVAJRA,

original: badzra kro dha dra ba dra ba /
analyzed: badzra kro dha dra ba dra ba /
translated: VAJRA KRODHA DRAVA DRAVA,

original: bi dra ba bi dra ba /
analyzed: bi dra ba bi dra ba /
translated: VIDRAVA VIDRAVA,

original: sarba aa ba ya /
analyzed: sarba aa ba ya /
translated: SARVA AVAYA,

original: n'a sha ya n'a sha ya /
analyzed: n'a sha ya n'a sha ya /
translated: NĀŚAYA NĀŚAYA,

original: ha ra ha ra phra nam h'um phat /
analyzed: ha ra ha ra phra nam h'um phat /
translated: HARA HARA PRANAMAH HŪṂ PHAṬ.

original: khro bo rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: khro bo rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: This is the wrathful Vajrasattva.

original: aom tree lo kya ka ri h'um phat /
analyzed: aom tree lo kya ka ri h'um phat /
translated: OṂ TRILOKYA KĀRI HŪṂ PHAṬ.

original: 'jig rten gsum snang gi'o //🔽aom tree lo kya da ma ka h'um phat /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum snang gi'o // aom tree lo kya da ma ka h'um phat /
translated: This is the illuminator of the three worlds.🔽 OṂ TRILOKYA DAMAKA HŪṂ PHAṬ.

original: 'jig rten gsum 'dul gyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum 'dul gyi'o //
translated: This is the tamer of the three worlds.

original: aom tree lo kya n'a sha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom tree lo kya n'a sha h'um phat /
translated: OṂ TRILOKYA NĀŚA HŪṂ PHAṬ.🔽 This is the destroyer of the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum 'jig gi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum 'jig gi'o //
translated: The world will be destroyed!

original: aom tri lo kya ha na ta ka h'um phat /
analyzed: aom tri lo kya ha na ta ka h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ trilokya hantaka hūṃ phaṭ.

original: 'jig rten gsum mthar byed kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum mthar byed kyi'o //
translated: The world's destroyer.

original: aom aa mri te h'um phat /
analyzed: aom aa mri te h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ amṛte hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i'o //
analyzed: aom bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i'o //
translated: The amṛta-coiling.

original: aom k'a la danda h'um phat /
analyzed: aom k'a la danda h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kāladanda hūṃ phaṭ.

original: be con sngon po'i'o /
analyzed: be con sngon po'i'o /
translated: The blue staff.

original: aom ka la ha ni h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ka la ha ni h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālahani hūṃ phaṭ.

original: mi g-yo mgon po'i'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo mgon po'i'o //
translated: The immovable lord.

original: aom ha ya gr'i ba h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ha ya gr'i ba h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hayagrīva hūṃ phaṭ.

original: rta mgrin @282b kyi'o ;
analyzed: rta mgrin @282b kyi'o ;
translated: The horse-headed.

original: / aom ka la aangku sha h'um phat /
analyzed: / aom ka la aangku sha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālāṅkuśa hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The hook.

original: lcags kyu'i'o // aom ka la p'a sha h'um phat /
analyzed: lcags kyu'i'o // aom ka la p'a sha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālapāśa hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The noose.

original: zhags pa'i'o // aom ka la bahdha h'um phat /
analyzed: zhags pa'i'o // aom ka la bahdha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālabhañja hūṃ phaṭ.

original: lcags sgrog gi'o //
analyzed: lcags sgrog gi'o //
translated: The chain.

original: aom ka la gtanta h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ka la gtanta h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālagandha hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The bell.

original: dril bu'i'o // aom ka la raksha si h'um phat /
analyzed: dril bu'i'o // aom ka la raksha si h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālarakṣasi hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The protector.

original: srung ma'i'o // aom ka la danda h'um phat /
analyzed: srung ma'i'o // aom ka la danda h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kāladanda hūṃ phaṭ.

original: be con mi'i'o //
analyzed: be con mi'i'o //
translated: The staff.

original: aom ka la ra ti h'um phat /
analyzed: aom ka la ra ti h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālarati hūṃ phaṭ.🔽The delight.

original: dga' ma'i'o // aom ka la ya ksha si h'um phat /
analyzed: dga' ma'i'o // aom ka la ya ksha si h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ kālayakṣi hūṃ phaṭ.

original: gnod sbyin gyi'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi'o //
translated: The yakṣa.

original: 'di dag gis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bstan to //
translated: These [verses] teach the supreme king of mandalas.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom pa rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i thug su sngags bkod la bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog sgom pa rnams kyis rdo rje sems dpa'i thug su sngags bkod la bskyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that those who practice the conduct of the gateway of mantra and meditate on the supreme king of mandalas should generate [themselves as] Vajrasattva by arranging the mantra in the heart.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni de bzhin du sngar bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum pa ni de bzhin du sngar bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The third meditative stabilization should be understood as taught previously.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor mi zad pa //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor mi zad pa //
translated: Then, the inexhaustible mandala,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi las ston te /
translated: and so on, teaches the ritual of the master.

original: bsnyen pa dang lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga thams cad spyad pa /
analyzed: bsnyen pa dang lhag par gnas pa'i cho ga thams cad spyad pa /
translated: Having performed all the rituals of approach and accomplishment,

original: de nas khro bo'i dkyil 'khor yangs pa rtsibs bcu gnyis pa 'od zer 'bar bas dkrigs shing cher 'bar bar snga ma ltar phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris nas lte ba la rdo rje sems dpa' gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khro bo'i dkyil 'khor yangs pa rtsibs bcu gnyis pa 'od zer 'bar bas dkrigs shing cher 'bar bar snga ma ltar phyi'i dkyil 'khor bris nas lte ba la rdo rje sems dpa' gzhag par bya'o //
translated: then, having drawn the outer mandala as before, with a vast wrathful mandala of twelve spokes, filled with blazing light, blazing greatly, Vajrasattva should be placed in the center.

original: dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the northeast,

original: shar gyi rtsibs gnyis la gsum snang dang gsum 'dul /
analyzed: shar gyi rtsibs gnyis la gsum snang dang gsum 'dul /
translated: On the two spokes in the east, Trisanandin and Trisantrâsa.

original: lho'i rtsibs gnyis la gsum 'jig dang gsum mthar byed /🔽nub kyi rtsibs gnyis la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang be con sngon po /
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs gnyis la gsum 'jig dang gsum mthar byed / nub kyi rtsibs gnyis la bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang be con sngon po /
translated: On the two spokes in the south, Trisanghâta and Trisantapta.🔽On the two spokes in the west, Amrâkuanda and Nîlagarbha.

original: byang gi rtsibs gnyis la mi g-yo mgon po dang rta mgrin /🔽me'i phyogs kyi rtsibs su srung ba'o //
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs gnyis la mi g-yo mgon po dang rta mgrin / me'i phyogs kyi rtsibs su srung ba'o //
translated: On the two spokes in the north, Acalanâtha and Hayagriva.🔽On the spoke in the southeast, Raksa.

original: srin po'i phyogs kyi rtsibs la be con ma /🔽rlung gi phyogs kyi rtsibs la dga' ba mo /
analyzed: srin po'i phyogs kyi rtsibs la be con ma / rlung gi phyogs kyi rtsibs la dga' ba mo /
translated: On the spoke in the southwest, Khadga.🔽On the spoke in the northwest, Rati.

original: dbang ldan phyogs kyi rtsibs la gnod sbyin mo //
analyzed: dbang ldan phyogs kyi rtsibs la gnod sbyin mo //
translated: On the spoke in the northeast, Yakshî.

original: khro bo brgyad 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad mnan pa zhal 'jigs pa phyag brgya phrag du ma mnga' ba /
analyzed: khro bo brgyad 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad mnan pa zhal 'jigs pa phyag brgya phrag du ma mnga' ba /
translated: The eight wrathful ones trample the eight Lokapâlas. They have terrifying faces and many hundreds of arms.

original: sprul dang thod kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: sprul dang thod kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are adorned with snakes and skulls.

original: stag lpags smad dkris byas pa /
analyzed: stag lpags smad dkris byas pa /
translated: They wear tiger-skin skirts.

original: rgyu ma thogs ba sprul pa phyag dang dbu mtha' yas pa 'byung ba /
analyzed: rgyu ma thogs ba sprul pa phyag dang dbu mtha' yas pa 'byung ba /
translated: They hold intestines and produce infinite emanations of arms and heads.

original: de dag kyang mgo thod shas bkang ba phyag na thogs par bri /
analyzed: de dag kyang mgo thod shas bkang ba phyag na thogs par bri /
translated: They also hold skulls filled with blood in their hands.

original: phyi rol na srin mo bdun cu la sogs pa gzhag / sgo ba rnams lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan thogs par bri /
analyzed: phyi rol na srin mo bdun cu la sogs pa gzhag / sgo ba rnams lcags kyu la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan thogs par bri /
translated: The gatekeepers should be painted holding their respective implements, such as the iron hook, and so forth.

original: de nas bdud rtsis gang ba'i bum pa bcu drug gzhag bdug pa dang me tog dri mar me kha zas @283a * //
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsis gang ba'i bum pa bcu drug gzhag bdug pa dang me tog dri mar me kha zas @283a * //
translated: Then, one should place sixteen vases filled with nectar, incense, flowers, perfume, lamps,

original: kyis bkang ba'i gtor ma bsham /
analyzed: kyis bkang ba'i gtor ma bsham /
translated: and a bali filled with food.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba'i bdud rtsis mgo thod gang bar gyur pa rnams gzhag ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba'i bdud rtsis mgo thod gang bar gyur pa rnams gzhag ces bya ba yin no //
translated: One should place the skull-cup filled with the nectar of food and drink.

original: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyang //
analyzed: de nas slob dpon bdag nyid kyang //
translated: Then, the master himself🔽should enter with the skull-cup gesture.

original: mgu nas mgo thod phyag rgyas gzhug / phyag rgya de dang de yis ni /
analyzed: mgu nas mgo thod phyag rgyas gzhug / phyag rgya de dang de yis ni /
translated: With that and that gesture,

original: sha rnams kun gyi dam tshig gsol //
analyzed: sha rnams kun gyi dam tshig gsol //
translated: he should request the pledge of all the flesh.

original: de nas 'dod ldan rnyed nas ni //
analyzed: de nas 'dod ldan rnyed nas ni //
translated: Then, having obtained the desired,

original: zhes bya ba la de ltar dgongs ka'i dus mtshams la bab pa dang / slob dpon gyis mgo thod kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor du zhugs te chad pa dang lhag pa zhi bar bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ltar dgongs ka'i dus mtshams la bab pa dang / slob dpon gyis mgo thod kyi phyag rgyas dkyil 'khor du zhugs te chad pa dang lhag pa zhi bar bya /
translated: At the time of the evening meal, the master should enter the maṇḍala with the skull-cup gesture and pacify any omissions or additions.

original: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum sngon du 'gro bas sgo dbye /
analyzed: de nas ting nge 'dzin gsum sngon du 'gro bas sgo dbye /
translated: Then, having first performed the three meditative stabilizations, one should open the door.

original: bsdu na nam mkha' la mgo thod kyi phyag rgya de dang / rnal 'byor de'i sha rnams kyi dam tshig gsol lo //
analyzed: bsdu na nam mkha' la mgo thod kyi phyag rgya de dang / rnal 'byor de'i sha rnams kyi dam tshig gsol lo //
translated: If one is brief, one should make the gesture of the skull-cup in space and restore the commitments of the flesh of that yogin.

original: de nas 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnyed nas h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags bcas pas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa'i dngos grub rnyed nas h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags bcas pas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, having obtained the desired powers, one should accomplish the mantra together with the mantra “hum.”

original: de nas sngags mkhan sgor sgo ma //
analyzed: de nas sngags mkhan sgor sgo ma //
translated: Then, the mantra practitioner should guard the door.

original: de nyid dran byed bsnyen par bya //
analyzed: de nyid dran byed bsnyen par bya //
translated: One should approach the one who is mindful of reality.

original: zhes bya ba ni lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing bgegs bskrad bsrung /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lcags kyu la sogs pas las bya zhing bgegs bskrad bsrung /
translated: This means that one should perform the rites with the hook and so forth, drive away obstructors, and guard.

original: sgo bcad phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab dbang bskur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgo bcad phyag rgya bzhis rgyas gdab dbang bskur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “close the door, seal with the four seals, and confer initiation” is this.

original: des ni nges par dngos grub ster //
analyzed: des ni nges par dngos grub ster //
translated: By that, one will certainly obtain powers.

original: yud tsam 'jig rten dbang du 'gyur //🔽dkyil 'khor du ni tshogs rnams dang // rang gi lha yi tshogs rnams la ;
analyzed: yud tsam 'jig rten dbang du 'gyur // dkyil 'khor du ni tshogs rnams dang // rang gi lha yi tshogs rnams la ;
translated: In an instant, one will control the world.🔽In the maṇḍala, one should recite the commitments that arise from the tantra

original: / rgyud las byung ba'i dam tshig brjod //
analyzed: / rgyud las byung ba'i dam tshig brjod //
translated: to the assembly of deities and to the assembly of one’s own deity.

original: ces bya ba ni dngos grub 'jig rten dbang du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rang gi tshogs rtsa ba'i rgyud la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dngos grub 'jig rten dbang du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rang gi tshogs rtsa ba'i rgyud la 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the root tantra of the deities of the outer mandala for the accomplishment of the subjugation of the world.

original: bzlas brjod kyi dam tshig thog ma dang tha ma med pa de srid kyi bar bar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzlas brjod kyi dam tshig thog ma dang tha ma med pa de srid kyi bar bar brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pledge of recitation is to recite the mantra without beginning or end as long as one lives.

original: de nas mchod de langs nas kyang //🔽tshogs can rdo rje sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: de nas mchod de langs nas kyang // tshogs can rdo rje sems dpa' yi //
translated: Then, having worshipped and arisen,🔽one should emerge abiding in the manner of

original: tshul du gnas nas 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: tshul du gnas nas 'byung bar bya //
translated: the vajra being of the gaṇas.

original: zhes pa ni mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg dang / gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug pa byas la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mchod pa dang / gtor ma dang / sbyin sreg dang / gnang ba nod pa'i mthar thug pa byas la /
translated: Having performed the worship, the bali offering, the burnt offering, and the request for permission,

original: tshogs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' khro bo'i tshul du gnas nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' khro bo'i tshul du gnas nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one should emerge abiding in the manner of the wrathful being of the gaṇas, the vajra being.

original: de nas slob ma bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: de nas slob ma bsdus nas ni //
translated: Then, having gathered the disciples,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs ston te /
translated: and so on, teaches the entry of the disciples and so on.

original: slob ma rnams snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad byas te lag tu rin po che thogs su bcug la /
analyzed: slob ma rnams snga ma bzhin du cho ga thams cad byas te lag tu rin po che thogs su bcug la /
translated: The disciples should perform all the rites as before, and then hold a jewel in their hands.

original: aom badzra kro dha zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: With the mantra “Oṃ vajra wrathful one” and so forth,

original: aom badzra @283b kro dha sa ma ya ma ti kra ma h'um phat ces bya bas dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
analyzed: aom badzra @283b kro dha sa ma ya ma ti kra ma h'um phat ces bya bas dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
translated: “Oṃ vajra wrathful one, be firm, hūṃ phaṭ,” they should be admitted into the maṇḍala.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa bzhin du cho ga lhag ma rjes su spyad nas /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud du gsungs pa bzhin du cho ga lhag ma rjes su spyad nas /
translated: Having performed the remaining rites according to the Root Tantra,

original: aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa h'um phat aa zhes bya ba 'dis khro bo'i bum pas dbang bskur la /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha sa ma ya aa bhi shinytsa h'um phat aa zhes bya ba 'dis khro bo'i bum pas dbang bskur la /
translated: with “Oṃ vajra wrathful one, confer empowerment, hūṃ phaṭ aḥ,” they should be empowered with the wrathful vase.

original: dbang bskur ba nyi shu po kun rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba nyi shu po kun rtsa ba'i rgyud du bshad pa bzhin du dbang bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all twenty empowerments should be conferred according to the explanation in the Root Tantra.

original: de nyid du dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la dngos grub bstan pa'i phyir de nas de dag gi sgrub pa bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la dngos grub bstan pa'i phyir de nas de dag gi sgrub pa bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Then, in order to show the spiritual powers to those who have obtained empowerment there, it is said, “Then, the practice of those is explained.”

original: de dag gi sgrub pa bshad pa ni sngar bshad pa'i cho gas khro bo gang yang rung bar bskyed de /
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub pa bshad pa ni sngar bshad pa'i cho gas khro bo gang yang rung bar bskyed de /
translated: The explanation of their practice is that, by the rite explained previously, one generates any wrathful deity.🔽One meditates on the seed syllable at the center of the sun at one's heart, and an immeasurable number of wrathful deities. Then, one meditates on the seed syllable and the wrathful deities mixed into one.

original: snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rang gi yi ge la khro bo dpag tu med pa bsgoms nas yi ge dang khro bo gcig tu bsres te bsgom pa dang / dang po bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa bsgoms na nges par gsod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la rang gi yi ge la khro bo dpag tu med pa bsgoms nas yi ge dang khro bo gcig tu bsres te bsgom pa dang / dang po bsnyen pa dang sgrub pa bsgoms na nges par gsod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one meditates on the approach and accomplishment in this way, one will definitely kill.🔽The Bhagavān says:

original: bdag nyid khro bor snyoms zhugs te //
analyzed: bdag nyid khro bor snyoms zhugs te //
translated: One enters into union with the wrathful one.

original: de nas snying gar nyi ma bsgom //
analyzed: de nas snying gar nyi ma bsgom //
translated: Then one meditates on the sun at the heart.

original: rang gi chos kyi yi ge las //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyi yi ge las //
translated: From one's seed syllable of reality

original: khros nas yang dang yang 'phros shing //
analyzed: khros nas yang dang yang 'phros shing //
translated: One emanates wrathfully again and again.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsgom par bya //
translated: One meditates on those two as one.

original: de nas 'grub 'gyur gzhan du min //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas 'grub 'gyur gzhan du min // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then one will be accomplished, not otherwise.

original: khro bo'i las gsod pa kho na'am zhe na /
analyzed: khro bo'i las gsod pa kho na'am zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether the activity of the wrathful one is only killing,

original: gzhan yang yin par /🔽khro bo'i rgyal po las dngos su ;
analyzed: gzhan yang yin par / khro bo'i rgyal po las dngos su ;
translated: the answer is that it is also other than that.🔽Although the activity of the king of wrathful ones is explained

original: / gsod par yin par bshad mod kyi //
analyzed: / gsod par yin par bshad mod kyi //
translated: as directly killing,

original: zhi dang dbang dang rgyas pa rnams //
analyzed: zhi dang dbang dang rgyas pa rnams //
translated: Pacification, subjugation, and increase,

original: 'di dag byed 'gyur gdon mi za //
analyzed: 'di dag byed 'gyur gdon mi za //
translated: these he will accomplish, there is no doubt.

original: zhes bya ba yin te khro bo thams cad thun mong gi sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te khro bo thams cad thun mong gi sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching of the common siddhi of all the wrathful ones.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Abiding in the samadhi of Vajrasattva,

original: khro bo dkyil 'khor bsgom byas nas //
analyzed: khro bo dkyil 'khor bsgom byas nas //
translated: having meditated on the mandala of wrathful ones,

original: sdug pa'i sems can 'dzin byed cing //
analyzed: sdug pa'i sems can 'dzin byed cing //
translated: one should hold the mind to the beloved being.

original: mdor na dug rims gdon la sogs //
analyzed: mdor na dug rims gdon la sogs //
translated: In brief, poisons, fevers, spirits, and so forth,

original: de bzhin de dag thams cad ni //
analyzed: de bzhin de dag thams cad ni //
translated: and likewise all of them,

original: thabs la sogs pas 'jigs byed pa'i //
analyzed: thabs la sogs pas 'jigs byed pa'i //
translated: are destroyed by the means and so forth

original: khros nas snying las 'byung 'gyur bar //
analyzed: khros nas snying las 'byung 'gyur bar //
translated: of one who is wrathful and arises from the heart.

original: bsad pa'i las la brtsam par bya //
analyzed: bsad pa'i las la brtsam par bya //
