translated: One should commence the activity of killing.

original: khros par gyur nas rgod pa'i las //
analyzed: khros par gyur nas rgod pa'i las //
translated: Having become wrathful, one should perform the activity of laughing,

original: sha dang khrag rnams 'jib byed cing //
analyzed: sha dang khrag rnams 'jib byed cing //
translated: licking the flesh and blood,

original: de dag 'tsho ba sreg par byed //
analyzed: de dag 'tsho ba sreg par byed //
translated: and burning their life force.

original: bsams nas nges par brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsams nas nges par brlag par 'gyur //
translated: Having contemplated, they will certainly be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa ltar rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chi bdag 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor las bshad pa ltar rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: As explained in the mandala of conquering the Lord of Death, one should perform the yoga of one's deity.

original: khro bo rdo rje sems dpar bskyed nas rang @284a * //
analyzed: khro bo rdo rje sems dpar bskyed nas rang @284a * //
translated: Having generated the wrathful Vajrasattva, one should meditate on the wrathful mandala in one’s heart.

original: gi snying gar khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te gdug pa dang rims la sogs pa thugs rje chen po'i thabs khro bos 'joms par bsams nas /
analyzed: gi snying gar khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms te gdug pa dang rims la sogs pa thugs rje chen po'i thabs khro bos 'joms par bsams nas /
translated: Having contemplated the destruction of evil and contagious diseases by the wrathful method of great compassion,

original: snying ga'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor las khro bo spros te bzhad pa'i zhal gyi sha dang khrag 'jib cing /
analyzed: snying ga'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor las khro bo spros te bzhad pa'i zhal gyi sha dang khrag 'jib cing /
translated: one should emanate wrathful deities from the wrathful mandala in the heart, sucking the flesh and blood from the mouths of the wrathful deities,🔽and contemplate the approach and accomplishment of the separation of life and death.

original: srog dang bral bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub par bsams nas nges par brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog dang bral bar bsnyen pa dang sgrub par bsams nas nges par brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should contemplate the destruction of the evil.

original: gzhan yang khro bo 'jig rten gsum snang kha dog dkar po bsgom zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang khro bo 'jig rten gsum snang kha dog dkar po bsgom zhing /
translated: Furthermore, one should meditate on the white color of the wrathful deity of the three worlds.🔽Then, having contemplated the pervasion by the mandala that arises from that, having emitted that light, one should contemplate the contagious disease, etc.,

original: de nas byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis khyab par bsams la 'od de phyung nas rims la sogs pa ring du dor la 'od las h'um byung rdo rjer bsam zhing 'od las h'um lta bu'i 'khor lor gyur pa go char bya /
analyzed: de nas byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis khyab par bsams la 'od de phyung nas rims la sogs pa ring du dor la 'od las h'um byung rdo rjer bsam zhing 'od las h'um lta bu'i 'khor lor gyur pa go char bya /
translated: as being cast far away, and having contemplated the vajra arising from the light, one should contemplate the wheel like the hūṃ in the light as an armor.

original: 'od zer gyi chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi chus spyi bo nas dbang bskur /
translated: One should confer empowerment with the water of light rays from the crown.

original: de nas ming nas smos shing bzlas brjod dang bsnyen pa dang bsgrub pa tshul bzhin du bsams na 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de nas ming nas smos shing bzlas brjod dang bsnyen pa dang bsgrub pa tshul bzhin du bsams na 'grub par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Then, if one thinks of the recitation, the approach, and the accomplishment, by way of the name, and the recitation, one will be successful.

original: khro bo 'jig rten gsum snang mdzad //
analyzed: khro bo 'jig rten gsum snang mdzad //
translated: The wrathful one is the illuminator of the three worlds.

original: zla ba 'dra ba'i dge bsams shing ;
analyzed: zla ba 'dra ba'i dge bsams shing ;
translated: Thinking of the moon-like virtue,🔽one should think of the special transformation

original: /'od zer phyung ba mang po yis //🔽khyad par gyur par rnam bsam la //🔽rims dang gdon dang dug la sogs //
analyzed: /'od zer phyung ba mang po yis // khyad par gyur par rnam bsam la // rims dang gdon dang dug la sogs //
translated: of the many light rays that are emitted.

original: 'od zer des ni phyung nas kyang //🔽de yi nad bgegs gnod pa sems //
analyzed: 'od zer des ni phyung nas kyang // de yi nad bgegs gnod pa sems //
translated: The light rays are emitted🔽for the sake of pacifying

original: zhi bya'i phyir ni ring du dor //
analyzed: zhi bya'i phyir ni ring du dor //
translated: the harm of the disease and obstacle of that person.

original: de nas h'um gi tshogs bzhag la //
analyzed: de nas h'um gi tshogs bzhag la //
translated: Then, having placed the assembly of hūṃs,

original: rdo rje lta bur lus bsam zhing //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bur lus bsam zhing //
translated: one should think of the body as being like a vajra.

original: h'um gi 'khor los go char bya //
analyzed: h'um gi 'khor los go char bya //
translated: One should make the armor with the wheel of hūṃs.

original: 'od zer chu yis dbang bskur ro //🔽de nas de yi ming smos shing //
analyzed: 'od zer chu yis dbang bskur ro // de nas de yi ming smos shing //
translated: One should confer empowerment with the water of light rays.🔽Then, one should think of the recitation

original: bzlas pa'i tshul gyis bsam par bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽sbyin sreg rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni de nas /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i tshul gyis bsam par bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no // sbyin sreg rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni de nas /
translated: by way of the name of that person.🔽The teaching of the three types of burnt offerings is as follows.

original: khung bu gsum las rnam gcig ni //
analyzed: khung bu gsum las rnam gcig ni //
translated: One of the three pits is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po zhi ba bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po zhi ba bstan te /
translated: Thus, the first is taught to be pacifying.

original: de yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang gsum las /
analyzed: de yang zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang gsum las /
translated: Moreover, among the three—pacifying, increasing, and controlling—

original: zhi ba ni kha dog dkar po /🔽tha ma ni khru gang /
analyzed: zhi ba ni kha dog dkar po / tha ma ni khru gang /
translated: pacifying is the white color.🔽The smallest is one cubit,

original: bar pa khru do /
analyzed: bar pa khru do /
translated: the medium is one and a half cubits,

original: mchog khru bzhi'o //
analyzed: mchog khru bzhi'o //
translated: and the best is four cubits.

original: rnal 'byor pa nges dang por sa rnams rab sbyangs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nges dang por sa rnams rab sbyangs te /
translated: The yogi/nī first cleans the ground well,

original: 'khor lo'i steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa cig thab khung gi dbus su bri /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i steng na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su rdo rje rtse lnga pa cig thab khung gi dbus su bri /
translated: and in the center of the hearth, on top of the maṇḍala, one should draw a five-pointed vajra in the center of the hearth.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa 'jig rten gsum snang la sogs pa'i phyag rgya 'od zer dkar por 'phrog 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs brgya 'joms pa bye brag tu phye ba bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi 'khor lo rtsibs bcu gnyis pa 'jig rten gsum snang la sogs pa'i phyag rgya 'od zer dkar por 'phrog 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs brgya 'joms pa bye brag tu phye ba bri /
translated: Outside of that, one should draw a twelve-spoked wheel, the mudra of the Illumination of the Three Worlds, radiating white light rays, destroying the one hundred families of desire, and so on, in particular.

original: rgyal po bzhi'i phyag mtshan @284b phyogs skyong rnams kyi phyag mtshan phyogs phyogs su bri /
analyzed: rgyal po bzhi'i phyag mtshan @284b phyogs skyong rnams kyi phyag mtshan phyogs phyogs su bri /
translated: The hand implements of the four kings and the hand implements of the directional protectors should be drawn in the directions.

original: lha chen po khyab 'jug la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag mtshan dkyil 'khor lta bur bri /
analyzed: lha chen po khyab 'jug la sogs pa rnams kyi phyag mtshan dkyil 'khor lta bur bri /
translated: The hand implements of the great gods, Viṣṇu, and so on, should be drawn in the maṇḍala.

original: dri zhim pa'i chus bkang ba'i mdog dkar po'i ras kyis dkris pa'i bum pa brgyad gzhag /
analyzed: dri zhim pa'i chus bkang ba'i mdog dkar po'i ras kyis dkris pa'i bum pa brgyad gzhag /
translated: Place eight vases filled with fragrant water and wrapped in white cloth.🔽Place sacrificial cakes of boiled rice, yogurt, butter, and the three white foods, as well as incense, butter lamps, and flowers.

original: 'bras chan dang zho dang mar dang dkar gsum gyi gtor ma dang / lha bshos dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang me tog rnams kyang gzhag / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bla re dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang rnga ma la sogs pa gzhag /
analyzed: 'bras chan dang zho dang mar dang dkar gsum gyi gtor ma dang / lha bshos dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang me tog rnams kyang gzhag / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir bla re dang / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang rnga ma la sogs pa gzhag /
translated: For the sake of making offerings, place canopies, parasols, victory banners, and yak-tail fans.

original: na ma re re ga pur dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po tsandan la sogs pa'i byug pas byugs kha shar du bltas te sbyin sreg bya /
analyzed: na ma re re ga pur dang bcas pa'i dri zhim po tsandan la sogs pa'i byug pas byugs kha shar du bltas te sbyin sreg bya /
translated: Anoint each one with fragrant ointments of sandalwood and so forth mixed with camphor, and make the fire offering while facing east.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyil krung ngam sems dpa'i skyil krung gis gdan la 'dug / gzhan yang gos la sogs pa dkar po dang / phreng ba dkar pos brgyan /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyil krung ngam sems dpa'i skyil krung gis gdan la 'dug / gzhan yang gos la sogs pa dkar po dang / phreng ba dkar pos brgyan /
translated: Sit on a seat in the tathāgata’s cross-legged posture or the bodhisattva’s cross-legged posture.

original: sreg pa'i rdzas bstan pa ni mar me dan sprad rtsi dang / 'o ma dang / nas kyi thug pa dang / til mar dang / til nyid dang / yungs kar dang / 'bras yos dang / 'bras chan dang / nas dan gro dang / me tog dri zhim pa rnams ga bur dang bsres pa tsandan dkar pos bsgos pa gzhag go //
analyzed: sreg pa'i rdzas bstan pa ni mar me dan sprad rtsi dang / 'o ma dang / nas kyi thug pa dang / til mar dang / til nyid dang / yungs kar dang / 'bras yos dang / 'bras chan dang / nas dan gro dang / me tog dri zhim pa rnams ga bur dang bsres pa tsandan dkar pos bsgos pa gzhag go //
translated: The substances for the burnt offering are: a lamp, clarified butter, milk, barley gruel, sesame oil, sesame seeds, white mustard seeds, parched grains, cooked rice, barley, wheat, and fragrant flowers mixed with camphor and anointed with white sandalwood.

original: yam shing dang bud shing ni 'dab ma brgyad pa me tog dang 'bras bu yod cing zho dang ldan pa'i yam shing la khung bu'i khyad par gyi sor gyis gzhal zhing /
analyzed: yam shing dang bud shing ni 'dab ma brgyad pa me tog dang 'bras bu yod cing zho dang ldan pa'i yam shing la khung bu'i khyad par gyi sor gyis gzhal zhing /
translated: The kindling wood and fuel are eight-petaled flowers with fruits, and kindling wood with curds, measured by finger-widths.

original: mchog sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi yan chad /
analyzed: mchog sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi yan chad /
translated: The best is twenty-four finger-widths,

original: sor bcu drug thab khung bar ma la /
analyzed: sor bcu drug thab khung bar ma la /
translated: sixteen finger-widths for the medium hearth,

original: bcu gnyis dang brgyad tha ma la /
analyzed: bcu gnyis dang brgyad tha ma la /
translated: and twelve or eight finger-widths for the small hearth.

original: gzhan yang bud shing zho dang ldan pa la dri'i chus bskus te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bud shing zho dang ldan pa la dri'i chus bskus te /
translated: Moreover, the fuel with curds is anointed with scented water.

original: bud shing de la rgyun gzhag la sogs pa'i me bcug ste /
analyzed: bud shing de la rgyun gzhag la sogs pa'i me bcug ste /
translated: That fuel is placed in the hearth, and so on, and the fire is ignited.

original: dzva la dzva la h'um zhes pas rlung yab kyis sbar nas /🔽dri'i chus bsang gtor byas te /
analyzed: dzva la dzva la h'um zhes pas rlung yab kyis sbar nas / dri'i chus bsang gtor byas te /
translated: With jvala jvala hūṃ, one fans [the fire] with a yak-tail fan.

original: de nas me lha bskyed pa ni kha dog dkar po phyag g-yas gnyis na padma dang nor bu /
analyzed: de nas me lha bskyed pa ni kha dog dkar po phyag g-yas gnyis na padma dang nor bu /
translated: One sprinkles it with scented water, and then generates the fire god: White in color, in his two right hands he holds a lotus and a gem.

original: phyag g-yon gnyis na ril ba dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gnyis na ril ba dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
translated: In his two left hands he holds a water vessel and a staff.

original: padma dkar po'i gdan gyi steng du de lta bu'i me lha bkug nas mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma dkar po'i gdan gyi steng du de lta bu'i me lha bkug nas mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having invoked the fire god in that way upon a seat of a white lotus, one should offer him a welcome offering.

original: sbyin sreg gi tshe na khyad par mchod pa'i lha kha dog dkar po 'gro ba la phan pa'i khro bo rdo rje sems dpa' padma dkar po la shar phyogs su bsams te /
analyzed: sbyin sreg gi tshe na khyad par mchod pa'i lha kha dog dkar po 'gro ba la phan pa'i khro bo rdo rje sems dpa' padma dkar po la shar phyogs su bsams te /
translated: At the time of the fire offering, one visualizes the special offering deity, white in color, the wrathful one who benefits beings, Vajrasattva, on a white lotus in the east, and invites him there.

original: de'i thog tu spyan drangs nas gzhag par bya'o //🔽de'i mdun du bsgrub @285a * //
analyzed: de'i thog tu spyan drangs nas gzhag par bya'o // de'i mdun du bsgrub @285a * //
translated: Having invoked him there, one should place him there.

original: par bya ba'i lus bzhag ste khro bo'i 'od zer gyis nyes pa drangs nas phyi rol du dor bar bsam mo //
analyzed: par bya ba'i lus bzhag ste khro bo'i 'od zer gyis nyes pa drangs nas phyi rol du dor bar bsam mo //
translated: In front of him, one places the body of the one to be accomplished, and having drawn out their faults with the light rays of the wrathful one, one imagines that they are expelled outside.

original: mchod pa'i dus su nang par snga bar khrus byas lus dris byug /'od zer bdud rtsi lta bur bsam zhing sbyin sreg bya ste dam tshig de ni 'da' bar mi bya ba kha na'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i dus su nang par snga bar khrus byas lus dris byug /'od zer bdud rtsi lta bur bsam zhing sbyin sreg bya ste dam tshig de ni 'da' bar mi bya ba kha na'o //
translated: At the time of the offering, having bathed early in the morning and anointed the body, one should make the burnt offering, imagining the light rays as nectar. That samaya should not be transgressed.

original: de nas mchod pa'i rim pa ni /
analyzed: de nas mchod pa'i rim pa ni /
translated: Next, the sequence of the offering is as follows:

original: sha chen la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang por me lha la phul /
analyzed: sha chen la sogs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang por me lha la phul /
translated: First, offer the five nectars, such as human flesh, to the fire god.

original: de nas shar phyogs na bzhugs pa'i khro bo de'i thugs kar spyan drangs la dbul /
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs na bzhugs pa'i khro bo de'i thugs kar spyan drangs la dbul /
translated: Then, having invited [the deities] into the heart of the wrathful one who resides in the east, offer [the torma].

original: de yang bsreg bya gsum du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bsreg bya gsum du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should offer it three times.

original: de nas de'i lus su sangs rgyas dkon mchog gsum spyan drangs la /
analyzed: de nas de'i lus su sangs rgyas dkon mchog gsum spyan drangs la /
translated: Then, having invited the Three Jewels, the Buddha Jewel, into one’s body,

original: dkon mchog gsum du dmigs la yang lan gsum du dbul /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum du dmigs la yang lan gsum du dbul /
translated: visualize the Three Jewels and offer [the torma] three times.

original: gshegs su gsol te yang me lha la dbul /
analyzed: gshegs su gsol te yang me lha la dbul /
translated: Having requested [the deities] to depart, offer [the torma] to the fire god.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams spyan drangs te rdo rje sems dpa' la dbul /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams spyan drangs te rdo rje sems dpa' la dbul /
translated: Then, having invited the maṇḍala deities, offer [the torma] to Vajrasattva.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha re re la dbul /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha re re la dbul /
translated: Then, offer [the torma] to each of the maṇḍala deities.

original: de nas bgegs la sogs pa thams cad la dbul /
analyzed: de nas bgegs la sogs pa thams cad la dbul /
translated: Then, offer [the torma] to all obstructors and so on.

original: yang gshegs su gsol te rang gi lhag pa'i lha la dbul /
analyzed: yang gshegs su gsol te rang gi lhag pa'i lha la dbul /
translated: Again, requesting them to depart, offer them to one's own special deity.

original: de nas dang por khro bo'i sngags kyis btab nas sbyin sreg byas te rdzas thams cad gcig tu bsres nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis btab ste /
analyzed: de nas dang por khro bo'i sngags kyis btab nas sbyin sreg byas te rdzas thams cad gcig tu bsres nas bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i sngags kyis btab ste /
translated: Then, first, having performed the burnt offering with the mantra of the wrathful one, having mixed all the substances into one, having performed the burnt offering with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali,

original: sbyin sreg kun byas pa'i 'og tu brgya stong ngam brgya rtsa brgyad dam khro bo spyan drangs pa la phul la 'od zer 'byung bas bsgrub par bya ba dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: sbyin sreg kun byas pa'i 'og tu brgya stong ngam brgya rtsa brgyad dam khro bo spyan drangs pa la phul la 'od zer 'byung bas bsgrub par bya ba dbang bskur zhing /
translated: after all the burnt offerings, offer it to the invited wrathful one, one hundred thousand, one hundred and eight, or more.

original: ham gi go chas bsrung /
analyzed: ham gi go chas bsrung /
translated: Having protected with the armor of HŪṂ,

original: mjug tu lha thams cad la mchod pa brgyad la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: mjug tu lha thams cad la mchod pa brgyad la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: in conclusion, having made offerings to all the deities with the eight offerings,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya gyen du bkrol te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya gyen du bkrol te /
translated: unravel the mudra of Vajrasattva upward.

original: aom badzra mu: zhes bya bas gshegs su gsol lo //
analyzed: aom badzra mu: zhes bya bas gshegs su gsol lo //
translated: With OṂ Vajra MUḤ, request them to depart.

original: 'dis ni zhi ba'i las 'grub pa la the tshom med do //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhi ba'i las 'grub pa la the tshom med do //
translated: By this, there is no doubt that the activity of pacification is accomplished.

original: ci ste sdig pa can nam ting nge 'dzin dang mi ldan nas dngos grub mi thob na /
analyzed: ci ste sdig pa can nam ting nge 'dzin dang mi ldan nas dngos grub mi thob na /
translated: If one who is sinful or who is not endowed with meditative stabilization does not attain power,

original: dang po stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
analyzed: dang po stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
translated: First, one should meditate on emptiness.

original: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas nas gdon mi za bar dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas snga ma bzhin du thams cad byas nas gdon mi za bar dngos grub tu 'gyur te /
translated: Then, having done everything as before, one will certainly attain power.

original: zhi ba'i las 'di tsam gyis mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba'i las 'di tsam gyis mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this much is the culmination of the rite of pacification.

original: de nas rgyas pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nas rgyas pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Next, the teaching on the extensive [rite] is

original: 'bras bur ldan na ma nags tshal lam //
analyzed: 'bras bur ldan na ma nags tshal lam //
translated: if one has a fruit, a forest grove,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'bras bur ldan pa'am nags tshal lam gnas sam rgyal po dang rje'u rigs kyi khyim du rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems @285b kyis bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur ldan pa'am nags tshal lam gnas sam rgyal po dang rje'u rigs kyi khyim du rgyas pa la dga' ba'i sems @285b kyis bya ste /
translated: One should perform the rite with a joyful mind in a place endowed with fruit, a forest grove, a dwelling, or the house of a king or warrior-noble,

original: thab khung chung du khru do //
analyzed: thab khung chung du khru do //
translated: in a hearth that is small, two cubits,

original: bar ma khru bzhi pa /
analyzed: bar ma khru bzhi pa /
translated: medium, four cubits,

original: mchog khru brgyad pa gang yang rung ba cig tu byas pa'i las bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mchog khru brgyad pa gang yang rung ba cig tu byas pa'i las bya ba yin no //
translated: or supreme, eight cubits, whichever is appropriate.

original: gzhan yang stegs bu dan phyag rgya bstan pa ni thab khung las stegs bu dpag pas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang stegs bu dan phyag rgya bstan pa ni thab khung las stegs bu dpag pas shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the teaching on the altar and the mudrā is to be understood by measuring the altar from the hearth.

original: thab khung khru do la stegs bu khru brgyad /
analyzed: thab khung khru do la stegs bu khru brgyad /
translated: For a hearth of two cubits, the altar is eight cubits.

original: thab khung khru bzhi la stegs bu khru bcu gnyis /
analyzed: thab khung khru bzhi la stegs bu khru bcu gnyis /
translated: The hearth should be four cubits, and the platform twelve cubits.

original: thab khung khru brgyad la stegs bu khru bcu drug ga ma nyi shu rtsa bzhir bya'o //
analyzed: thab khung khru brgyad la stegs bu khru bcu drug ga ma nyi shu rtsa bzhir bya'o //
translated: The hearth should be eight cubits, and the platform sixteen or twenty-four cubits.

original: thab khung khru do la mu khyud sor brgyad /
analyzed: thab khung khru do la mu khyud sor brgyad /
translated: The hearth should be two cubits, and the rim eight finger-widths.

original: thab khung khru bzhi la mu khyud sor bcu drug /
analyzed: thab khung khru bzhi la mu khyud sor bcu drug /
translated: The hearth should be four cubits, and the rim sixteen finger-widths.

original: thab khang khru brgyad la mu khyad sor sum cu rtsa gnyis su bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thab khang khru brgyad la mu khyad sor sum cu rtsa gnyis su bya ba yin no //
translated: The hearth should be eight cubits, and the rim thirty-two finger-widths.

original: de'i phyi rol du padma sna tshogs pas brgyan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du padma sna tshogs pas brgyan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Outside of that, it should be adorned with various lotuses.

original: de'i dbus su rin po che dang padma sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su rin po che dang padma sna tshogs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In the center of that, various jewels and lotuses should be placed.

original: de'i dbus su thab brko ba ni zabs su rgya'i phyed kyi tshad gru bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: de'i dbus su thab brko ba ni zabs su rgya'i phyed kyi tshad gru bzhi pa'am /
translated: In the center of that, the hearth should be dug, half a cubit deep, square,

original: khru brgyad gang yang rung bar bya'o //
analyzed: khru brgyad gang yang rung bar bya'o //
translated: or eight cubits, whichever is appropriate.

original: 'jim pa ser pos bskus shing gur kum la sogs pas byugs nas tshon ser pos bskus te gser 'od dang 'dra bar bsam zhing bya'o //
analyzed: 'jim pa ser pos bskus shing gur kum la sogs pas byugs nas tshon ser pos bskus te gser 'od dang 'dra bar bsam zhing bya'o //
translated: Having smeared it with yellow clay and anointed it with saffron, etc., it should be smeared with yellow dye, and one should imagine it to be like the golden light.

original: de nas tshon dmar ser gyis rin po che dang / padma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor 'khor yug nyid du gnas pa bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas tshon dmar ser gyis rin po che dang / padma la sogs pa phyag rgya'i dkyil 'khor 'khor yug nyid du gnas pa bri bar bya ste /
translated: Then, with red and yellow colors, one should draw the maṇḍala of the mudrā such as the jewel, lotus, and so on, in the surrounding area.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gnyis sam /🔽thab khung dang mu khyud dang nang gi dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor te bzhi'am nang gi 'khor yug dang mu khyud dang 'khor lo dang lha'i gnas dan mu ran dkar po'i nang dan phyi rol dang 'gro ris kyi gnas dan /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gnyis sam / thab khung dang mu khyud dang nang gi dkyil 'khor dang phyi'i dkyil 'khor te bzhi'am nang gi 'khor yug dang mu khyud dang 'khor lo dang lha'i gnas dan mu ran dkar po'i nang dan phyi rol dang 'gro ris kyi gnas dan /
translated: The inner maṇḍala and the outer maṇḍala are two layers.

original: yang na rim pa brgyad dang ldan par bri'o //
analyzed: yang na rim pa brgyad dang ldan par bri'o //
translated: Or, the hearth, the enclosure, the inner maṇḍala, and the outer maṇḍala are four; or the inner surrounding area, the enclosure, the maṇḍala, the abode of the deities, and the white edge are five; or the inner surrounding area, the enclosure, the maṇḍala, the abode of the deities, the white edge, the outer area, and the abode of the castes are seven; or the inner surrounding area, the enclosure, the maṇḍala, the abode of the deities, the white edge, the outer area, the abode of the castes, and the abode of the planets are eight.

original: sgo ba nyid kyang phyag rgya'i gzugs su bri'o //
analyzed: sgo ba nyid kyang phyag rgya'i gzugs su bri'o //
translated: One should draw the gatekeepers in the form of mudrās.

original: bum pa kha dog ser po dri chus bkang ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: bum pa kha dog ser po dri chus bkang ba brgyad dam /
translated: There are eight vases filled with scented water,

original: bcu gnyis sam /
analyzed: bcu gnyis sam /
translated: twelve,

original: bcu drug gam /
analyzed: bcu drug gam /
translated: sixteen,

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis te bkra shis pa'i dar ser pos dkri /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis te bkra shis pa'i dar ser pos dkri /
translated: or thirty-two, wrapped in yellow auspicious silk.

original: kha rgyan yal ga dang me tog can dri zhim po'i me tog dang bdug pa dang phreng ba dang mar me dang rgyan rnams dan rgyal mtshan dan 'phan dag bla re dang gdugs rnams ser so brgyan pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha rgyan yal ga dang me tog can dri zhim po'i me tog dang bdug pa dang phreng ba dang mar me dang rgyan rnams dan rgyal mtshan dan 'phan dag bla re dang gdugs rnams ser so brgyan pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place the ornaments, namely, garlands, parasols, banners, flags, streamers, canopies, and lamps, which are fragrant with sweet-smelling flowers, incense, and garlands, and are yellow.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor bstan pa ni bdag nyid gos dang rgyan dang me tog la sogs pa ser pos brgyan /
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor bstan pa ni bdag nyid gos dang rgyan dang me tog la sogs pa ser pos brgyan /
translated: The teaching of the deity yoga is that one should adorn oneself with yellow clothes, ornaments, flowers, and so on,

original: byang phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug nas khro bo rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byed cing zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang phyogs su kha bltas te 'dug nas khro bo rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor byed cing zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and sitting facing north, one should perform the yoga of wrathful Vajrasattva.

original: gzhan yang de nyid kyi tshe na mchod pa'i lha byang phyogs su nam mkha' @286a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid kyi tshe na mchod pa'i lha byang phyogs su nam mkha' @286a * //
translated: Moreover, at that time, the offering deities are in the north, in the sky

original: la lha'i bu yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan mdog ser po 'dra ba dang / lha'i bu dang nyi ma dang zla ba dang ku be ra dang nor sbyin dang / dzambha la kun kyang 'od zer gser lta bu 'bebs shing yid kyi dgos pa skong bar mdzad pa 'od zer chu yis dbang bskur bar bsam mo /
analyzed: la lha'i bu yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan mdog ser po 'dra ba dang / lha'i bu dang nyi ma dang zla ba dang ku be ra dang nor sbyin dang / dzambha la kun kyang 'od zer gser lta bu 'bebs shing yid kyi dgos pa skong bar mdzad pa 'od zer chu yis dbang bskur bar bsam mo /
translated: The divine sons Cintāmaṇicchatra, Cintāmaṇidhvaja, who is like the color of yellow, the divine sons Sūrya, Candra, Kubera, Vasudatta, and Jambhala all rain down golden light rays and fulfill mental needs.

original: de nas dbang thob nas lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dbang thob nas lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having obtained empowerment, the body will expand.

original: yang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir de'i ming dang gung gung zhes bya ba rtsa brgyad dang stong phrag brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: yang rgyas par bya ba'i phyir de'i ming dang gung gung zhes bya ba rtsa brgyad dang stong phrag brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: Again, in order to expand, one should repeat the name and “gung gung” eight times and one hundred and eight thousand times.

original: de nas sbyin sreg bya ba ni byang phyogs su seng ge'i stan gyi thog na rin po che'i khri /
analyzed: de nas sbyin sreg bya ba ni byang phyogs su seng ge'i stan gyi thog na rin po che'i khri /
translated: Then, the homa rite: On the northern side, on top of a lion seat, a jeweled throne,

original: yang na padma dang nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan khri'i steng na rdo rje rin chen dang / rdo rje gzi brjid dang / rdo rje dpal dang / rdo rje bzhad pa dang bzhi rgyan kun gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: yang na padma dang nyi ma dang zla ba'i gdan khri'i steng na rdo rje rin chen dang / rdo rje gzi brjid dang / rdo rje dpal dang / rdo rje bzhad pa dang bzhi rgyan kun gyis brgyan pa /
translated: Or else, on seats of lotus, sun, and moon, are the four vajras: vajraratna, vajratejas, vajraśrī, and vajrahāsa, all adorned with all ornaments.

original: phyag rgya mchog sbyin mdzad pa rin po che'i char dang 'od zer gyi phreng bas bsgrub par bya ba la khyab par bsam mo //
analyzed: phyag rgya mchog sbyin mdzad pa rin po che'i char dang 'od zer gyi phreng bas bsgrub par bya ba la khyab par bsam mo //
translated: They bestow the boon of the supreme seal, and one should imagine that the one to be accomplished is pervaded by a rain of jewels and garlands of light rays.

original: dung dang cang te'u dang pi wang dang / sil snyan dang glu dang gar gyis de rnams mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: dung dang cang te'u dang pi wang dang / sil snyan dang glu dang gar gyis de rnams mchod par bya ste /
translated: One should worship them with conches, hand drums, lutes, cymbals, songs, and dances.

original: de'i 'og tu sbyin sreg gi las brtsam mo /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sbyin sreg gi las brtsam mo /
translated: Then, one should commence the rite of burnt offerings.

original: yam shing dang bung shing bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yam shing dang bung shing bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the sacrificial sticks and kindling:

original: khung bu'i khyad par las yam shing dang bud shing dbye ste mdzub gang ba dang khru gang ba ni chung du yin no //🔽bar ma ni khru do /
analyzed: khung bu'i khyad par las yam shing dang bud shing dbye ste mdzub gang ba dang khru gang ba ni chung du yin no // bar ma ni khru do /
translated: From the distinctions of the holes, the sacrificial sticks and fuel are distinguished. Those one finger or one cubit long are small.🔽The medium ones are four cubits.

original: khru bzhi pa ni mchog go //
analyzed: khru bzhi pa ni mchog go //
translated: The supreme ones are four cubits.

original: me tog dang 'bras bur bcas pa rtse mo sbrang rtsis byug pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bur bcas pa rtse mo sbrang rtsis byug pa yin no //
translated: The flowers and fruits are anointed with honey.

original: bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas 'bru dang me tog dang 'bras bu ser po dang / mar dang sbrang rtsir bsres nas dpal gyi 'bras bu lta bur byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas 'bru dang me tog dang 'bras bu ser po dang / mar dang sbrang rtsir bsres nas dpal gyi 'bras bu lta bur byas pa yin no //
translated: The substances to be burned are grains, flowers, yellow fruits, mixed with ghee and honey, and made into the shape of a glorious fruit.

original: mchod pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mchod pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the stages of worship,

original: me lha kha dog ser po phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: me lha kha dog ser po phyag bzhi pa /
translated: the fire god is yellow, with four arms,

original: phyag mtshan sngar zhib par bshad pa bzhin padmo'i gdan la zhugs pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa spyan drangs te bsreg bya dbul /
analyzed: phyag mtshan sngar zhib par bshad pa bzhin padmo'i gdan la zhugs pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa spyan drangs te bsreg bya dbul /
translated: seated on a lotus seat, adorned with various ornaments, just as the hand implements were explained in detail before.🔽Then, having invited him, the burnt offerings are offered.

original: de nas de nyid 'bar bar bzhugs pa'i lus su khro bo'i rgyal po bcug nas /
analyzed: de nas de nyid 'bar bar bzhugs pa'i lus su khro bo'i rgyal po bcug nas /
translated: Then, having placed the king of wrathful ones into the body of that very blazing one,🔽one should recall the accomplishment as before.

original: sngon bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dran par byed cing sbyin sreg dbul pa ni 'bum ma ma nyis 'bum gyis nges par dngos grub 'grub bo //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba dran par byed cing sbyin sreg dbul pa ni 'bum ma ma nyis 'bum gyis nges par dngos grub 'grub bo //
translated: The burnt offerings are offered, and by one hundred thousand or two hundred thousand, one definitely achieves power.

original: 'bum phrag brgyas ni rgyal srid la dbang ba'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'bum phrag brgyas ni rgyal srid la dbang ba'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'grub bo //
translated: One hundred thousand times the enjoyments of a universal monarch are accomplished.

original: de nas mjug tu 'od zer gyis dbang bskur zhing bsrungs na rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas mjug tu 'od zer gyis dbang bskur zhing bsrungs na rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, at the end, if one is consecrated with light rays and protected, one will expand.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bka' bzhin no zhes @286b bya ba yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bka' bzhin no zhes @286b bya ba yin la /
translated: It is said, “just like the word of the vajra holder.”

original: 'di tsam gyis ni rgyas pa'i las mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dbang ni chags ba'i sems kyis kyang //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni rgyas pa'i las mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to // dbang ni chags ba'i sems kyis kyang //
translated: The meaning is that just this much is the culmination of the activity of expansion.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang gi las ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbang gi las ston te /
translated: “Power is also with a desirous mind” and so on teaches the activity of power.

original: dbang ni chags pa'i sems dang ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang ni chags pa'i sems dang ting nge 'dzin gyis bya ba ste /
translated: Power is the activity of a desirous mind and meditative stabilization.

original: chags pa rdo rje can dang / rdo rje chags pa de las byung zhing khams gsum chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa rdo rje can dang / rdo rje chags pa de las byung zhing khams gsum chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desirous vajra holder and the vajra desire arisen from that cause the three realms to desire.

original: padma'i sems dpa' rtag tu chags pa de bas na dbang du bya ba'i las grub par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: padma'i sems dpa' rtag tu chags pa de bas na dbang du bya ba'i las grub par bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lotus hero is always desirous. Therefore, the activity of power is explained as accomplished. This is the meaning.

original: gnas ji lta bu zhig tu bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ji lta bu zhig tu bya zhe na /
translated: In what kind of place should one perform the activity?

original: chags dang mthun pa'i sa phyogs sam //
analyzed: chags dang mthun pa'i sa phyogs sam //
translated: In a place that is conducive to passion,

original: chags par byed pa'i khyim du shes //
analyzed: chags par byed pa'i khyim du shes //
translated: or in a house that arouses passion.

original: bco blag mkhan nam zla mtshan can dag gi / khyim du chags pa'i las rnams bya ba yin //
analyzed: bco blag mkhan nam zla mtshan can dag gi / khyim du chags pa'i las rnams bya ba yin //
translated: The rites of passion should be performed in the house of a craftsman or a menstruating woman.

original: rdo rje chags pa'i gnas kyang rung //
analyzed: rdo rje chags pa'i gnas kyang rung //
translated: Or in a place of passion of the Vajra,

original: phyag na padmo'i gnas nyid du //
analyzed: phyag na padmo'i gnas nyid du //
translated: or in a place of the Lotus-bearer,

original: rtag tu rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas //
analyzed: rtag tu rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas //
translated: or in a place of Vajrasattva always.🔽In a great place of great bliss,🔽in a pond of lotuses and utpalas,

original: bde chen gyi ni gnas chen dang // padma autpala rdzing bu dang // bandu ka yi me tog gnas //
analyzed: bde chen gyi ni gnas chen dang // padma autpala rdzing bu dang // bandu ka yi me tog gnas //
translated: in a place of bandhuka flowers,

original: me tog 'bras bu dmar tshal ni //
analyzed: me tog 'bras bu dmar tshal ni //
translated: in a grove of red flowers and fruits,

original: yid 'ong sems ni chags byed pa //
analyzed: yid 'ong sems ni chags byed pa //
translated: pleasing and arousing the mind,

original: der ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: that is the place, it is said.🔽The altar and the fire pit are taught:

original: stegs bu dang thab khung bstan pa ni stegs bu khru brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: stegs bu dang thab khung bstan pa ni stegs bu khru brgyad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The altar is eight cubits, etc.

original: stegs bu khru brgyad dam bcu drug pa rnams byas /
analyzed: stegs bu khru brgyad dam bcu drug pa rnams byas /
translated: The altars are made eight or sixteen cubits.

original: de'i dbus su hom khung bya ba ni go rims bzhin du khru do dang / khru bzhi par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su hom khung bya ba ni go rims bzhin du khru do dang / khru bzhi par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, the fire pit is made two or four cubits, respectively.

original: dbyibs ni gzhu dang 'dra ba dang / padma 'dra ba dang / rdo rje 'dra ba dang / mda' 'dra ba dang / zla ba kham pa 'dra ba dang / padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas la zheng du mchu'i phyed kyi tshang zhing gi phyed kyi tshad zabs su brko /
analyzed: dbyibs ni gzhu dang 'dra ba dang / padma 'dra ba dang / rdo rje 'dra ba dang / mda' 'dra ba dang / zla ba kham pa 'dra ba dang / padma'i 'dab ma 'dra bar byas la zheng du mchu'i phyed kyi tshang zhing gi phyed kyi tshad zabs su brko /
translated: The shape is like a bow, like a lotus, like a vajra, like an arrow, like a crescent moon, or like a lotus leaf. Make it one-half the width of the mouth and one-half the size of the field in depth.

original: mu khyud sor bzhi pa dang sor brgyad pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / tha ma dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi khyad par lags so //
analyzed: mu khyud sor bzhi pa dang sor brgyad pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / tha ma dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi khyad par lags so //
translated: The circumference is four fingerbreadths, eight fingerbreadths, twelve fingerbreadths, and the distinctions of the inferior, medium, and superior.

original: yam shing dang bud shing ni so sor nges par bya bzhi ba'i skabs su gsungs pa ltar byas la /
analyzed: yam shing dang bud shing ni so sor nges par bya bzhi ba'i skabs su gsungs pa ltar byas la /
translated: The firewood and kindling are to be done according to the individual determinations taught in the section on the four.

original: shin tu dmar ba'i tsandan dang / btsag dang / rgya skyegs dang / le brgan rtsi dang / gur kum dang bcas pas bud shing dang yam shing la bsku'o //
analyzed: shin tu dmar ba'i tsandan dang / btsag dang / rgya skyegs dang / le brgan rtsi dang / gur kum dang bcas pas bud shing dang yam shing la bsku'o //
translated: Smear the firewood and kindling with very red sandalwood, madder, lac, vermilion, and saffron.

original: gzhan yang rdzas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rdzas bstan pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the substances that are taught are:

original: yungs 'bru dmar po dang / btsag dang / mtshal dang / zangs kyi phye ma dang / yungs kar @287a * //
analyzed: yungs 'bru dmar po dang / btsag dang / mtshal dang / zangs kyi phye ma dang / yungs kar @287a * //
translated: red mustard seed, lac, madder, copper filings, white mustard seed,🔽white mustard seed, asafoetida, salt, sesame seed, fragrant sesame seed,

original: dang ske tse dang / lan tshva dang til dang zhim thig le'i 'bru dang / la phug dang nyungs rdog dang / khrag dang rdul chen po dang bcas pa kun bsres par bya ba'i phyir bsdus nas btsag la sogs pas bskus nas /
analyzed: dang ske tse dang / lan tshva dang til dang zhim thig le'i 'bru dang / la phug dang nyungs rdog dang / khrag dang rdul chen po dang bcas pa kun bsres par bya ba'i phyir bsdus nas btsag la sogs pas bskus nas /
translated: chili pepper, white mustard seed, blood, and great dust, all mixed together,

original: khro bo'i sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: khro bo'i sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: consecrated with the mantra of the wrathful one,

original: ba dang ra las bzhos pa'i bsrubs ma thag pa'i mar sar dang / mar dang til mar rnams ga bur la sogs pas bskus nas bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i sngags kyis btab ste gzhag go //
analyzed: ba dang ra las bzhos pa'i bsrubs ma thag pa'i mar sar dang / mar dang til mar rnams ga bur la sogs pas bskus nas bdud rtsi 'khyil ba'i sngags kyis btab ste gzhag go //
translated: and the fresh butter from a cow or a goat, butter, and sesame oil, anointed with camphor, etc., consecrated with the mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali, should be placed.

original: de nas hom khung dmar por bsams nas spos dmar po la sogs pas byug cing bsku bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas hom khung dmar por bsams nas spos dmar po la sogs pas byug cing bsku bar bya'o //
translated: Then, imagining the fire pit as red, it should be anointed with red incense, etc.

original: gzhan yang thab khung dang phyag rgya bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang thab khung dang phyag rgya bstan pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, the teaching on the fire pit and the mudrā is as follows:

original: gur kum gyis bsres pa'i tshon gyis hom khung gi nang du padma bri /
analyzed: gur kum gyis bsres pa'i tshon gyis hom khung gi nang du padma bri /
translated: In the interior of the fire pit, draw a lotus with dye mixed with saffron.

original: de'i lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bri /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bri /
translated: In its center, draw an arrow and a bow.

original: de'i dbus su rdo rje bri /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rdo rje bri /
translated: In the middle of that, draw a vajra.

original: nang gi 'khor yug tu padma bri /
analyzed: nang gi 'khor yug tu padma bri /
translated: On the inner circumference, draw a lotus.

original: mu khyud la mda' dang gzhu bri /
analyzed: mu khyud la mda' dang gzhu bri /
translated: On the rim, draw arrows and a bow.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi 'khor yug la padma nyid mda' dang bcas pa bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi 'khor yug la padma nyid mda' dang bcas pa bri /
translated: On the outer circumference of that, draw lotuses with arrows.

original: de'i phyi rol 'khor lo'i rtsibs la dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang mnga' gzhu dang gsum shar gyi rtsibs la /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol 'khor lo'i rtsibs la dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang mnga' gzhu dang gsum shar gyi rtsibs la /
translated: On the spokes of the wheel outside of that, beginning from the northeast, draw a vajra, a hook, and a bow and arrow on the eastern spoke,

original: lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la rin chen dang rgyal mtshan dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bri /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la rin chen dang rgyal mtshan dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bri /
translated: on the southern spoke, a jewel, a victory banner, and a sun maṇḍala,

original: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la padma dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo bri //
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi rtsibs la padma dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo bri //
translated: on the western spoke, a lotus, a sword, and a wheel,

original: byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la sna tshogs rdo rje dang mche ba dang / go cha'i mchog rnams bri'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi rtsibs la sna tshogs rdo rje dang mche ba dang / go cha'i mchog rnams bri'o //
translated: and on the northern spoke, a crossed vajra, a tusk, and the supreme armor.

original: grva rnams su spos la sogs pa phyag rgya'i gzugs bri /
analyzed: grva rnams su spos la sogs pa phyag rgya'i gzugs bri /
translated: In the corners, draw the forms of the mudras of incense and so on.

original: de nas me tog la sogs thams cad kyis snga ma bzhin du mchod do //
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs thams cad kyis snga ma bzhin du mchod do //
translated: Then, with all the flowers and so forth, one should worship as before.

original: gos dang phreng ba dmar po dang dmar po'i dris bskus nas dmar thag ma chad bar du las brtsams te bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gos dang phreng ba dmar po dang dmar po'i dris bskus nas dmar thag ma chad bar du las brtsams te bya ba yin no //
translated: Having anointed oneself with red garments, red garlands, and red scents, one should commence the rite before the red fortnight.

original: khyad par dbang la byin gyis brlabs /🔽padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: khyad par dbang la byin gyis brlabs / padma dmar po'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: In particular, one should consecrate the empowerment.

original: rab chags phyag na padma bsnams //
analyzed: rab chags phyag na padma bsnams //
translated: One should visualize the two wrathful ones, Yamântaka and Padmantakrî, on the seat of a red lotus.🔽One should visualize Avalokita, Padmadhara, in the western part of the lotus,🔽holding a lotus in his hand,

original: g-yon du rdo rje chags pa la //
analyzed: g-yon du rdo rje chags pa la //
translated: and to the left of him, Vajrârâga,

original: g-yas su bde ba chen po ste //
analyzed: g-yas su bde ba chen po ste //
translated: and to the right of him, Mahasukha.

original: bsams nas de yi dbus su ni //
analyzed: bsams nas de yi dbus su ni //
translated: Having visualized them, one should place in the middle of them

original: chu srin rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa gzhag rdo rje gzhu dang g-yon 'gying ma //
analyzed: chu srin rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa gzhag rdo rje gzhu dang g-yon 'gying ma //
translated: the one holding the crocodile banner,🔽adorned with red flowers,

original: me tog dmar brgyan rab dgyes ma //
analyzed: me tog dmar brgyan rab dgyes ma //
translated: and very pleased.

original: zhes bya ba la nub kyi padma'i cha la rab chags phyag na padma bsnams pa'i spyan ras gzigs bri /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nub kyi padma'i cha la rab chags phyag na padma bsnams pa'i spyan ras gzigs bri /
translated: One should draw Avalokita, Padmadhara, in the western part of the lotus, holding a lotus in his hand.

original: g-yon du rdo rje chags pa /
analyzed: g-yon du rdo rje chags pa /
translated: To the left of him, one should draw Vajrârâga,

original: g-yas par bde ba chen po yid kyis bri zhing bsams nas /
analyzed: g-yas par bde ba chen po yid kyis bri zhing bsams nas /
translated: and to the right of him, Mahasukha.

original: lte ba la @287b chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan ma dang / lha mo rdo rje glu dang / lha mo rdo rje g-yon 'gying ma dang rab dgyes ma dang bcas pa bsam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lte ba la @287b chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan ma dang / lha mo rdo rje glu dang / lha mo rdo rje g-yon 'gying ma dang rab dgyes ma dang bcas pa bsam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At the navel, one should imagine the sea-monster banner-mark, the goddess Vajra Song, the goddess Vajra Left-Arm Swinging, and the goddess Supreme Joy.

original: dri la sogs pas rab mchod de //🔽zhes bya ba la snga ma bzhin du glu dang rol mos mchod nas /
analyzed: dri la sogs pas rab mchod de // zhes bya ba la snga ma bzhin du glu dang rol mos mchod nas /
translated: Having worshipped with scent and so forth,

original: badzra satva h'um ho h'um zhes bya ba zlos shing dbang du byas pa'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: badzra satva h'um ho h'um zhes bya ba zlos shing dbang du byas pa'i phyir brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite means that, having worshipped with song and music as before, one should recite vajrasattva hūṃ hoḥ hūṃ in order to bring [Vajra]Jvālamukha under one's power.

original: mchod pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mchod pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the sequence of worship,

original: mda' dang gzhu thogs de bzhin du //
analyzed: mda' dang gzhu thogs de bzhin du //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, holding a bow and arrow, likewise,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: and so forth.

original: 'dir me lha phyag gnyis na mda' gzhu thogs pa phyag gnyis na padma dmar po dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
analyzed: 'dir me lha phyag gnyis na mda' gzhu thogs pa phyag gnyis na padma dmar po dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
translated: Here, the fire god holds a bow and arrow in two hands, and a red lotus and club in two hands.

original: de lta bu'i me lha bcug nas dang por mchod de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i me lha bcug nas dang por mchod de /
translated: Having inserted such a fire god, one should first worship.

original: de'i lus su khro bo'i rgyal po bcug ste mchod /
analyzed: de'i lus su khro bo'i rgyal po bcug ste mchod /
translated: Having inserted the king of wrathful ones into his body, one should worship.

original: 'od zer dmar po byung nas de las lcags kyu dang zhags pas bsgrub par bya ba bkug cing bcings la spyi bo zhabs drung du bzhag par bsam /
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po byung nas de las lcags kyu dang zhags pas bsgrub par bya ba bkug cing bcings la spyi bo zhabs drung du bzhag par bsam /
translated: Red light rays come from that, and hooks and lassos from that summon the object of practice and bind him or her, and place him or her at one’s feet.

original: de ltar bsams na lha yang dbang du 'gyur na mi dang mi min lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de ltar bsams na lha yang dbang du 'gyur na mi dang mi min lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If one thinks in that way, even the gods come under one’s control, so what need is there to mention humans and non-humans?

original: las zin par gyur pa dang chags pa'i sems su bcas nas spyi bo nas 'od zer gyis dbang bskur zhing ham gi go chas bsrung bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: las zin par gyur pa dang chags pa'i sems su bcas nas spyi bo nas 'od zer gyis dbang bskur zhing ham gi go chas bsrung bar bya ba ste /
translated: When the rite is completed, one should be in a state of passion, and the empowerment is conferred by light rays from the crown. One should be protected by the armor of haṃ.

original: rdo rje chos kyi rnal 'byor gyis lha rnams mchod de /
analyzed: rdo rje chos kyi rnal 'byor gyis lha rnams mchod de /
translated: One should worship the deities with the yoga of Vajradharma.

original: dam tshig phyag rgya gyen du bkrol la gshegs su gsol la rdo rje srung bas bsrungs te ;
analyzed: dam tshig phyag rgya gyen du bkrol la gshegs su gsol la rdo rje srung bas bsrungs te ;
translated: One should release the pledge seal upward and request them to depart. One should be protected by the Vajra protection.

original: rdo rje 'dod pa ham zhes bya ba bzlas nas langs la ci bder gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dod pa ham zhes bya ba bzlas nas langs la ci bder gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should rise, reciting the Vajra desire mantra, haṃ, and remain as is comfortable.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dbang gi las mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dbang gi las mthar thug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this much is the culmination of the rite of enthrallment.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la yang thog mar mchod pa rnams kyis mchod de bstod nas /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la yang thog mar mchod pa rnams kyis mchod de bstod nas /
translated: Also, for all the maṇḍalas of the contemplations, first make offerings with the offerings, and praise.

original: phyag rgya bkrol te gshegs su gsol ba ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya bkrol te gshegs su gsol ba ni /
translated: Then, releasing the seals, request their departure.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pas /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston pas /
translated: This is taught by “Then,” and so forth.

original: de nas brgya byin la sogs lhas //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin la sogs lhas //
translated: Then, the gods such as Śakra

original: yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal te //🔽rin chen gdugs la sogs mchog gi //
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal te // rin chen gdugs la sogs mchog gi //
translated: again and again pay homage,

original: mchod pa sna tshogs byas nas kyang //
analyzed: mchod pa sna tshogs byas nas kyang //
translated: and having made various offerings

original: phyag na rdo rje rgyal dbang la //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje rgyal dbang la //
translated: with the supreme such as the jeweled parasol,

original: dga' ba'i sems kyis stod par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba'i sems kyis stod par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: they praise with a joyful mind🔽the mighty one, Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad pa ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bar ma chad pa ste /
translated: “Then” means without a break,

original: khro bo rdo rje 'dzin pas rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma dbang gi las la thug gi bar bshad pa'i rjes thogs la'o //🔽brgya byin la sogs lha zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khro bo rdo rje 'dzin pas rgyud phyi ma'i phyi ma dbang gi las la thug gi bar bshad pa'i rjes thogs la'o // brgya byin la sogs lha zhes bya ba ni /
translated: immediately after the wrathful Vajradhara explained the continuation of the continuation tantra up to the activity of empowerment.🔽“The gods such as Śakra”

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs @288a * //
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs @288a * //
translated: means the gods such as Śakra and Brahmā

original: pa dkyil 'khor du bkod pa'i lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa dkyil 'khor du bkod pa'i lha rnams kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: who are arranged in the maṇḍala.

original: yang dang yang du phyag byas shing rin po che'i gdugs la sogs pas mchod pa ni mchod par byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du phyag byas shing rin po che'i gdugs la sogs pas mchod pa ni mchod par byas pa'o //
translated: Having bowed again and again, and having worshipped with jeweled parasols and so forth, he worshipped.

original: de yang gsang sngags kyi spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba la sogs pa rdzogs nas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas bstod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang gsang sngags kyi spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba la sogs pa rdzogs nas mchod pa sngon du 'gro bas bstod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is to say, those who desire to practice the mantra conduct, having completed the mandala activities and so forth, with worship as a prerequisite, they praise, is the meaning.

original: phyag na rdo rje rgyal dbang la //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje rgyal dbang la //
translated: To Vajrapani, the Lord of the Victorious Ones,

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dgu'i bdag po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba dang khro bo la zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dgu'i bdag po'i rdo rje 'dzin pa zhi ba dang khro bo la zhes ston to //
translated: he teaches that the Vajra Holder, the master of the nine mandalas, is peaceful and wrathful.

original: dga' ba'i sems kyis stod par byed //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sems kyis stod par byed //
translated: With a joyful mind, he praises,

original: ces bya ba ni yid bde ba'i sems kyis 'og nas 'byung ba rnams brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yid bde ba'i sems kyis 'og nas 'byung ba rnams brjod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that with a happy mind, he utters the following, is the meaning.

original: de yang gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor dgu'i skabs su 'dis bstod do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de yang gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor dgu'i skabs su 'dis bstod do zhes ston to //
translated: And that is to say, those who desire to practice the mantra conduct, with this praise, they praise in the context of the nine mandalas, he teaches.

analyzed: bstod pa'i rang gi ngo bo ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the essence of praise is:

translated: Also includes hoisting on the top of a victory banner, making offerings, and so forth.

original: dgos pa ni ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dgos pa ni ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: phyag na rdo rje 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: Will become like Vajrapāṇi.

original: zhes gsungs te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba @290a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba @290a * //
translated: “The Blessed One” and so forth teaches delight and rejoicing.

original: ston to // de yang gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: ston to // de yang gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod par 'dod pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo zhing rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: Moreover, those who wish to practice the conduct of the mantra gateway dedicate their roots of virtue and rejoice.

original: sprul pa'i tshogs lus la bsdus la sprul pa bya ba nas ci bder gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sprul pa'i tshogs lus la bsdus la sprul pa bya ba nas ci bder gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the assembly of emanations is gathered into the body, and the emanations perform their activities, and then they abide as is comfortable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa dang / des byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni sh'akya thub pa dang / des byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa khro bo rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “The Blessed One” means Śākyamuni and those blessed by him, Vajrapāṇi and the wrathful vajra-holders.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / rgyud byi ma dang / phyi ma'i phyi ma'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i rgyud dang / rgyud byi ma dang / phyi ma'i phyi ma'o //
translated: “Having said this” refers to the root tantra, the continuation tantra, and the later continuation tantra.

original: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i 'khor rnams dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming zhes bya ba yang shas che ba ste /
analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i 'khor rnams dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri za dang gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ming zhes bya ba yang shas che ba ste /
translated: The retinue of gods such as Indra and Brahma, and the retinue of gods, humans, demigods, gandharvas, yakshas, rakshasas, and so forth means that the names are mostly the same.

original: rdzu 'phrul la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la brten pa'o //
translated: It is based on miracles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba 'bras bu thob pas mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba 'bras bu thob pas mngon par dga' ste /
translated: It is said, Rejoicing in the Bhagavat's teaching, which means that by attaining the result, one rejoices.

original: rgyud sprul pas bshad pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud sprul pas bshad pa la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: It is rejoicing in the explanation of the emanated tantra.

original: ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i gzi brjid kyi rgyal po'i brtag pa zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ngan song thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i gzi brjid kyi rgyal po'i brtag pa zhes bya ba sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The name Tantra of the King of Splendor Who Completely Purifies All Bad Transmigrations is as explained above.
